original: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can rnams dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la bkod pa pas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di glegs bam klag pa'am /
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can rnams dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la bkod pa pas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di glegs bam klag pa'am /

original: dpe 'dri ba'am /
analyzed: dpe 'dri ba'am /
translated: “Substantial, substantial, O Lord!”

analyzed: kha ton du bye ba'i phyir gzhan la byin pa bsod nams che ba'i phan yon bstan pa ste / de ltar phan yon che ba yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las dus gsum gyi nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis zag pa med pa'i chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la thug gi @2a * //
translated: The benefits of giving to others for recitation are taught.

original: bar la bslabs nas so so'i 'bras bu thob par 'gyur ba rnams rgya cher bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bar la bslabs nas so so'i 'bras bu thob par 'gyur ba rnams rgya cher bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, the great benefits are also taught in this perfection of wisdom, because the śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and bodhisattvas of the three times, having trained in the uncontaminated dharmas from the four establishments of mindfulness up to the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha, will attain their individual results.

original: de la yang dag pa'i skyon med par zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni nyan thos rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa la bya'o //
analyzed: de la yang dag pa'i skyon med par zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni nyan thos rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa la bya'o //
translated: Here, one who has entered into the faultless refers to one who has entered in order to attain the result of stream-entry.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po thob par bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po thob par bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa'o //
translated: “Enters into the faultlessness of the bodhisattva” means that he has entered in order to attain the first bodhisattva stage.

original: koo shi ka sems can gcig cig rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la bzhag na /
analyzed: koo shi ka sems can gcig cig rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la bzhag na /
translated: Kauśika, if one being were to be established in the result of stream enterer,

original: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de'i bsod nams ches mang du 'phel gyi /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de'i bsod nams ches mang du 'phel gyi /
translated: the son of a good family or daughter of a good family would have much more merit

original: 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can rnams dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la bkod pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can rnams dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la bkod pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba nas /
translated: than if the beings of Jambudvīpa were to be established in the ten wholesome actions.

original: koo shi ka rnam grangs des na /
analyzed: koo shi ka rnam grangs des na /
translated: Kauśika, for these reasons

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang mchod cing rim gro bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang mchod cing rim gro bya ba yin te /
translated: it is like this: the bodhisattvas are to be worshipped and served.

original: 'jig rten lha dang bcas pa dang / bdud dang bcas pa dang / tshangs pa dang bcas pa dang / dge sbyong dang bram zer bcas pa'i skye dgus me tog dang / phreng ba dang / spos dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang /
analyzed: 'jig rten lha dang bcas pa dang / bdud dang bcas pa dang / tshangs pa dang bcas pa dang / dge sbyong dang bram zer bcas pa'i skye dgus me tog dang / phreng ba dang / spos dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang /
translated: The world with its gods, Māra, and Brahmā, with its monks and brahmins, should offer flowers, garlands, perfume, ointments,

original: na bza' dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang / sil snyan sna tshogs kyis rim gror bya ba dang / bkur stir bya ba dang / phu dud du bya ba yin par shes par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can rnams dge @2b ba bcu'i las kyi lam la bkod pa bas /
analyzed: na bza' dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang / sil snyan sna tshogs kyis rim gror bya ba dang / bkur stir bya ba dang / phu dud du bya ba yin par shes par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can rnams dge @2b ba bcu'i las kyi lam la bkod pa bas /
translated: Compared to establishing the sentient beings of Jambudvīpa in the ten virtuous actions,🔽it is of greater merit to establish a single sentient being in the result of stream enterer, in the result of once-returner, in the result of non-returner, and in the state of an arhat.

original: sems can gcig rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la bzhag pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid la bkod pa'i bsod nams che ba dang / 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can rnams rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu bzhi la bkod pa bas kyang sems can gcig rang byang chub la bzhag pa bsod nams che ba dang /
analyzed: sems can gcig rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la bzhag pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid la bkod pa'i bsod nams che ba dang / 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can rnams rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu bzhi la bkod pa bas kyang sems can gcig rang byang chub la bzhag pa bsod nams che ba dang /
translated: Compared to establishing the sentient beings of Jambudvīpa in the four results of stream enterer and so forth, it is of greater merit to establish a single sentient being in the state of a pratyekabuddha.

original: 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can thams cad rang byang chub la bkod pa bas kyang /
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can thams cad rang byang chub la bkod pa bas kyang /
translated: It is more beneficial to establish a single sentient being of the desire realm in the state of a solitary realizer than to establish all the sentient beings of Jambudvīpa in the state of a solitary realizer.🔽

original: sems can gcig bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la bzhag pa bsod nams che ba gtan tshigs dang bcas par bstan te /
analyzed: sems can gcig bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la bzhag pa bsod nams che ba gtan tshigs dang bcas par bstan te /
translated: It is taught that it is of greater merit to establish a single sentient being in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening🔽than to establish all sentient beings in the world systems in the ten directions in the solitary realizers’ awakening.

original: de'i gtan tshigs kyang sems can gcig bla na med pa'i byang chub la bzhag pas ni sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi tshul rgyun mi 'chad par 'gyur gyis /
analyzed: de'i gtan tshigs kyang sems can gcig bla na med pa'i byang chub la bzhag pas ni sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi tshul rgyun mi 'chad par 'gyur gyis /
translated: The reason for that is also taught: “By establishing a single sentient being in unsurpassed awakening, the way of the Dharma of the Buddhas will not be cut off.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams so so'i 'bras bu la bkod par de ltar mi 'gyur ba dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa yang byang chub sems dpa' las 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams so so'i 'bras bu la bkod par de ltar mi 'gyur ba dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa yang byang chub sems dpa' las 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: By establishing the solitary realizers and the hearers in their individual results, it will not be like that, and because the solitary realizers, the hearers, and the Tathāgatas arise from the bodhisattvas.”

original: koo shi ka rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la la zhig gis /
analyzed: koo shi ka rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la la zhig gis /
translated: Kauśika, if a son of a good family or a daughter of a good family

original: 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can thams cad dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la bkod par gyur na /
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can thams cad dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la bkod par gyur na /
translated: If all the sentient beings of the world were to be established in the ten virtuous actions,

original: koo shi ka de ci snyam du sems zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: koo shi ka de ci snyam du sems zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Kauśika, what do you think?🔽Up to “The tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete buddhas exist.”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams yod do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can thams cad dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la bkod pa dang / gling bzhi pa'i sems can rnams dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams yod do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can thams cad dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la bkod pa dang / gling bzhi pa'i sems can rnams dang /
translated: All the sentient beings of the world are established in the ten virtuous actions, and the sentient beings of the four continents,

original: stong gcig gi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can rnams dang / stong gnyis kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can rnams dang / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can rnams dang / phyogs bcu'i phyogs re re zhing yang 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na sems can ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la bkod pa'i bsod nams pas kyang /
analyzed: stong gcig gi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can rnams dang / stong gnyis kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can rnams dang / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can rnams dang / phyogs bcu'i phyogs re re zhing yang 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na sems can ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la bkod pa'i bsod nams pas kyang /
translated: The merit of establishing all the sentient beings of a world system of one thousand worlds, or of a world system of two thousand worlds, or of a world system of three thousand worlds, or of all the sentient beings in as many world systems in the ten directions as there are sand particles in the Ganges River, in the ten virtues,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di glegs bam klag pa 'am /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di glegs bam klag pa 'am /
translated: is not even a fraction of the merit of giving to others this perfection of wisdom, so that they can read it,

original: dpe bri @3a * //
analyzed: dpe bri @3a * //
translated: or copy it,🔽or recite it aloud.

original: ba'am / kha ton du bya ba'i phyir gzhan la byin na bsod nams che ba gtan tshigs dang bcas par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: ba'am / kha ton du bya ba'i phyir gzhan la byin na bsod nams che ba gtan tshigs dang bcas par bstan pa ste /
translated: This is the explanation of the great merit of giving this perfection of wisdom to others, together with the reason.

original: de'i gtan tshigs kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las zag pa med pa'i chos thams cad rgya cher bstan pa dang / zag pa med pa'i chos de dag yod pas rgyal rigs che zhing mtho ba la sogs pa 'dod pa'i khams kyi mi ya rabs rnams dang /
analyzed: de'i gtan tshigs kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las zag pa med pa'i chos thams cad rgya cher bstan pa dang / zag pa med pa'i chos de dag yod pas rgyal rigs che zhing mtho ba la sogs pa 'dod pa'i khams kyi mi ya rabs rnams dang /
translated: The reason for that is that all uncontaminated phenomena are extensively taught in this perfection of wisdom, and because those uncontaminated phenomena exist, the noble people of the desire realm such as the great and high caste,🔽and the gods of the three realms down to the gods of the formless realm such as the gods of the four great kings exist in the world,

original: rgyal chen bzhi'i rigs kyi lha la sogs pa gzugs med pa'i khams kyi lha man chad khams gsum gyi lha rnams 'jig rten na yod par 'gyur pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la thug gi bar du /🔽rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad 'jig rten na yod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi'i rigs kyi lha la sogs pa gzugs med pa'i khams kyi lha man chad khams gsum gyi lha rnams 'jig rten na yod par 'gyur pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la thug gi bar du /🔽rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad 'jig rten na yod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: and all the phenomena of purification exist in the world up to the perfection of generosity and so on, the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Complete Buddha.🔽Thus it is taught.

original: koo shi ka gzhan yang 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi ji snyed pa de dag rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo la las bsam gtan bzhi la bkod de /
analyzed: koo shi ka gzhan yang 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi ji snyed pa de dag rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo la las bsam gtan bzhi la bkod de /
translated: “Moreover, Kauśika, if some son of a good family or daughter of a good family were to establish as many beings as there are in Jambudvīpa in the four concentrations,

original: tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / mngon par shes pa lnga la rab tu bkod na /
analyzed: tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / mngon par shes pa lnga la rab tu bkod na /
translated: and in the four immeasurables, the four formless absorptions, and the five kinds of clairvoyance,

original: koo shi ka de ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: koo shi ka de ji snyam du sems /
translated: Kauśika, what do you think?

original: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de'i bsod nams de'i rgyus mang du 'phel lam zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de'i bsod nams de'i rgyus mang du 'phel lam zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Would the merit of that son of a good family or daughter of a good family on that account increase much?”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams yod do zhes pa'i bar du ni 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi thams cad dang / gling bzhi pa'i sems can rnams dang / stong gcig gi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can rnams dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams yod do zhes pa'i bar du ni 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi thams cad dang / gling bzhi pa'i sems can rnams dang / stong gcig gi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can rnams dang /
translated: Up to “The Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Awakened One exists,” the beings of Jambudvīpa, the beings of the four continents, the beings of a world system of a billion universes,

original: stong gnyis kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can rnams dang / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can rnams dang / phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi sems can ji snyed yod pa de dag thams cad bsam gtan bzhi dang /
analyzed: stong gnyis kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can rnams dang / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can rnams dang / phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi sems can ji snyed yod pa de dag thams cad bsam gtan bzhi dang /
translated: The merit of establishing all the sentient beings of a world system of a billion worlds in the four concentrations,

original: tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / mngon par shes pa lnga la bkod pa'i bsod nams pas kyang /
analyzed: tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / mngon par shes pa lnga la bkod pa'i bsod nams pas kyang /
translated: the four immeasurables, the four formless absorptions, and the five superknowledges

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di glegs bam la klag pa dang / dpe bri ba dang / kha ton du bya ba'i phyir gzhan la byin pa bsod nams che ba gtan @3b tshigs sngar bshad pa dang bcas par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di glegs bam la klag pa dang / dpe bri ba dang / kha ton du bya ba'i phyir gzhan la byin pa bsod nams che ba gtan @3b tshigs sngar bshad pa dang bcas par bstan pa'o //
translated: is far outshone by the merit of giving this perfection of wisdom to others for reading, for memorizing, and for writing it down.

original: koo shi ka gzhan yang rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par byed pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed na de'i bsod nams ches mang du 'phel gyis zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: koo shi ka gzhan yang rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par byed pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed na de'i bsod nams ches mang du 'phel gyis zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Moreover, Kauśika, a son of a good family or a daughter of a good family who takes up, bears in mind, reads aloud, masters, and properly pays attention to this perfection of wisdom will have a lot more merit than that, up to🔽it is not from establishing all the sentient beings in a great billionfold world system in the ten wholesome actions, and in the four concentrations, four immeasurables, four formless absorptions, and five clairvoyances.

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can thams cad dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la bkod pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / mngon par shes pa lnga la bkod pas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la tshul bzhin yid la byed pa gtso bor bya ste 'dzin pa dang /🔽'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par byas na /
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can thams cad dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la bkod pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / mngon par shes pa lnga la bkod pas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la tshul bzhin yid la byed pa gtso bor bya ste 'dzin pa dang /🔽'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par byas na /
translated: Up to here, the main point is that if you take up, bear in mind, read aloud, and master this perfection of wisdom, and properly pay attention to it,🔽you will have a lot more merit than that.

original: 'dzam bu'i gling nas stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams la thug gi bar gyi sems can thams cad dge ba bcu la sogs pa la bkod pa'i bsod nams pas kyang bsod nams ches mang du 'phel ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling nas stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams la thug gi bar gyi sems can thams cad dge ba bcu la sogs pa la bkod pa'i bsod nams pas kyang bsod nams ches mang du 'phel ba bstan pa'o //
translated: The merit of establishing all the sentient beings of the world-realms in the ten directions up to the limit of space in the ten virtues and so on is shown to be surpassed by the merit of the perfection of wisdom.

original: de la tshul bzhin yid la byed pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la tshul bzhin yid la byed pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of proper mental attention is as follows.

original: gnyis pa la spyod pa yang ma yin mi gnyis pa la spyod pa yang ma yin pa'i blos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dzin pa dang / kun chub par byed pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gnyis pa la spyod pa yang ma yin mi gnyis pa la spyod pa yang ma yin pa'i blos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dzin pa dang / kun chub par byed pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: In the second, with a cognition that does not practice dualism or non-dualism, one takes up the perfection of wisdom, masters it, holds it, reads it aloud, and properly pays attention to it, up to:🔽one properly pays attention to the knowledge of all modes.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa'i don bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa'i don bstan pa ste /
translated: The meaning of proper mental attention is shown.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe don dam par chos thams cad stong pa nyid du rtogs pas yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa'i mtha' gnyis su yang mi 'dzin /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe don dam par chos thams cad stong pa nyid du rtogs pas yod pa dang med pa la sogs pa'i mtha' gnyis su yang mi 'dzin /
translated: When they practice the perfection of wisdom, they do not apprehend the two extremes of existence and nonexistence, because they realize that ultimately all phenomena are emptiness.

original: yod med gnyis kyi mtha' dang bral bar yang mi 'dzin par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar la spyod pa nyid tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yod med gnyis kyi mtha' dang bral bar yang mi 'dzin par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar la spyod pa nyid tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: They do not apprehend the freedom from the extremes of existence and nonexistence, but practice the perfection of wisdom and so forth up to the knowledge of all aspects in a proper way.

original: koo shi ka gzhan yang rigs kyi bu'am /🔽rigs kyi bu mo la la zhig / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di gzhan la rnam grangs drangs du mar rgya cher brjod cing @4a * //
analyzed: koo shi ka gzhan yang rigs kyi bu'am / rigs kyi bu mo la la zhig / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di gzhan la rnam grangs drangs du mar rgya cher brjod cing @4a * //
translated: Kauśika, moreover, some son of a good family🔽or daughter of a good family, having taken up this perfection of wisdom,🔽and so forth, who explain and teach this perfection of wisdom to others in many ways and in detail,

original: ston la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bdag nyid kyis bzung zhing bcangs pa la sogs pa byas pa pas kyang /
analyzed: ston la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bdag nyid kyis bzung zhing bcangs pa la sogs pa byas pa pas kyang /
translated: and who, having taken up this perfection of wisdom, carry it,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la gnyis su yang mi lta /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la gnyis su yang mi lta /
translated: In this perfection of wisdom, one should not view it as dual,

original: gnyis su med par yang mi lta ba la sogs pa'i don gzhan la rgya cher bstan cing bshad pa bsod nams ches mang du 'phel ba'i yon tan bstan pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis su med par yang mi lta ba la sogs pa'i don gzhan la rgya cher bstan cing bshad pa bsod nams ches mang du 'phel ba'i yon tan bstan pa ste /
translated: nor should one view it as non-dual. The meaning of this and so on is explained in detail for others. The qualities of greatly increasing merit are taught.

original: de la rnam grangs du mar rgya cher brjod cing ston pa 'chad cing 'grel pa dang / rnam par 'byed cing gsal bar byed la yang dag par ston cing de'i don gtan la phab par ston pa byed na zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don gnyis su med pa gzhan la zhib tu ston cing 'chad pa'i rnam grangs su🔽rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la rnam grangs du mar rgya cher brjod cing ston pa 'chad cing 'grel pa dang / rnam par 'byed cing gsal bar byed la yang dag par ston cing de'i don gtan la phab par ston pa byed na zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don gnyis su med pa gzhan la zhib tu ston cing 'chad pa'i rnam grangs su rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, to explain, expound, comment, analyze, clarify, and teach correctly, and to teach the meaning of that means to teach in detail to others the meaning of the perfection of wisdom, which is non-duality. This should be understood as the enumeration of explanations.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gnyis su lta ba ma yin /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gnyis su lta ba ma yin /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is not viewed as dual,

original: gnyis su med par lta ba ma yin zhes bya ba ni don dam par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin chos thams cad la rnam par mi rtog pa yin pa'i phyir gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhes bya bar yang mi rtog
analyzed: gnyis su med par lta ba ma yin zhes bya ba ni don dam par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin chos thams cad la rnam par mi rtog pa yin pa'i phyir gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhes bya bar yang mi rtog
translated: Not a view of non-duality means that, because of the non-discrimination of all things which have the perfection of wisdom as their own-being in the ultimate sense, one does not even discriminate that it is the non-dual own-being.

original: na gnyis kyi ngo bo nyid du rtogs pa lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
analyzed: na gnyis kyi ngo bo nyid du rtogs pa lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
translated: How much less could one discriminate it as the dual own-being!

original: de bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gnyis kyi tshul du yang mi lta //
analyzed: de bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gnyis kyi tshul du yang mi lta //
translated: Therefore, the perfection of wisdom is not to be viewed as a method of duality.

original: gnyis su med pa'i tshul du yang mi lta'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i tshul du yang mi lta'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Nor is it to be viewed as a method of non-duality. This is the meaning.

original: mtshan mar ma yin mtshan ma med par ma yin zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'i yul la dmigs pa'i tshe gzugs la sogs pa kun brtags pa'i dngos po rnams la mtshan mar mi 'dzin pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'o zhes bya bar yang rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan mar ma yin mtshan ma med par ma yin zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'i yul la dmigs pa'i tshe gzugs la sogs pa kun brtags pa'i dngos po rnams la mtshan mar mi 'dzin pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'o zhes bya bar yang rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Not a sign, not signless means that when one is occupied with the objective supports of the eye, etc., one does not grasp the signs of the imagined things, such as form, etc., and one does not discriminate that it is signless.

original: blang bar ma yin dor bar ma yin zhes bya ba ni las legs nyes byed pa'i tshe srid pa'i phyi ma blang ba'i rnam par rtog pa med pa dang / las kyi rnam par smin pa myong ba'i tshe sdug bsngal la sogs pa dor ba'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blang bar ma yin dor bar ma yin zhes bya ba ni las legs nyes byed pa'i tshe srid pa'i phyi ma blang ba'i rnam par rtog pa med pa dang / las kyi rnam par smin pa myong ba'i tshe sdug bsngal la sogs pa dor ba'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Neither to be taken up nor to be put down” means that when one is performing good or bad actions, there is no discursive thought of taking up a future existence, and when one is experiencing the results of actions, there is no discursive thought of rejecting suffering, etc.

original: dbri bar ma yin bsnan par ma yin zhes bya ba ni shes par bya ba ni shes par bya ba'i chos rnams rab tu 'byed pa'i tshe yod pa'i dngos po la med do zhes skur ba 'debs shing dbri bar mi byed pa dang / med pa'i dngos po la yod do zhes sgro 'dogs shing bsnan pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbri bar ma yin bsnan par ma yin zhes bya ba ni shes par bya ba ni shes par bya ba'i chos rnams rab tu 'byed pa'i tshe yod pa'i dngos po la med do zhes skur ba 'debs shing dbri bar mi byed pa dang / med pa'i dngos po la yod do zhes sgro 'dogs shing bsnan pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Neither to be diminished nor to be augmented” means that when one is discerning the phenomena that are to be known, one does not diminish by denying existence to existent things, nor does one augment by reifying nonexistent things.

original: kun nas nyon mongs par @4b ma yin rnam par byang bar ma yin zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po yin te /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs par @4b ma yin rnam par byang bar ma yin zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po yin te /
translated: “Neither to be defiled nor to be purified” means that all sentient beings have the essence of the Tathāgata.

original: rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'i phyir so so'i skye bo'i tshe yang kun nas nyon mongs pa med la /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'i phyir so so'i skye bo'i tshe yang kun nas nyon mongs pa med la /
translated: Because it is pure by nature, it is uncontaminated even in the state of ordinary beings.

original: 'phags par gyur pa'i tshe yang rnam par byang ba med pa'i phyir ro //🔽skye bar ma yin 'gag par ma yin zhes bya ba ni shes par bya ba'i de kho na nyid yongs su brtag pa'i tshe chos kyi chos nyid la don dam par skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phags par gyur pa'i tshe yang rnam par byang ba med pa'i phyir ro // skye bar ma yin 'gag par ma yin zhes bya ba ni shes par bya ba'i de kho na nyid yongs su brtag pa'i tshe chos kyi chos nyid la don dam par skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And because it is uncontaminated even in the state of noble ones, it is unpurified.🔽It is neither produced nor stopped refers to the reality that is to be known, because when one investigates the suchness of phenomena, one realizes that ultimately there is no production and no stopping.

original: gzung bar ma yin mi bzung bar ma yin zhes bya ba ni chos kyi de bzhin nyid la sems rtse gcig tu 'jog cing bsgom pa'i tshe gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis med par gzung ba dang mi bzung ba gnyis kar rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir
analyzed: gzung bar ma yin mi bzung bar ma yin zhes bya ba ni chos kyi de bzhin nyid la sems rtse gcig tu 'jog cing bsgom pa'i tshe gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis med par gzung ba dang mi bzung ba gnyis kar rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir
translated: It is neither apprehended nor non-apprehended refers to the suchness of phenomena, because when one places the mind one-pointedly on the suchness of phenomena and cultivates it, one has no concepts of either apprehending or not apprehending, since there is neither the apprehended nor the apprehender.

original: ro // len par ma yin la 'dor bar ma yin zhes bya ba ni sa 'og ma nas sa gong mar 'phar ba'i tshe don dam par sa gong ma'i yon tan blang ba dang / sa 'og ma'i skyon dor bar mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ro // len par ma yin la 'dor bar ma yin zhes bya ba ni sa 'og ma nas sa gong mar 'phar ba'i tshe don dam par sa gong ma'i yon tan blang ba dang / sa 'og ma'i skyon dor bar mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Not taking up, not putting down means that, when one ascends from a lower to a higher stage, one does not conceive that one is taking up the virtues of the higher stage or putting down the faults of the lower stage.

original: gnas par ma yin mi gnas par ma yin zhes bya ba ni sa gong nas gong du 'phar zhing gnas par bya ba dang / sa 'og ma la gnas par mi bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas par ma yin mi gnas par ma yin zhes bya ba ni sa gong nas gong du 'phar zhing gnas par bya ba dang / sa 'og ma la gnas par mi bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Not abiding, not not abiding means that one does not conceive that one should abide in the higher stages and not abide in the lower stages.

original: yang dag par ma yin log par ma yin zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel bar sgrub pa'i tshe 'di ni yang dag pa'i bsgrub pa'o //🔽'di ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i bsgrub pa'o zhes bya bar rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag par ma yin log par ma yin zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel bar sgrub pa'i tshe 'di ni yang dag pa'i bsgrub pa'o //🔽'di ni yang dag pa ma yin pa'i bsgrub pa'o zhes bya bar rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Not real, not unreal means that when one practices the union of calm abiding and insight, one does not conceive that this is a real practice and that is not a real practice.

original: ldan par ma yin mi ldan par ma yin zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel bar sgrub cing yid la byed pa de nyid kyi tshe 'di la byed pa 'di ni rigs pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: ldan par ma yin mi ldan par ma yin zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel bar sgrub cing yid la byed pa de nyid kyi tshe 'di la byed pa 'di ni rigs pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Neither associated nor non-associated is the application of mindfulness that is the union of serenity and insight.

original: yid la byed pa 'di ni rigs pa dang mi ldan pa'o zhes bya bar rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid la byed pa 'di ni rigs pa dang mi ldan pa'o zhes bya bar rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the application of mindfulness that is not associated with the view of the transitory aggregates, etc.

original: 'dre bar ma yin mi 'dre bar ma yin zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa phra mo mthar gyis spong ba na nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i skyon rnams dang 'dres pa dang ma 'dres pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dre bar ma yin mi 'dre bar ma yin zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa phra mo mthar gyis spong ba na nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i skyon rnams dang 'dres pa dang ma 'dres pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Neither mixed nor unmixed is the application of mindfulness that is the gradual abandonment of the subtle obscurations of the passions and the knowable.

original: rkyen du ma yin rkyen med par ma yin zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid du rab tu rtogs par byed pa'i tshe don dam @5a * //
analyzed: rkyen du ma yin rkyen med par ma yin zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid du rab tu rtogs par byed pa'i tshe don dam @5a * //
translated: Neither conditioned nor unconditioned is the application of mindfulness that is the realization of reality.

original: pa'i rang bzhin de de bzhin nyid de las dang po la sogs pa'i rigs pas 'jug kyang rgyu dang rkyen gyi rang bzhin du so sor dbye ba dang / dbye ba med pa'i rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa'i rang bzhin de de bzhin nyid de las dang po la sogs pa'i rigs pas 'jug kyang rgyu dang rkyen gyi rang bzhin du so sor dbye ba dang / dbye ba med pa'i rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The nature of that suchness is suchness. Even though one enters it through reasoning such as the beginningless, etc., the conceptualization of a division into the nature of cause and condition and the absence of division does not occur.

original: chos su ma yin chos su ma yin par ma yin zhes bya ba'i chos kyi chos nyid mngon sum du byed pa'i tshe chos dang chos ma yin pa'i dngos por rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos su ma yin chos su ma yin par ma yin zhes bya ba'i chos kyi chos nyid mngon sum du byed pa'i tshe chos dang chos ma yin pa'i dngos por rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: When one realizes the reality of dharmas, which is neither dharma nor non-dharma, the conceptualization of things as dharma and non-dharma does not occur.

original: de bzhin nyid du ma yin de bzhin nyid ma yin par ma yin zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid la bsgom pa'i tshe 'di ni de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du ma yin de bzhin nyid ma yin par ma yin zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid la bsgom pa'i tshe 'di ni de bzhin nyid do //
translated: As for “neither suchness nor not suchness,” when one meditates on suchness, there is no conceptualization that thinks, “This is suchness,”

original: 'di ni de bzhin nyid ma yin no zhes bya bar rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin nyid ma yin no zhes bya bar rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: or “This is not suchness.”

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' ma yin par ma yin zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshe yang dag pa'i don gyi mtha'o zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' ma yin par ma yin zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshe yang dag pa'i don gyi mtha'o zhes bya ba'am /
translated: It is not that it is not the limit of reality.🔽🔽This means that even when nirvana is attained, it is the limit of reality.

original: yang dag pa'i don gyi mtha' ma yin no zhes bya bar rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don gyi mtha' ma yin no zhes bya bar rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not that it is not the very limit of reality is because there is no conceptual thought that it is the very limit of reality at the time of nirvana, or that it is not the very limit of reality.🔽The merit of teaching the perfection of wisdom

original: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di gzhan la rgya cher brjod cing ston la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de ltar gong du smos pa'i rim pas /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di gzhan la rgya cher brjod cing ston la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de ltar gong du smos pa'i rim pas /
translated: The merit of teaching the perfection of wisdom is explained in the passage beginning with “Moreover, Subhuti, a son or daughter of good family who teaches this perfection of wisdom to others in detail, explains it, illuminates it, reveals it, expounds it, and analyzes it,🔽and so on. In this way, by the sequence mentioned above,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo mtha' gnyis dang bral ba de lta bu bdag 'ba' zhig gis bzung zhing bcangs pa la sogs pa byas pa bas kyang gzhan la rgya cher bshad cing bstan pa bsod nams mang du 'phel ba'i phan yon mjug
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo mtha' gnyis dang bral ba de lta bu bdag 'ba' zhig gis bzung zhing bcangs pa la sogs pa byas pa bas kyang gzhan la rgya cher bshad cing bstan pa bsod nams mang du 'phel ba'i phan yon mjug
translated: the merit of teaching and explaining in detail to others the profound meaning of the perfection of wisdom, which is thus free from the two extremes, is shown to increase greatly, compared to just oneself upholding, keeping, and so on, of that perfection of wisdom.

original: bsdus te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bsdus te bstan pa'o //
translated: The benefits are summarized at the end.

original: koo shi ka gzhan yang rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la la zhig /
analyzed: koo shi ka gzhan yang rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la la zhig /
translated: Furthermore, Kauśika, some son of a good family or daughter of a good family

original: bdag nyid kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dzin cing kun chub par byed de zhes bya ba nas /🔽rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de'i bsod nams ni shin tu mang du 'phel lo zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bdag nyid kyang 'dzin cing 'chang ba la sogs pa'i nan tan byed la /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dzin cing kun chub par byed de zhes bya ba nas / rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de'i bsod nams ni shin tu mang du 'phel lo zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bdag nyid kyang 'dzin cing 'chang ba la sogs pa'i nan tan byed la /
translated: will hold and master the perfection of wisdom, and so on up to🔽“the merit of that son of a good family or daughter of a good family increases much more.”🔽This shows the benefit of the increase of merit that is much greater than before if one practices the perfection of wisdom oneself, holding it, keeping it, and so on,

original: gzhan la yang gnyis su med pa'i don rgya cher bshad na bsod nams snga ma bas kyang ches mang du 'phel ba'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan la yang gnyis su med pa'i don rgya cher bshad na bsod nams snga ma bas kyang ches mang du 'phel ba'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
translated: and also explains extensively the meaning of nonduality to others.

original: brgya byin gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: brgya byin gyis gsol pa /
translated: Śatakratu said,

original: bcom ldan 'das rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de ltar don dang ldan la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de ltar don dang ldan la /
translated: “Lord, a son of a good family or a daughter of a good family who has the perfection of wisdom like that, with the meaning,

original: yi ge dang ldan par bstan par bgyi'am zhes bya ba ni @5b shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo gzhan la rgya cher bstan pa bsod nams che ba gzhan dag kyang bstan pa'i gleng bslang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yi ge dang ldan par bstan par bgyi'am zhes bya ba ni @5b shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo gzhan la rgya cher bstan pa bsod nams che ba gzhan dag kyang bstan pa'i gleng bslang ba'i phyir /
translated: Should I teach it with the letters? means Should I teach the profound meaning of the perfection of wisdom to others in detail?

original: ci shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don de lta bu gzhan la nges par bstan 'tshal lam zhes zhus pa'o //
analyzed: ci shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don de lta bu gzhan la nges par bstan 'tshal lam zhes zhus pa'o //
translated: It is asking, Should I definitely teach the meaning of the perfection of wisdom to others in that way?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: koo shi ka rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de ltar don dang ldan pa /
analyzed: koo shi ka rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de ltar don dang ldan pa /
translated: Kauśika, a son of good family or daughter of good family should teach the perfection of wisdom in that way, with the meaning,

original: yi ge dang ldan par bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: yi ge dang ldan par bstan par bya ste /
translated: and with the letters.🔽Kauśika, a son of good family or daughter of good family who teaches in that way will possess immeasurable, incalculable heaps of merit.

original: koo shi ka de ltar ston pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo ni bsod nams kyi phung po tshad med grangs med pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo gzhan la rgya cher
analyzed: koo shi ka de ltar ston pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo ni bsod nams kyi phung po tshad med grangs med pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo gzhan la rgya cher
