original: 'di don dang tshig 'bru gsal ba dang ldan par gzhan la rgya cher bstan pa bsod nams che ba dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la bslabs te /
analyzed: 'di don dang tshig 'bru gsal ba dang ldan par gzhan la rgya cher bstan pa bsod nams che ba dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la bslabs te /
translated: It is of great merit to teach this extensively to others, clearly in its meaning and in its words.🔽The Bhagavan Buddhas of the three times have trained in this perfection of wisdom and have become fully enlightened.

original: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs dang bcas te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs dang bcas te bstan pa'o //
translated: This is taught together with the reason.

original: koo shi ka gzhan yang rigs kyi bu 'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la las bskal pa tshad med grangs med par dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pa dang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: koo shi ka gzhan yang rigs kyi bu 'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la las bskal pa tshad med grangs med par dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pa dang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Moreover, Kausika, any son or daughter of good family who practices the perfection of giving for immeasurable, countless eons in a manner of objectification, up to...🔽...and teaches it correctly, his merit increases much more.

original: yang dag par ston par byed pa de'i bsod nams ches mang du 'phel lo zhes bya ba'i bar du ni mtshan ma dang bcas par bskal pa tshad med grangs med par pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad pa bas kyang /
analyzed: yang dag par ston par byed pa de'i bsod nams ches mang du 'phel lo zhes bya ba'i bar du ni mtshan ma dang bcas par bskal pa tshad med grangs med par pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad pa bas kyang /
translated: This is up to: compared to one who practices the six perfections for immeasurable, countless eons with signs,

original: mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis @6a * //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis @6a * //
translated: by way of non-apprehension...

original: 'khor gsum yongs su dag par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di don dang tshig tu ldan par gzhan la rgya cher bshad pa bsod nams che ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor gsum yongs su dag par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di don dang tshig tu ldan par gzhan la rgya cher bshad pa bsod nams che ba bstan pa'o //
translated: This shows that it is of great merit to explain this perfection of wisdom extensively to others, in its meaning and in its letter, knowing it to be purified of the three spheres.

original: de la dmigs pa ni 'di yin te zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa ni 'di yin te zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Here is the idea:🔽... up to: it is only the perfection of wisdom, not the perfection of giving.🔽This shows that when one practices the six perfections of giving, etc.,

original: shes rab nyid du 'gyur gyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa'i tshe 'khor gsum yongs su ma dag par spyod pa nyid dmigs pa dang🔽bcas pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab nyid du 'gyur gyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa'i tshe 'khor gsum yongs su ma dag par spyod pa nyid dmigs pa dang bcas pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: one is still possessed of an objective support, because one has not purified the three spheres.🔽Kausika, the son or daughter of good family who practices with an objective support in that way does not complete the perfection of giving, and so on up to:

original: koo shi ka rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de bzhin de ltar dmigs pa la spyod pas ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par mi
analyzed: koo shi ka rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de bzhin de ltar dmigs pa la spyod pas ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par mi
translated: does not complete the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni dmigs pa dang bcas par pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad na pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur ba'i nyes dmigs bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni dmigs pa dang bcas par pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad na pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur ba'i nyes dmigs bstan pa'o //
translated: Up to will be turned away teaches the disadvantage of practicing the six perfections with reference, in that one will not complete the six perfections.

original: brgya byin gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: brgya byin gyis gsol pa /
translated: Śatakratu said:

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar spyad na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar spyad na /
translated: Blessed One, how should a bodhisattva mahāsattva practice

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur zhes bya ba nas /
translated: to complete the perfection of generosity?🔽Up to how should they practice to complete the perfection of wisdom?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis 'khor gsum yongs su dag par pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa'i rang bzhin gyis bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis 'khor gsum yongs su dag par pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa'i rang bzhin gyis bstan pa'o //
translated: This teaches the nature of practicing the six perfections with the purity of the three spheres by way of non-apprehension.

original: koo shi ka rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de ltar khong du chud pa med pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don dang ldan yi ge dang ldan par bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba nas de ltar khong du chud pa med par sbyin pa'i
analyzed: koo shi ka rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de ltar khong du chud pa med pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don dang ldan yi ge dang ldan par bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba nas de ltar khong du chud pa med par sbyin pa'i
translated: Kauśika, a son of a good family or a daughter of a good family should teach the perfection of wisdom that is endowed with the meaning and endowed with the letters in such a way that there is no comprehension, and so on up to should teach the perfection of giving

original: pha rol tu phyin pa don dang ldan /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa don dang ldan /
translated: that is endowed with the meaning and endowed with the letters in such a way that there is no comprehension.

original: yi ge dang ldan par bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de ltar mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis 'khor gsum yongs su dag par pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par bstan pa'i don mjug bsdus nas bstan pa ste /
analyzed: yi ge dang ldan par bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de ltar mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis 'khor gsum yongs su dag par pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par bstan pa'i don mjug bsdus nas bstan pa ste /
translated: This is the summary of the teaching of the perfection of the six perfections by way of the complete purity of the three spheres in such a way that there is no apprehension.

original: khong du chud pa med par zhes bya ba ni gang la yang dngos po dang mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing /
analyzed: khong du chud pa med par zhes bya ba ni gang la yang dngos po dang mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing /
translated: “No comprehension” means not apprehending anything as a thing or a sign.

original: dmigs pa med par pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par byas shing gzhan la yang don dang tshig tu ldan par bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dmigs pa med par pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par byas shing gzhan la yang don dang tshig tu ldan par bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should complete the six perfections without reference, and also teach them to others with meaning and words.

original: de ci'i @6b phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i @6b phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: koo shi ka ma 'ongs pa'i dus na rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo la la byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa ba rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan ston pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: koo shi ka ma 'ongs pa'i dus na rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo la la byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa ba rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan ston pa 'byung ste /
translated: Kauśika, in the future there will appear sons of good family or daughters of good family who, in the vehicle of the bodhisattvas, will teach a counterfeit perfection of wisdom.

original: der rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu zhugs pa de dag gis kyang gzugs brnyan de thos nas lam ston par 'gyur te /
analyzed: der rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu zhugs pa de dag gis kyang gzugs brnyan de thos nas lam ston par 'gyur te /
translated: There, those sons of good family or daughters of good family who have set out for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening will hear that counterfeit and will teach a counterfeit path.

original: de dag la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di don dang ldan /
analyzed: de dag la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di don dang ldan /
translated: For them, this perfection of wisdom is meaningful,

original: yi ge dang ldan par bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa'i rim pas mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan par bya ba'i dgos pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: yi ge dang ldan par bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa'i rim pas mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan par bya ba'i dgos pa bstan pa ste /
translated: The statement “should be taught endowed with the letters” indicates the purpose of teaching the perfection of wisdom by way of non-apprehension in the manner explained above.

original: de ltar mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis ma bstan na /
analyzed: de ltar mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis ma bstan na /
translated: If it were not taught by way of non-apprehension,

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na theg pa chung ngu pa kha cig dmigs pa can gyi tshul du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na theg pa chung ngu pa kha cig dmigs pa can gyi tshul du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston pa 'byung ste /
translated: in the future some of the Hīnayāna would teach the perfection of wisdom in a manner of apprehension.🔽They would teach a counterfeit of the meaning of the perfection of wisdom,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don ma yin pa la /🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don ltar bcos shing ston pa de dag thos nas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don ma yin pa la / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don ltar bcos shing ston pa de dag thos nas /
translated: which is not the meaning of the perfection of wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa rnams lta ba log cing byang chub sems dpa'i lam las nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa rnams lta ba log cing byang chub sems dpa'i lam las nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: Having heard that, those newly entered into the vehicle of the bodhisattvas would have a wrong view and would fall from the path of the bodhisattvas.

original: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don dmigs su med pa de lta bu bstan dgos so zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: de'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don dmigs su med pa de lta bu bstan dgos so zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the perfection of wisdom is such that it must be taught as non-apprehensible.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don ma yin pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don yin pa ltar bcos te ston pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don ma yin pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don yin pa ltar bcos te ston pa'o //
translated: The phrase a counterfeit of the perfection of wisdom means that it is a counterfeit of the meaning of the perfection of wisdom, and is taught as if it were the meaning of the perfection of wisdom.

original: brgya byin gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: brgya byin gyis gsol pa /
translated: Śatakratu then asks,

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan gang lags zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan gang lags zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Bhagavan, what is a counterfeit of the perfection of wisdom?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan ji lta bu yin pa 'khor rnams la zhib tu bshad pa skabs dbye ba'i phyir zhus pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan ji lta bu yin pa 'khor rnams la zhib tu bshad pa skabs dbye ba'i phyir zhus pa'o //
translated: He asks this in order to make a request to the Bhagavān to explain in detail to the assembly what a counterfeit of the perfection of wisdom is like.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān replies,

original: koo shi ka 'di la rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bshad do snyam zhing /
analyzed: koo shi ka 'di la rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bshad do snyam zhing /
translated: Kauśika, here, sons of good family or daughters of good family, thinking 'I will explain the perfection of wisdom,'

original: de dag gzugs brnyan ston par byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni theg pa chung ngu pa dag dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i sems kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan to snyam du sems shing ston pa @7a * //
analyzed: de dag gzugs brnyan ston par byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni theg pa chung ngu pa dag dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i sems kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan to snyam du sems shing ston pa @7a * //
translated: The statement they teach the counterfeit of the perfection of wisdom means that the Hinayanists think that the perfection of wisdom is taught by a mind that has an objective reference.

original: nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan ston pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan ston pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The Lord has shown that they teach the counterfeit of the perfection of wisdom.

original: brgya byin gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: brgya byin gyis gsol pa /
translated: Sakra says:

original: ji ltar na rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan ston pa lags zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan thabs ji ltar ston ces zhus pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar na rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan ston pa lags zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan thabs ji ltar ston ces zhus pa'o //
translated: How do those sons and daughters of good family teach the counterfeit of the perfection of wisdom? He asks how the counterfeit of the perfection of wisdom is taught.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord replies:

original: koo shi ka 'di la rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston par byed pa'i tshe /
analyzed: koo shi ka 'di la rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston par byed pa'i tshe /
translated: Kausika, here when sons and daughters of good family teach the perfection of wisdom,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan ston te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan ston te /
translated: He teaches a counterfeit perfection of wisdom.

original: de la 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan gang yin pa zhib tu bshad pa'o //🔽'di ltar gzugs mi rtag go zhes bya bar ston /🔽gzugs sdug bsngal lo zhes bya bar ston /🔽gzugs bdag med do zhes bya bar ston /🔽gzugs mi sdug go zhes bya bar ston cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos thams cad la dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i tshul du /
analyzed: de la 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan gang yin pa zhib tu bshad pa'o // 'di ltar gzugs mi rtag go zhes bya bar ston / gzugs sdug bsngal lo zhes bya bar ston / gzugs bdag med do zhes bya bar ston / gzugs mi sdug go zhes bya bar ston cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos thams cad la dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i tshul du /
translated: Here, “This is the counterfeit perfection of wisdom” and so on explain in detail what the counterfeit perfection of wisdom is.

original: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal dang / bdag med pa dang / mi sdug pa'i rang bzhin du bsgom pa ston pa theg pa chung ngu'i tshul yin yang /
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal dang / bdag med pa dang / mi sdug pa'i rang bzhin du bsgom pa ston pa theg pa chung ngu'i tshul yin yang /
translated: “He teaches that form is impermanent” and so on teach that the way of the Lesser Vehicle is to meditate on all phenomena, from form up to omniscience, as having the nature of impermanence, suffering, no-self, and unpleasantness, and to do so with reference to them as objects.

original: gang de ltar ston cing spyod pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no zhes 'chad pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan ston pa yin no zhes bshad pa'o //
analyzed: gang de ltar ston cing spyod pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no zhes 'chad pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan ston pa yin no zhes bshad pa'o //
translated: This is explained as teaching a counterfeit perfection of wisdom.🔽“Furthermore, Kauśika, those sons of a good family or daughters of a good family teach this perfection of wisdom as follows:

original: koo shi ka gzhan yang rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston pa 'di ltar ston te zhes bya ba nas de yang mtshan ma'i tshul dang / dmigs pa'i tshul gyis ston te /
analyzed: koo shi ka gzhan yang rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston pa 'di ltar ston te zhes bya ba nas de yang mtshan ma'i tshul dang / dmigs pa'i tshul gyis ston te /
translated: They teach it as a causal sign and as an objective support.

original: de dus kyi 'du shes kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dus kyi 'du shes kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms par 'gyur te /
translated: They cultivate the perfection of wisdom with the perception of time.🔽Kauśika, that is a counterfeit perfection of wisdom.”

original: koo shi ka de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan no zhes bya ba'i bar du ni mtshan ma dang bcas shing dmigs pa dang bcas par pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgoms na /
analyzed: koo shi ka de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan no zhes bya ba'i bar du ni mtshan ma dang bcas shing dmigs pa dang bcas par pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgoms na /
translated: This passage explains that if one cultivates the six perfections with causal signs and with objective supports,

original: tshe rabs sam bskal pa'i dus 'di tsam zhig gis byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu thob par 'gyur ro zhes dus kyi 'du shes dang bcas @7b par pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgom pa ston na yang mtshan ma dang bcas shing dmigs pa dang bcas par shes
analyzed: tshe rabs sam bskal pa'i dus 'di tsam zhig gis byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu thob par 'gyur ro zhes dus kyi 'du shes dang bcas @7b par pha rol tu phyin pa drug bsgom pa ston na yang mtshan ma dang bcas shing dmigs pa dang bcas par shes
translated: “They will attain the ten bodhisattva levels in this many lifetimes or eons,” and they teach the cultivation of the six perfections with a sense of time, but they should know that they are still with signs and with reference points.

original: rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston pas /
analyzed: rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston pas /
translated: They teach the perfection of wisdom,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don yang dag pa ston pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don yang dag pa ston pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: but they do not teach the true meaning of the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan ston pa yin no zhes bshad pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan ston pa yin no zhes bshad pa'o //
translated: They teach a counterfeit of the perfection of wisdom.”

original: koo shi ka gzhan yang rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo dag la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ltar ston te /
analyzed: koo shi ka gzhan yang rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo dag la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ltar ston te /
translated: “Furthermore, Kauśika, those sons of a good family or daughters of a good family teach those sons of a good family or daughters of a good family in the Bodhisattva Vehicle the perfection of wisdom like this:

original: tshur rigs kyi bu khyod kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms shig /
analyzed: tshur rigs kyi bu khyod kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms shig /
translated: ‘Come here, son of a good family! You should cultivate the perfection of wisdom.

original: rigs kyi bu khyod kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms dang nyan thos kyi sa las 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu khyod kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms dang nyan thos kyi sa las 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “Son of a good family, you should cultivate the perfection of wisdom, and you will pass beyond the śrāvaka level,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las 'da' bar 'gyur ro zhes ston te /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las 'da' bar 'gyur ro zhes ston te /
translated: and you will pass beyond the pratyekabuddha level.”🔽Kauśika, that is a counterfeit perfection of wisdom.

original: koo shi ka de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan no zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma dang bcas shing dmigs pa'i tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms na /
analyzed: koo shi ka de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan no zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma dang bcas shing dmigs pa'i tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms na /
translated: If someone teaches that “by cultivating the perfection of wisdom in a way that is accompanied by signs and a reference,

original: dus 'di tsam zhig gis nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las 'da' bar 'gyur ro zhes ston na yang mtshan ma dang bcas shing dmigs pa dang bcas par ston pas de yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan yin gyis /
analyzed: dus 'di tsam zhig gis nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las 'da' bar 'gyur ro zhes ston na yang mtshan ma dang bcas shing dmigs pa dang bcas par ston pas de yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan yin gyis /
translated: you will pass beyond the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha levels in just this much time,” then because of teaching in a way that is accompanied by signs and a reference, that also is a counterfeit perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don yang dag pa ma yin zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don yang dag pa ma yin zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It is taught that it is not the real perfection of wisdom.

original: koo shi ka gzhan yang rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston na 'di ltar ston te zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: koo shi ka gzhan yang rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston na 'di ltar ston te zhes bya ba nas /
translated: “Furthermore, Kauśika, when those sons of a good family or daughters of a good family teach the perfection of wisdom to those sons of a good family or daughters of a good family in the Bodhisattva Vehicle, they teach it like this:

original: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag la ston na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan ston to zhes bya ba'i bar du ni mtshan ma dang bcas shing dmigs pa dang bcas par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms na byang
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag la ston na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan ston to zhes bya ba'i bar du ni mtshan ma dang bcas shing dmigs pa dang bcas par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms na byang
translated: ‘Those sons of a good family or daughters of a good family teach the perfection of wisdom to those sons of a good family or daughters of a good family if they teach it like this.’

original: chub sems dpa'i skyon med par 'jug pa dang / mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par 'gyur ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par shes pa la gnas te /
analyzed: chub sems dpa'i skyon med par 'jug pa dang / mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par 'gyur ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par shes pa la gnas te /
translated: Kauśika, when they cultivate the perfection of wisdom with signs and with reference points, they do not enter into the secure state of a bodhisattva, they do not attain the patient acceptance of the fact that dharmas are not produced, and they do not stand in the bodhisattva’s extrasensory knowledge.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la mchod cing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la mchod cing /
translated: They do not make offerings to the lord buddhas,

original: rim gro la sogs pa byed cing sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas @8a * //
analyzed: rim gro la sogs pa byed cing sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas @8a * //
translated: and they do not go from buddhafield to buddhafield.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes kyang ston la mtshan ma dang bcas shing dmigs pa dang bcas par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dzin cing 'chang ba la sogs pa byed na /🔽bsod nams kyi phung po tshad med grangs med dpag tu med par 'gyur ro zhes ston na yang mtshan ma dang bcas shing dmigs pa dang bcas par ston pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don yang dag pa nyid ston pa ma yin gyis /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes kyang ston la mtshan ma dang bcas shing dmigs pa dang bcas par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dzin cing 'chang ba la sogs pa byed na / bsod nams kyi phung po tshad med grangs med dpag tu med par 'gyur ro zhes ston na yang mtshan ma dang bcas shing dmigs pa dang bcas par ston pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don yang dag pa nyid ston pa ma yin gyis /
translated: They will go to a buddhafield.🔽 If they hold, keep, etc., this perfection of wisdom with signs and with objective reference, then it is taught that they will have an immeasurable, incalculable, and unlimited heap of merit.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan ston pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan ston pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: But it is not taught that they teach the reality of the perfection of wisdom, because they teach with signs and with objective reference, and they teach a reflection of the perfection of wisdom.

original: koo shi ka gzhan yang rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag la 'di ltar ston te zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: koo shi ka gzhan yang rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag la 'di ltar ston te zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Kausika, moreover, those sons and daughters of good family teach those sons and daughters of good family in the vehicle of the Bodhisattvas as follows:

original: de dag de ltar ston cing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan ston to zhes bya ba'i bar du ni mtshan ma dang bcas shing dmigs pa dang bcas par dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba la rjes su🔽yi rang bar byas la /🔽rjes su yi rang ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos shig ces ston na yang mtshan ma dang bcas shing dmigs pa dang bcas par ston pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i
analyzed: de dag de ltar ston cing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan ston to zhes bya ba'i bar du ni mtshan ma dang bcas shing dmigs pa dang bcas par dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba la rjes su yi rang bar byas la / rjes su yi rang ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos shig ces ston na yang mtshan ma dang bcas shing dmigs pa dang bcas par ston pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i
translated: They teach, “You should rejoice in the wholesome roots of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones of the three times, with signs and with reference points.🔽And you should dedicate the wholesome roots of that rejoicing to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

original: don yang dag par ston pa ma yin gyis /
analyzed: don yang dag par ston pa ma yin gyis /
translated: But they teach with signs and with reference points, so they do not teach the meaning of the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: They teach a counterfeit perfection of wisdom.

original: brgya byin gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: brgya byin gyis gsol pa /
translated: Śatakratu said,🔽“Subhūti, what is the perfection of wisdom?

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar ston na rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan mi ston pa lags zhes bya ba la
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar ston na rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan mi ston pa lags zhes bya ba la
translated: Blessed One, how do they teach so that those sons of enlightened heritage or daughters of enlightened heritage do not present a counterfeit perfection of wisdom to those sons of enlightened heritage or daughters of enlightened heritage who follow the vehicle of the bodhisattvas?”

original: sogs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan ston pa'i gnyen por mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing mi dmigs par ston pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid du bstan pa bshad pa ste /
analyzed: sogs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan ston pa'i gnyen por mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing mi dmigs par ston pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid du bstan pa bshad pa ste /
translated: The following passage explains the teaching on the perfect meaning of the perfection of wisdom, which is the antidote to presenting a counterfeit perfection of wisdom and which teaches that one should not apprehend things by means of characteristics and that one should not objectify them.

original: gzugs mi rtag ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su ma lta shig / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs mi rtag ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su ma lta shig / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: “Do not view form as impermanent. And why?

original: gzugs ni rang bzhin gyis stong ste /🔽gzugs kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni dngos @8b po med pa'o zhes bya ba ni don dam par gzugs rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
analyzed: gzugs ni rang bzhin gyis stong ste /🔽gzugs kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni dngos @8b po med pa'o zhes bya ba ni don dam par gzugs rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
translated: Form is empty of inherent nature.🔽The inherent nature of form is non-entity.”

original: dngos po med pa'i phyir gzugs mi rtag pa zhes bya bar mtshan mar mi bzung zhing dmigs par bya ba'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i phyir gzugs mi rtag pa zhes bya bar mtshan mar mi bzung zhing dmigs par bya ba'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Because of the non-existence of things, one should not apprehend form as impermanent, and should not apprehend it as a causal sign.

original: dngos po med pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po med pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: That non-existence of things is the perfection of wisdom.🔽In that perfection of wisdom, one does not apprehend form as permanent,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de la ni gzugs rtag ces bya ba'am /🔽mi rtag ces bya ba mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni de ltar don dam par gzugs rang bzhin gyis stong zhing /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de la ni gzugs rtag ces bya ba'am / mi rtag ces bya ba mi dmigs so zhes bya ba ni de ltar don dam par gzugs rang bzhin gyis stong zhing /
translated: or as impermanent.

original: dngos po med par rtogs pa nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin te /
analyzed: dngos po med par rtogs pa nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin te /
translated: Thus, the realization that form is empty of intrinsic nature and non-existent in the ultimate sense is itself the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ltar rtogs pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par mi rtog pa de la ni gzugs rtag ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: de ltar rtogs pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par mi rtog pa de la ni gzugs rtag ces bya ba'am /
translated: In that non-conceptual perfection of wisdom which realizes in that way, there is no conceptualization of form as permanent,

original: mi rtag ces bya bar rnam par rtog pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi rtag ces bya bar rnam par rtog pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: or as impermanent. This is the meaning.

original: de la gzugs nyid kyang med na rtag pa'am mi rtag pa lta ga la yod ces bya ba ni gzugs nyid kyang don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong zhing dngos po med na /
analyzed: de la gzugs nyid kyang med na rtag pa'am mi rtag pa lta ga la yod ces bya ba ni gzugs nyid kyang don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong zhing dngos po med na /
translated: If form itself does not exist, how could it be permanent or impermanent?🔽This shows that if form itself is ultimately empty of intrinsic reality and is unreal,

original: gzugs kyi chos nyid rtag pa dang mi rtag ces bya ba lta ga la yod ces bstan pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyi chos nyid rtag pa dang mi rtag ces bya ba lta ga la yod ces bstan pa ste /
translated: how could the reality of form be permanent or impermanent?

original: de ltar ston cing 'doms pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don yang dag pa nyid ston pa yin gyis /
analyzed: de ltar ston cing 'doms pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don yang dag pa nyid ston pa yin gyis /
translated: Thus, teaching and instructing in that way is teaching the reality of the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan ston pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan ston pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It is not teaching a counterfeit perfection of wisdom.

original: gzugs ji ltar bshad pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: gzugs ji ltar bshad pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as form is explained,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: so should it be applied up to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: koo shi ka gzhan yang rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ltar ston to zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni chos🔽thams cad blang dor med par ston pa /
analyzed: koo shi ka gzhan yang rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ltar ston to zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni chos thams cad blang dor med par ston pa /
translated: “Moreover, Kauśika, those sons of a good family or daughters of a good family should show those sons of a good family or daughters of a good family who have set out in the vehicle of the bodhisattvas this perfection of wisdom like this” and so on.🔽This is the teaching of the Dharma

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid du ston pa yin par bshad pa ste /🔽de la chos gang las kyang yongs su 'da' bar ma byed cig ces bya ba ni theg pa chung ngu pa ltar 'khor ba'i chos gang las kyang yongs su 'da' bar ma byed cig ces bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don yang dag pa ji lta ba nyid du ston pa yin par bshad pa ste / de la chos gang las kyang yongs su 'da' bar ma byed cig ces bya ba ni theg pa chung ngu pa ltar 'khor ba'i chos gang las kyang yongs su 'da' bar ma byed cig ces bstan pa'o //
translated: that shows the suchness of the perfection of wisdom, which is that all phenomena are without acceptance and rejection.🔽“Do not pass beyond any dharma at all” teaches, “Do not pass beyond any dharma of cyclic existence at all, like those who are Hīnayānists.”

original: chos gang la yang gnas par ma byed cig ces bya ba ni theg pa chung ngu pa ltar mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos gang la yang gnas par ma byed cig ces bstan pa'o //
analyzed: chos gang la yang gnas par ma byed cig ces bya ba ni theg pa chung ngu pa ltar mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos gang la yang gnas par ma byed cig ces bstan pa'o //
translated: “Do not stand in any dharma at all” teaches, “Do not stand in any dharma of nirvāṇa at all, like those who are Hīnayānists.”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: @9a * // de ni 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la chos gang las 'da' bar bya ba'am /
analyzed: @9a * // de ni 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la chos gang las 'da' bar bya ba'am /
translated: Because in this perfection of wisdom there is no dharma at all that one should transcend or abide in.

original: gang la gnas par bya ba'i chos de med do zhes bya ba ni chos gang las kyang 'da' bar mi bya ba dang / chos gang la yang gnas par mi bya ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste ;
analyzed: gang la gnas par bya ba'i chos de med do zhes bya ba ni chos gang las kyang 'da' bar mi bya ba dang / chos gang la yang gnas par mi bya ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste ;
translated: This teaches the reason why one should not transcend any dharma and should not abide in any dharma.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don dang sbyar na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don dang sbyar na /
translated: When applied to the meaning of the perfection of wisdom,

original: don dam par 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos gnyi ga yang med pas 'da' bar bya ba'am gnas par bya ba med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos gnyi ga yang med pas 'da' bar bya ba'am gnas par bya ba med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: it teaches that ultimately, since both the dharmas of saṃsāra and nirvāṇa do not exist, there is nothing to transcend or abide in.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i chos gang yin pa de ni dngos po med pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'da' bar bya ba dang / gnas par bya ba'i chos gnyis ka dngos po med pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i chos gang yin pa de ni dngos po med pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'da' bar bya ba dang / gnas par bya ba'i chos gnyis ka dngos po med pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: The statement that which is empty of the intrinsic reality of all phenomena is a non-entity teaches the reason that both the phenomenon to be transcended and the phenomenon to abide are non-entities.

original: don dam par 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir dngos po med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir dngos po med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It teaches that ultimately all phenomena of cyclic existence and nirvana are non-entities because they are empty of intrinsic reality.

original: dngos po med pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste zhes bya ba ni de ltar dngos po med par rtogs pa de ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de la ni blang bar bya ba'am /
analyzed: dngos po med pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste zhes bya ba ni de ltar dngos po med par rtogs pa de ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de la ni blang bar bya ba'am /
translated: The statement that which is a non-entity is the perfection of wisdom teaches that the realization of non-entityness is the perfection of non-conceptual wisdom.

original: dor bar bya ba'am /🔽skye bar bya ba'am /
analyzed: dor bar bya ba'am /🔽skye bar bya ba'am /
translated: The statement in that perfection of wisdom there is nothing to be adopted or discarded, nothing to be diminished or augmented, nothing to be clarified or obscured teaches that the perfection of wisdom is free from the elaborations of the four extremes.

original: 'gag par bya ba'i chos gang yang med do zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de la ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos blang bar bya ba'am /🔽'khor ba'i chos dor bar bya ba rnam par rtog pa yang med la 'phags pa'i lam bskyed par bya ba'am /
analyzed: 'gag par bya ba'i chos gang yang med do zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de la ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos blang bar bya ba'am / 'khor ba'i chos dor bar bya ba rnam par rtog pa yang med la 'phags pa'i lam bskyed par bya ba'am /
translated: This shows that in that perfection of nonconceptual wisdom there is no conceptualization of a phenomenon of nirvāṇa to be adopted or a phenomenon of saṃsāra to be rejected.

original: 'phags pa'i lam gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams 'gag par bya bar rnam par rtog pa yang med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams 'gag par bya bar rnam par rtog pa yang med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: There is no conceptualization of the ārya path to be generated or the phenomena of afflictions that are counteragents to the ārya path to be stopped.🔽Kauśika, those sons of a good family or daughters of a good family who teach in that way do not teach a counterfeit perfection of wisdom.

original: koo shi ka de ltar ston pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan mi ston to zhes bya ba ni de ltar gong du bshad pa'i tshul du chos thams cad la blang dor med par ston
analyzed: koo shi ka de ltar ston pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan mi ston to zhes bya ba ni de ltar gong du bshad pa'i tshul du chos thams cad la blang dor med par ston
translated: This shows that in the manner explained above, all phenomena are taught to be without adoption and rejection.

original: pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don yang dag pa nyid ston pa yin te /
analyzed: pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don yang dag pa nyid ston pa yin te /
translated: This is the teaching of the perfect meaning of the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan ston pa ma yin no zhes bstan @9b pa'o ;
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan ston pa ma yin no zhes bstan @9b pa'o ;
translated: It is not the teaching of a counterfeit perfection of wisdom.

original: / koo shi ka de lta bas na rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mos de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: / koo shi ka de lta bas na rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mos de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don bstan par bya ste /
translated: Kauśika, therefore, a son of a good family or a daughter of a good family should teach the meaning of the perfection of wisdom in this way.

original: koo shi ka de ltar ston pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag gi bsod nams kyi phung po ni ches mang du 'phel gyi /
analyzed: koo shi ka de ltar ston pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag gi bsod nams kyi phung po ni ches mang du 'phel gyi /
translated: Kauśika, the merit of those sons of a good family or daughters of a good family who teach in this way increases much more.🔽It is not the case for those previous sons of a good family or daughters of a good family.”

original: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo snga ma dag ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de ltar mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don phyin ci ma log par bstan na bsod nams mang du 'phel
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo snga ma dag ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de ltar mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don phyin ci ma log par bstan na bsod nams mang du 'phel
translated: This is the increase of merit when the unmistaken meaning of the perfection of wisdom is taught by not apprehending signs and by not apprehending an object.

original: gyi mtshan ma dang bcas par dmigs pa dang bcas par bya ste /
analyzed: gyi mtshan ma dang bcas par dmigs pa dang bcas par bya ste /
translated: It is not the case when [the perfection of wisdom] is taught with signs and with an object.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i phyir gzugs brnyan gong du smos pa lta bur bstan na bsod nams mang du mi 'phel lo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i phyir gzugs brnyan gong du smos pa lta bur bstan na bsod nams mang du mi 'phel lo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that if it were taught as a reflection, as mentioned above, for the sake of the perfection of wisdom, then merit would not increase much.

original: koo shi ka gzhan yang 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can ji snyed pa de dag rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo la la zhig gis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la rab tu bkod na zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: koo shi ka gzhan yang 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can ji snyed pa de dag rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo la la zhig gis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la rab tu bkod na zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Moreover, Kauśika, if some son of a good family or daughter of a good family were to establish all the sentient beings of Jambudvīpa in the result of stream enterer, up to

analyzed: koo shi ka shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las rang byang chub rnams yod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can ji snyed yod pa dang / gling bzhi dang / stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams dang /

translated: the beings in the world systems of the great trichiliocosm, and the beings in as many world systems in each of the ten directions as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā River, were all to be established in the result of stream enterer,

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang byang chub la bkod pa'i bsod nams pas kyang /
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang byang chub la bkod pa'i bsod nams pas kyang /
translated: in the result of once-returner, in the result of non-returner, in the state of a worthy one, and in individual enlightenment,🔽compared to the merit of that, it is taught that the merit of teaching this perfection of wisdom extensively to others, in its meaning and in its words, and causing them to practice it, is greater.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di'i don dang / tshig tu ldan par gzhan la rgya cher bstan cing nyams su len du bcug pa bsod nams che ba'i phan yon bstan pa'o //

original: koo shi ka gzhan yang 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can ji snyed pa de dag rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo la la zhig gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par bskul ba byas nas zhes bya ba nas /

translated: Furthermore, Kauśika, if some son of a good family or daughter of a good family were to incite all the sentient beings of Jambudvīpa to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, and so on, up to

original: stong gnyis kyi 'jig rten gyi khams dang / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams dang / phyogs bcu'i phyogs re re zhing yang 'jig rten gyi khams gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi sems can ji snyed yod pa de dag thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bskul ba byas pa'i bsod nams pas kyang shes rab

translated: The merit of encouraging all the sentient beings of the two-thousand-fold world system, the three-thousand-fold world system, and the sentient beings of as many world systems as there are sand particles in the Ganges River in each of the ten directions to attain unsurpassable, perfect enlightenment is far surpassed by the merit of teaching this perfection of wisdom with its meaning and words, and by teaching it with instructions and making others practice it.

translated: The reason for the superiority of the merit is also like this.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi bsod nams ci byas pa ni bdag 'ba' zhig gi don du yongs su bsngo ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i rjes su yi rang ba'i bsod nams ni sems can gyi phyir yongs su bsngo bas /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi bsod nams ci byas pa ni bdag 'ba' zhig gi don du yongs su bsngo ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i rjes su yi rang ba'i bsod nams ni sems can gyi phyir yongs su bsngo bas /
translated: Whatever merit the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas create is dedicated for their own sake alone. The merit of the bodhisattva’s rejoicing is dedicated for the sake of sentient beings.

original: de'i phyir bsod nams khyad par du 'phags par che'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bsod nams khyad par du 'phags par che'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is taught that the merit is superior.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to Śakra, Lord of the Gods:

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa la 'di skad ces smras so zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa la 'di skad ces smras so zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Maitreya said to Subhūti, Subhūti, what you have said is excellent, excellent!

original: dmigs pa de dag rigs kyi bu de dag gis ji ltar mtshan mar byas pa de bzhin du dmigs @13a * //
analyzed: dmigs pa de dag rigs kyi bu de dag gis ji ltar mtshan mar byas pa de bzhin du dmigs @13a * //
translated: Those sons of good family have taken those objects as signs just as they are.

original: su yod pa yin nam zhes bya ba'i bar du ni gong du byang chub sems dpa' byams pas rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i bsod nams sems can thams cad dang thun mong du bya ste /
analyzed: su yod pa yin nam zhes bya ba'i bar du ni gong du byang chub sems dpa' byams pas rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i bsod nams sems can thams cad dang thun mong du bya ste /
translated: Up to Are those objects existent? is the teaching on the superiority of the merit of the dedication of the merit of rejoicing, which the bodhisattva Maitreya above made common to all sentient beings,

original: de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pa bsod nams khyad par du 'phags par che ba bstan pa la /
analyzed: de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pa bsod nams khyad par du 'phags par che ba bstan pa la /
translated: and the dedication of the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment of that merit by way of non-apprehension.

original: rab 'byor gyis gal bzung nas dris pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gal bzung nas dris pa ste /
translated: Subhūti, having taken that as a basis, asked a question.

original: phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das tshad med grangs med pa dag gis dang po byang chub tu thugs bskyed nas /
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das tshad med grangs med pa dag gis dang po byang chub tu thugs bskyed nas /
translated: The immeasurable, countless Bhagavān Buddhas of the ten directions, from the first generation of the mind of enlightenment,

original: mtha' yongs su mya ngan las 'das shing dam pa'i chos nub par gyur gyi bar du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis dge ba'i rtsa ba ci bsags pa de dag la byang chub sems dpa' rnams rjes su yi rang ba dang / nyan thos kyi theg pa pa rnams kyis sbyin pa byas pa dang /
analyzed: mtha' yongs su mya ngan las 'das shing dam pa'i chos nub par gyur gyi bar du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis dge ba'i rtsa ba ci bsags pa de dag la byang chub sems dpa' rnams rjes su yi rang ba dang / nyan thos kyi theg pa pa rnams kyis sbyin pa byas pa dang /
translated: Until the end of time, until the nirvana of all the buddhas and the disappearance of their holy Dharma, bodhisattvas rejoice in whatever sources of good the blessed buddhas have accumulated.🔽They rejoice in the generosity,

original: tshul khrims bsrungs pa dang / bsam gtan bsgoms pa'i bsod nams dang / 'phags pa nyan thos slob pa dang mi slob pa rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba zag pa med pa la rjes su yi rang ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i zag pa med pa'i phung po lnga la rjes su yi rang ba dang /
analyzed: tshul khrims bsrungs pa dang / bsam gtan bsgoms pa'i bsod nams dang / 'phags pa nyan thos slob pa dang mi slob pa rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba zag pa med pa la rjes su yi rang ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i zag pa med pa'i phung po lnga la rjes su yi rang ba dang /
translated: discipline and meditation of those who follow the Listeners' Vehicle, in the untainted sources of good of the noble listeners who are in training and beyond training and in the untainted five aggregates of the tathagatas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje chen po sems can la phan par bzhed pa la rjes su yi rang ba dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi dam pa'i chos tshad med grangs med pa rnams dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis dam pa'i chos de dag bstan pa la rjes su yi rang ba dang /🔽dam pa'i chos ji skad bstan pa la bslabs nas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje chen po sems can la phan par bzhed pa la rjes su yi rang ba dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi dam pa'i chos tshad med grangs med pa rnams dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis dam pa'i chos de dag bstan pa la rjes su yi rang ba dang / dam pa'i chos ji skad bstan pa la bslabs nas /
translated: rejoicing in the boundless and innumerable excellent teachings of the bhagavat buddhas and in the bhagavat’s teaching of those excellent teachings,🔽rejoicing in the attainment of the individual results of the shravakas, pratyekabuddhas, and bodhisattvas through training in the teachings as they were taught,

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis so so'i 'bras bu thob pa la rjes su yi rang ba dang / sems can gang dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa mngon sum du bzhugs pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba gang ji snyed bskyed pa de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus te /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis so so'i 'bras bu thob pa la rjes su yi rang ba dang / sems can gang dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa mngon sum du bzhugs pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba gang ji snyed bskyed pa de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus te /
translated: and rejoicing in all the roots of virtue that sentient beings have produced in the presence of the tathagatas, whether they are present or in nirvana,

original: bla na med pa'i rjes su yi rang bas de ltar rjes su yi rang ba'i bsod nams de yang sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas te /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i rjes su yi rang bas de ltar rjes su yi rang ba'i bsod nams de yang sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas te /
translated: Through rejoicing in the unsurpassed, the merit of such rejoicing is shared with all sentient beings.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs @13b su bsngos pa'i bsod nams kyi dngos po de dag dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'i 'phags pa de dag dang rjes su yi rang zhing bsod nams yongs su sngo bar byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de dag ji ltar grags shing tha snyad du btags pa de bzhin du yang dag par yod pa yin nam zhes rab
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs @13b su bsngos pa'i bsod nams kyi dngos po de dag dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'i 'phags pa de dag dang rjes su yi rang zhing bsod nams yongs su sngo bar byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de dag ji ltar grags shing tha snyad du btags pa de bzhin du yang dag par yod pa yin nam zhes rab
translated: And the merit of dedicating to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment the things that are the bases of merit, the noble beings who have generated the roots of virtue, and the bodhisattvas who rejoice and dedicate merit, is it really existent in the way it is renowned and conventionally designated?

original: 'byor gyis byang chub sems dpa' byams pa la dris pa ste /
analyzed: 'byor gyis byang chub sems dpa' byams pa la dris pa ste /
translated: Subhūti asked the bodhisattva Maitreya this question.

original: de dag ji ltar dmigs shing mtshan mar bzung ba bzhin du yod par gyur na ni chos thams cad dngos po yod cing dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag ji ltar dmigs shing mtshan mar bzung ba bzhin du yod par gyur na ni chos thams cad dngos po yod cing dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: If they were to exist in the way they are apprehended and taken to be real, the fault would be that all phenomena would be things that exist and are apprehended.

original: de ste med na ni dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag la rjes su yi rang zhing yongs su bsngor yang med de /
analyzed: de ste med na ni dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag la rjes su yi rang zhing yongs su bsngor yang med de /
translated: If they do not exist, then there is no rejoicing in those roots of virtue and no dedication of them.

original: de ltar dngos po med pa la rjes su yi rang zhing yongs su bsngos na /
analyzed: de ltar dngos po med pa la rjes su yi rang zhing yongs su bsngos na /
translated: Thus, if one rejoices and dedicates in the absence of things,

original: med pa la yod par sgro btags pas phyin ci log tu bltas par 'gyur ro zhes gal bzung ste dris pa'o //
analyzed: med pa la yod par sgro btags pas phyin ci log tu bltas par 'gyur ro zhes gal bzung ste dris pa'o //
translated: then, since one would be imputing existence to what is nonexistent, one would be viewing things in a distorted way.

original: byams pas smras pa /
analyzed: byams pas smras pa /
translated: Maitreya replied:

original: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu de dag gis ji ltar mtshan mar bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu de dag gis ji ltar mtshan mar bya ste /
translated: How could those sons of the lineage in the Bodhisattva Vehicle take those as signs?

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as they dedicate those roots of virtue to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment,

original: dngos po de dag dang / dmigs pa de dag dmigs su yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag dang / rjes su yi rang ba la sogs pa gong du smos pa de dag kun rdzob tu dmigs shing /
analyzed: dngos po de dag dang / dmigs pa de dag dmigs su yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag dang / rjes su yi rang ba la sogs pa gong du smos pa de dag kun rdzob tu dmigs shing /
translated: in the same way, those things and those objects of reference do not exist as objects of reference.

original: yongs su bsngo bar zad kyi don dam par dngos po yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su bsngo bar zad kyi don dam par dngos po yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It is only a dedication, but ultimately there is no existent thing.

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: gal te de ltar dngos po med pa dang dmigs pa med pas zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gal te de ltar dngos po med pa dang dmigs pa med pas zhes bya ba nas /
translated: “If it is like that, with no existent thing and no reference point,

original: de ltar de'i 'du shes phyin ci log tu ma gyur tam zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de ltar dngos po med pa yin na phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas de dag gis dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams la rjes su yi rang ba'i bsod nams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba de mi dmigs na ni bsngor yang med /
analyzed: de ltar de'i 'du shes phyin ci log tu ma gyur tam zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de ltar dngos po med pa yin na phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas de dag gis dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams la rjes su yi rang ba'i bsod nams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba de mi dmigs na ni bsngor yang med /
translated: up to ‘Is his perception not distorted?’ If it is like that, with no existent thing, then the blessed buddhas in the ten directions and those śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas do not reference the roots of virtue, and the merit of rejoicing in them is not dedicated to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bsngos na dngos po med pa la yod par rtogs pas /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bsngos na dngos po med pa la yod par rtogs pas /
translated: If it is dedicated by way of reference, then since an existent thing is conceived in a nonexistent thing,

original: mi rtag pa la rtag par lta ba dang / sdug bsngal ba la bde bar lta ba dang / bdag med pa la bdag tu lta ba dang / mi gtsang ba la gtsang bar lta ba @14a * //
analyzed: mi rtag pa la rtag par lta ba dang / sdug bsngal ba la bde bar lta ba dang / bdag med pa la bdag tu lta ba dang / mi gtsang ba la gtsang bar lta ba @14a * //
translated: Just as impermanence is seen as permanence, suffering as happiness, the non-self as self, and the impure as pure.

original: bzhin du / 'du shes dang lta ba phyin ci log tu mi 'gyur ram zhes brgal ba'o //
analyzed: bzhin du / 'du shes dang lta ba phyin ci log tu mi 'gyur ram zhes brgal ba'o //
translated: So, is it not the case that perception and view are distorted?

original: de ltar yin yang thams cad dngos po ji lta ba dang / dmigs pa ji lta bar byang chub kyang de bzhin sems kyang de bzhin zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de ltar yin yang thams cad dngos po ji lta ba dang / dmigs pa ji lta bar byang chub kyang de bzhin sems kyang de bzhin zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Even though this is so, if everything is just as it is, and awakening is just as it is, and the mind is just as it is,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyang de bzhin na ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba'i dngos po de ni gang zhig yin /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyang de bzhin na ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba'i dngos po de ni gang zhig yin /
translated: and if the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha are just as they are, then what is the thing that is dedicated to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?

original: dmigs pa de ni gang zhig yin /
analyzed: dmigs pa de ni gang zhig yin /
translated: What is the object of that dedication?

original: byang chub de ni gang zhig yin /
analyzed: byang chub de ni gang zhig yin /
translated: What is that awakening?

original: sems de ni gang zhig yin /
analyzed: sems de ni gang zhig yin /
translated: What is that mind?

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag ni gang zhig yin /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag ni gang zhig yin /
translated: What are those wholesome roots?

original: rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i bsod nams de ni gang zhig yin zhes bya ba'i bar du ni ji ltar tha snyad du btags shing mtshan mar bzung ba de bzhin du bla na med pa'i byang chub dang / yongs su bsngo ba'i sems dang /
analyzed: rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i bsod nams de ni gang zhig yin zhes bya ba'i bar du ni ji ltar tha snyad du btags shing mtshan mar bzung ba de bzhin du bla na med pa'i byang chub dang / yongs su bsngo ba'i sems dang /
translated: Up to the unsurpassed enlightenment, the mind of complete dedication,🔽the perfection of generosity, and so on, up to the eighteen unshared qualities of the Buddha, all those things are, just as they are designated in conventional terms and apprehended as having defining characteristics,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la thug gi bar du dngos po de dag thams cad ji ltar tha snyad du btags shing mtshan mar bzung ba de bzhin du dngos po yod pa zhig yin na
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la thug gi bar du dngos po de dag thams cad ji ltar tha snyad du btags shing mtshan mar bzung ba de bzhin du dngos po yod pa zhig yin na
translated: if they were things that existed in reality,

original: yongs su bsngos pa'i dngos po dang / dmigs pa dang / byang chub dang / sems dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po de dag rang bzhin gyis grub cing yod pa gang yin zhes dris pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su bsngos pa'i dngos po dang / dmigs pa dang / byang chub dang / sems dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po de dag rang bzhin gyis grub cing yod pa gang yin zhes dris pa'o //
translated: then what is the dedicated thing, the object of observation, enlightenment, the mind, the roots of virtue, and the merit of the thing that is the basis of rejoicing that is naturally established and exists?”

original: byams pas smras pa /
analyzed: byams pas smras pa /
translated: Maitreya said,

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod spyod pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod spyod pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: If bodhisattvas practice the six perfections,

original: skye ba'i tshul gyis ma yin no //
analyzed: skye ba'i tshul gyis ma yin no //
translated: not by way of origination,🔽not by way of cessation,

original: 'gags pa'i tshul gyis ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du ni byang chub sems dpa' pha rol tu phyin pa drug la goms par spyad pa /
analyzed: 'gags pa'i tshul gyis ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du ni byang chub sems dpa' pha rol tu phyin pa drug la goms par spyad pa /
translated: then, having trained in the practice of the six perfections,

original: sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur byas pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur byas pa /
translated: having served many buddhas,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba skyed par gyur pa chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa la goms par bslabs pa dag ni chos thams cad mtshan ma med cing gnyis su med par rtogs pas /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba skyed par gyur pa chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa la goms par bslabs pa dag ni chos thams cad mtshan ma med cing gnyis su med par rtogs pas /
translated: having generated the roots of virtue, having trained in the familiarization with all phenomena being empty of intrinsic nature,🔽since they realize all phenomena to be without signs and non-dual,

original: de ltar mtshan mar byas shing yongs su bsngo bar mi byed pa'i phyir de dag la ni gal bzung du med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar mtshan mar byas shing yongs su bsngo bar mi byed pa'i phyir de dag la ni gal bzung du med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: since they do not dedicate by way of signs, it is taught that they are not seized by any demons.

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' de dag pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod spyod pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' de dag pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod spyod pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba nas /
translated: If those bodhisattvas do not practice the six perfections,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid @14b kyis stong pa'i chos rnams de ltar bstan pa ni theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i mdun du mi bshad do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa pha rol tu
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid @14b kyis stong pa'i chos rnams de ltar bstan pa ni theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i mdun du mi bshad do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa pha rol tu
translated: The teaching of phenomena as empty of their own characteristics should not be explained in the presence of bodhisattvas who have newly entered the vehicle.

original: phyin pa drug la goms par ma spyad pa /
analyzed: phyin pa drug la goms par ma spyad pa /
translated: This is because bodhisattvas who have newly entered the vehicle have not trained in the six perfections,

original: sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur ma byas pa dge ba'i rtsa ba cher ma bskyed pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur ma byas pa dge ba'i rtsa ba cher ma bskyed pa /
translated: have not served many buddhas, have not created much merit,

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su ma bzung ba /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su ma bzung ba /
translated: have not been taken hold of by a spiritual friend,🔽and have not trained well in the realization that all phenomena are empty of their own nature.

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong par rtogs par bya ba la legs par ma bslabs pa zhig yin na ni dngos po de dag mtshan ma dang bcas shing dmigs pa dang bcas par yongs su bsngo yang srid kyis /
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong par rtogs par bya ba la legs par ma bslabs pa zhig yin na ni dngos po de dag mtshan ma dang bcas shing dmigs pa dang bcas par yongs su bsngo yang srid kyis /
translated: It is possible that they will dedicate those things with signs and references.

original: de dag la phyin ci log tu lta ba'i skyon du 'gyur bas /
analyzed: de dag la phyin ci log tu lta ba'i skyon du 'gyur bas /
translated: But since they would be viewing those things incorrectly,

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' yongs su ma dag pa theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa'i mdun du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du sangs rgyas kyi chos ming gis smos
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' yongs su ma dag pa theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa'i mdun du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du sangs rgyas kyi chos ming gis smos
translated: Thus, in the presence of a bodhisattva who is impure and newly entered into the vehicle, one should not explain the profound and non-apprehensible Buddha-qualities, such as the perfection of wisdom, up to and including omniscience, by their names.

original: pa de dag zab cing dmigs su med pa de lta bur bshad par mi bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: pa de dag zab cing dmigs su med pa de lta bur bshad par mi bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni de la dad pa tsam mam /
analyzed: de ni de la dad pa tsam mam /
translated: Because for that one, even that mere faith,

original: dga' ba tsam mam /
analyzed: dga' ba tsam mam /
translated: mere joy,

original: mos pa tsam mam /🔽gus pa tsam zhig yod pa de yang med par gyur pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la chos zab mo bstan na snod du ma gyur pas yid mi ches shing dad pa 'bri ba la sogs
analyzed: mos pa tsam mam / gus pa tsam zhig yod pa de yang med par gyur pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la chos zab mo bstan na snod du ma gyur pas yid mi ches shing dad pa 'bri ba la sogs
translated: mere aspiration,🔽mere respect, will be lost.

original: pa'i skyon du gyur pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: pa'i skyon du gyur pa bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation of the fault of a decrease in faith and so on, due to being an unsuitable vessel, when the profound Dharma is taught to bodhisattvas who are newly entered into the vehicle.

translated: The passage beginning “The mind, Maitreya, by which one rejoices and dedicates those roots of virtue to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening” teaches the reason why it is not reasonable to dedicate roots of virtue with signs and with objective references.

original: yongs su bsngo bar bya ba'i sems de ni zad cing 'gags pa med de rnam par gyur zhes bya ba ni bla na med pa'i byang chub tu dmigs shing yongs su sngo bar byed pa'i sems de ni skad cig ma'i rang bzhin te /

translated: The passage beginning “The mind that is to be dedicated is not exhausted, ceased, or transformed” means that the mind that is dedicated to unsurpassed awakening is momentary in nature.

original: zad cing 'gags la dngos po med de /
analyzed: zad cing 'gags la dngos po med de /

analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa byas pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang skad cig ma ste /

translated: Thus, if the mind of rejoicing, the things such as generosity,

translated: When the mind of dedication arises, the mind of rejoicing has ceased and does not exist. Therefore, it is not possible for the mind to dedicate the mind.🔽The nature of the mind cannot be dedicated.

translated: Thus, the nature of the mind is not established as existing ultimately. Since it does not exist, it is taught that it is not possible to dedicate a non-entity.

analyzed: dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: If a bodhisattva great being, when practicing the perfection of wisdom,

analyzed: gal te de ltar yongs su bsngo na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni don dam par pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid
translated: and so on up to: if one dedicates in this way, it becomes a dedication to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: de dag la mtshan mar mi 'dzin par kun rdzob tu rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i bsod nams bla na med pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos na bsod nams yongs su bsngo ba skyon med cing yongs su dag par yongs su bsngos par 'gyur ro🔽zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de dag la mtshan mar mi 'dzin par kun rdzob tu rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i bsod nams bla na med pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos na bsod nams yongs su bsngo ba skyon med cing yongs su dag par yongs su bsngos par 'gyur ro🔽zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: If one rejoices in the conventional without apprehending characteristics and dedicates the merit of that rejoicing to unsurpassed enlightenment, then the dedication of merit becomes faultless and pure.

original: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis gnas brtan rab 'byor la smras pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis gnas brtan rab 'byor la smras pa zhes bya ba nas /

translated: The bodhisattvas who are pure, as explained above, should realize with wisdom that ultimately all phenomena are devoid of entityness,

analyzed: thabs kyis kun rdzob tu dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag bla na med pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos na /
translated: and with skillful means, they should dedicate those roots of virtue to unsurpassed enlightenment in the conventional sense.

original: bsngo ba la skyon med cing yongs su dag par 'gyur na /
analyzed: bsngo ba la skyon med cing yongs su dag par 'gyur na /
translated: If they dedicate in that way, their dedication will be faultless and pure.

original: theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' thabs dang shes rab tu mi ldan pa rnams kyis chos thams cad dngos po med par bstan pa 'di thos nas /

analyzed: 'jigs shing skrag par 'gyur ram mi 'gyur /

translated: Śakra asks Subhūti how the roots of virtue and the meritorious deeds associated with rejoicing in them are to be dedicated to unsurpassed enlightenment.

analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa la dmigs nas /

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba dmigs su med pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i tshul gyis yongs su bsngo ba'i thabs bstan pa 'khor thams cad kyi yid ches par bya ba'i phyir byams pa la dmigs nas smras pa bstan pa ste /

translated: In order to show the method of dedicating the roots of virtue by way of the non-apprehension and signlessness, he spoke, focusing on Maitreya, in order to inspire confidence in the entire retinue.

translated: Kauśika, if that bodhisattva mahāsattva who has newly entered the vehicle practices the perfection of wisdom and also apprehends that perfection of wisdom by way of non-apprehension and by way of signlessness, and so on up to
