analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la spyod cing /
translated: practices the knowledge of all aspects,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de yang mi dmigs pa'i tshul dang / mtshan ma med pa'i tshul gyis 'dzin par byed na zhes bya ba'i bar du ni dge ba'i rtsa ba dang rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po de dag bla na med pa'i byang chub tu ji ltar bsngo ba'i thabs bstan pa
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de yang mi dmigs pa'i tshul dang / mtshan ma med pa'i tshul gyis 'dzin par byed na zhes bya ba'i bar du ni dge ba'i rtsa ba dang rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po de dag bla na med pa'i byang chub tu ji ltar bsngo ba'i thabs bstan pa
translated: The section from “that knowledge of all aspects” up to “grasps at it in a manner of nonapprehending and a manner of signlessness” teaches the method of how to dedicate those roots of virtue and the bases of meritorious action endowed with rejoicing to unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: ste / pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos de dag thams cad don dam par rang bzhin med pas de dag la mi dmigs shing mtshan mar mi 'dzin par byas la /
analyzed: ste / pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos de dag thams cad don dam par rang bzhin med pas de dag la mi dmigs shing mtshan mar mi 'dzin par byas la /
translated: All those phenomena, from the six perfections up to the knowledge of all aspects, are ultimately without inherent existence, so one should not apprehend them and should not grasp at their signs.

original: kun rdzob tu de dag la spyod cing yongs su bzung nas de ltar spyod pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag bla na med pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos na bsod nams bsngo ba skyon med cing yongs su dag par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu de dag la spyod cing yongs su bzung nas de ltar spyod pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag bla na med pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos na bsod nams bsngo ba skyon med cing yongs su dag par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: If one practices in this way, and dedicates the roots of virtue of such practice to unsurpassed enlightenment, then the dedication of merit will be faultless and pure.

original: des shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mos pa mang ba dang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: des shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mos pa mang ba dang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Through this, one will have much interest in the perfection of wisdom, and so on, up to

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la mos pa mang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la mos pa mang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: one will have much interest in the knowledge of all aspects.🔽One will be assisted by spiritual friends.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de ltar thabs dang shes rab tu ldan pas don dam par mtshan ma dang dmigs pa med par yang rtogs la /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de ltar thabs dang shes rab tu ldan pas don dam par mtshan ma dang dmigs pa med par yang rtogs la /
translated: In this way, by being endowed with method and wisdom, one realizes that ultimately there are no signs or reference points.

original: kun rdzob tu chos de dag la spyod cing dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su dag par bsngo na chos zab mos 'jigs shing skrag pa med pas pha rol @17a * //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu chos de dag la spyod cing dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su dag par bsngo na chos zab mos 'jigs shing skrag pa med pas pha rol @17a * //
translated: However, conventionally, one practices these teachings and dedicates the roots of virtue to purity. Since one is not afraid of the profound teachings, one is🔽not afraid of the profound teachings.

original: tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad la the tshom dang nem nur med pas dad pa dang mos pa che bar 'gyur ba dang / chos zab mo'i snod du gyur pas dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin par 'gyur ba'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
analyzed: tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad la the tshom dang nem nur med pas dad pa dang mos pa che bar 'gyur ba dang / chos zab mo'i snod du gyur pas dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin par 'gyur ba'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
translated: The benefits are shown by the absence of doubt and uncertainty with regard to all the elements of enlightenment, from the six perfections up to the knowledge of all aspects, and by the great faith and interest that results from that, and by the fact that, as a vessel for the profound Dharma, one is assisted by spiritual friends.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen de dag kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag don dang ldan yi ge dang ldan par ston par 'gyur te zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen de dag kyang pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag don dang ldan yi ge dang ldan par ston par 'gyur te zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Those spiritual friends will teach these six perfections, both the meaning and the words.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par chud kyi bar du ci nas kyang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang bral bar mi 'gyur ba de ltar ston to zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de ltar chos zab mo'i snod du gyur pa'i byang chub sems
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par chud kyi bar du ci nas kyang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang bral bar mi 'gyur ba de ltar ston to zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de ltar chos zab mo'i snod du gyur pa'i byang chub sems
translated: They will teach in such a way that, until one enters into the certainty of the bodhisattvas, one will not be separated from the eighteen special qualities of the Buddhas.

original: dpa' de la dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams kyang yid ches pas /
analyzed: dpa' de la dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams kyang yid ches pas /
translated: And because of that, the spiritual masters will have confidence in them.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la thug gi bar du don dang tshig tu ldan par lung dang man ngag ma nor bar ston par 'gyur ba'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la thug gi bar du don dang tshig tu ldan par lung dang man ngag ma nor bar ston par 'gyur ba'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
translated: And they will teach them the Dharma, both the meaning and the words, without error, from the six perfections up to the eighteen distinctive qualities of a buddha.

original: de la bdud kyi las rnams kyang ston par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la bdud kyi las rnams kyang ston par 'gyur te /
translated: And they will teach them the works of Mara.

original: des bdud kyi las de dag thos nas 'grib pa'am 'phel ba med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: des bdud kyi las de dag thos nas 'grib pa'am 'phel ba med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: When they hear about those works of Mara, they will neither decrease nor increase.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen de dag theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de dag la dge ba'i bar chad du 'gyur ba'i bdud kyi las rnams ji ltar 'byung ba yang ston par 'gyur la /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen de dag theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de dag la dge ba'i bar chad du 'gyur ba'i bdud kyi las rnams ji ltar 'byung ba yang ston par 'gyur la /
translated: Those spiritual masters will teach those bodhisattvas who are new to the vehicle about the works of Mara that will arise as obstacles to their virtue.

original: theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis bdud kyi las de dag thos na yang don dam par bdud kyi las de dag nyid kyang dngos po med pa dang / bdag nyid la yang bdud kyis glags btsal ba'i skyon med pa'i phyir skrag cing zhum par yang mi 'gyur la bdud kyi las dngos po med par rtogs pas bsnyems shing nga rgyal yang med par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis bdud kyi las de dag thos na yang don dam par bdud kyi las de dag nyid kyang dngos po med pa dang / bdag nyid la yang bdud kyis glags btsal ba'i skyon med pa'i phyir skrag cing zhum par yang mi 'gyur la bdud kyi las dngos po med par rtogs pas bsnyems shing nga rgyal yang med par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: When those bodhisattvas who are new to the vehicle hear about those deeds of Mara, they do not become frightened or discouraged, because ultimately those very deeds of Mara are unreal, and because they themselves are free from the fault of being vulnerable to Mara. And they do not become arrogant or proud, because they understand that the deeds of Mara are unreal.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar bdud kyi las de dag la ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya ba ni 'grib pa'am 'phel ba med pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar bdud kyi las de dag la ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya ba ni 'grib pa'am 'phel ba med pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa'o //
translated: Because those deeds of Mara have no intrinsic nature. This shows the reason for the absence of decrease or increase.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par chud kyi bar du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur te zhes bya @17b ba la sogs pa ni de ltar snod du gyur pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par chud kyi bar du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur te zhes bya @17b ba la sogs pa ni de ltar snod du gyur pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang
translated: Thus, that Bodhisattva who has become a suitable vessel will be in the company of the Blessed Buddhas,

original: 'grogs par 'gyur ba dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la bsnyen bkur byed cing /
analyzed: 'grogs par 'gyur ba dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la bsnyen bkur byed cing /
translated: and he will serve those Blessed Buddhas,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag gis nam yang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sar mi ltung zhing /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag gis nam yang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sar mi ltung zhing /
translated: and he will plant wholesome roots, and by those wholesome roots he will never fall into the states of existence of Disciples and Pratyekabuddhas,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan par 'gyur ba'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rigs phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan par 'gyur ba'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
translated: and he will be endowed with the perfection of the Bodhisattva lineage.

original: koo shi ka gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa la gsar du zhugs pas zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: koo shi ka gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa la gsar du zhugs pas zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Moreover, Kausika, a Bodhisattva, a great being, who is a beginner,

original: sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas te /
translated: and he should dedicate it to the supreme enlightenment, having made it into a wholesome root shared by all beings.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpas phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa rnams kyi
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpas phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa rnams kyi
translated: From the phrase “I dedicate this to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening” up to the phrase “the bodhisattvas who have newly entered the vehicle should rejoice in the roots of virtue of the bhagavān buddhas of the ten directions and their śrāvaka saṅghas,”

original: bsod nams kyi mdzad pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dang nyan thos kyi dge 'dun de dag la rgyal rigs che zhing mtho ba la sogs pa 'og min gyi lha'i bar du 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams kyi mi dang lha rnams kyis dge ba'i rtsa ba ci bsags pa de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus te /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi mdzad pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dang nyan thos kyi dge 'dun de dag la rgyal rigs che zhing mtho ba la sogs pa 'og min gyi lha'i bar du 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams kyi mi dang lha rnams kyis dge ba'i rtsa ba ci bsags pa de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus te /
translated: the roots of virtue that the bhagavān buddhas and their śrāvaka saṅghas have accumulated, and the roots of virtue that the kṣatriyas of the highest caste and so on up to the Akaniṣṭha devas have accumulated in the desire realm and the form realm, all of those are gathered together.

original: bla na med pa'i rjes su yi rang bar byas la /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i rjes su yi rang bar byas la /
translated: Rejoicing in those,

original: de ltar rjes su yi rang ba'i bsod nams kyang sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas te bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar bya ba bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar rjes su yi rang ba'i bsod nams kyang sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas te bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar bya ba bstan pa ste /
translated: Thus, the merit of rejoicing is also made common to all sentient beings and is dedicated to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: de la spros pa'i tshul chad par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la spros pa'i tshul chad par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the teaching. Therein, “the mode of conceptual elaboration is cut off” means that the Lord Buddhas are free from the conceptual elaborations of discursive thought.

original: tshig gis lam nyams pa mi mnga' ba zhes bya ba ni de ltar rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' yang sngon gyi smon lam gyi shugs kyis sems can gyi don du chos 'chad pa'i gsung rnam pa sna tshogs rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung ba la bya'o //
analyzed: tshig gis lam nyams pa mi mnga' ba zhes bya ba ni de ltar rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' yang sngon gyi smon lam gyi shugs kyis sems can gyi don du chos 'chad pa'i gsung rnam pa sna tshogs rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung ba la bya'o //
translated: “The path of words is not lost” means that, although they are free from discursive thought in this way, by the power of their former aspirations, the various utterances explaining the Dharma arise uninterruptedly for the sake of sentient beings.

original: khur bor ba zhes bya ba ni phung po'i khur dang / nyon mongs pa'i khur dang / yid dam bcas pa'i khur dang / brtson 'grus kyi khur rnams blangs @18a * //
analyzed: khur bor ba zhes bya ba ni phung po'i khur dang / nyon mongs pa'i khur dang / yid dam bcas pa'i khur dang / brtson 'grus kyi khur rnams blangs @18a * //
translated: The laying down of the burden refers to the burden of the aggregates, the burden of afflictions, the burden of vows, and the burden of striving.

original: ba mthar phyin cing bor ba la bya ste /
analyzed: ba mthar phyin cing bor ba la bya ste /
translated: The phrase “having laid down the burden” refers to the completion and laying down of the burden of the heaps, the burden of the mental afflictions, the burden of one’s vows, and the burden of striving.

original: gleng gzhi'i le'u las khur bor ba bstan pa'i skabs su bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gleng gzhi'i le'u las khur bor ba bstan pa'i skabs su bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: This is explained in the chapter on the introduction.

original: grong gi tsher ma rab tu bsal ba zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo phal pa grong mi'i chos ngan pa lus dang ngag yid kyis nyes par spyod pa bdag dang gzhan la gnod pa'i chos can tsher ma dang 'dra ba rnams spangs pa la bya'o //
analyzed: grong gi tsher ma rab tu bsal ba zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo phal pa grong mi'i chos ngan pa lus dang ngag yid kyis nyes par spyod pa bdag dang gzhan la gnod pa'i chos can tsher ma dang 'dra ba rnams spangs pa la bya'o //
translated: The phrase “having removed the thorns of the village” means that he has abandoned the evil conduct of ordinary persons who live in villages, which is conduct that is harmful to both oneself and others and that is similar to thorns.

original: srid pa kun du sbyor ba yongs su chad pa zhes bya ba ni log par lta ba la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyis khams gsum du skye zhing sbyor bar 'gyur ba rnams spangs shing rgyun bcad pa la bya ste /
analyzed: srid pa kun du sbyor ba yongs su chad pa zhes bya ba ni log par lta ba la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyis khams gsum du skye zhing sbyor bar 'gyur ba rnams spangs shing rgyun bcad pa la bya ste /
translated: The phrase “having severed the fetters that bind one to existence” means that he has abandoned and severed the mental afflictions, such as wrong views, that cause one to be born and that bind one to the three realms of existence.

original: gleng gzhi'i le'u las srid par kun tu sbyor ba yongs su zad pa bstan pa'i skabs su zhib tu bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gleng gzhi'i le'u las srid par kun tu sbyor ba yongs su zad pa bstan pa'i skabs su zhib tu bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: This is as explained in detail in the chapter on the introduction, in the section on the complete exhaustion of the fetters of existence.

original: yang dag par yongs su mkhyen pas thugs shin tu rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags yan chad ma lus par spangs shing ye shes rnam par dag pa la bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par yongs su mkhyen pas thugs shin tu rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags yan chad ma lus par spangs shing ye shes rnam par dag pa la bya'o //
translated: As for his mind is completely liberated through right complete understanding, this refers to the complete elimination of all the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience, including their traces, and to the purity of gnosis.

original: rjes su yi rang ba'i rab dam pa mchog ces bya ba la sogs pa ni don dam par chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i tshul du rtogs par byas nas kun rdzob tu de dag la rjes su yi rang ba ni bla na med pa'i rjes su yi rang🔽ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rjes su yi rang ba'i rab dam pa mchog ces bya ba la sogs pa ni don dam par chos thams cad mi dmigs pa'i tshul du rtogs par byas nas kun rdzob tu de dag la rjes su yi rang ba ni bla na med pa'i rjes su yi rang ba zhes bya ste /
translated: As for the most excellent, sublime rejoicing, and so on, having realized all phenomena in the ultimate sense in the manner of non-apprehension, to rejoice in them in the conventional sense is called the unsurpassed rejoicing.

original: rab dang dam pa la sogs pa ni bla na med pa'i rnam grangs su zad do //
analyzed: rab dang dam pa la sogs pa ni bla na med pa'i rnam grangs su zad do //
translated: The terms most excellent, sublime, and so on, are all synonyms for unsurpassed.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so zhes bya ba nas /🔽lta ba phyin ci log tu mi 'gyur ba yin zhes bya ba'i bar du ni theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bsod nams kyi rjes su yi rang ba dang / bsod nams yongs su bsngo ba skyon med cing yongs su dag par bya ba zhib tu bshad pa'i gleng bslangs pa'i phyir de ltar theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de rjes su yi rang zhing yongs su bsngo ba'i tshe sangs rgyas bcom ldan
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so zhes bya ba nas / lta ba phyin ci log tu mi 'gyur ba yin zhes bya ba'i bar du ni theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bsod nams kyi rjes su yi rang ba dang / bsod nams yongs su bsngo ba skyon med cing yongs su dag par bya ba zhib tu bshad pa'i gleng bslangs pa'i phyir de ltar theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de rjes su yi rang zhing yongs su bsngo ba'i tshe sangs rgyas bcom ldan
translated: Then the bodhisattva great being Maitreya said to the venerable Subhūti...🔽... up to it will not become a mistaken view.

original: 'das de dag dang / nyan thos kyi dge 'dun de dag dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag ma bsams par ni yongs su bsngo bar yang mi rung /
analyzed: 'das de dag dang / nyan thos kyi dge 'dun de dag dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag ma bsams par ni yongs su bsngo bar yang mi rung /
translated: In order to explain in detail the faultless and pure rejoicing in merit and the dedication of merit of the bodhisattvas who have newly entered the vehicle, the bodhisattvas who have newly entered the vehicle, when rejoicing and dedicating in that way, should not dedicate the buddhas, the blessed ones, the śrāvaka saṅghas, and those roots of virtue without having contemplated them.

original: de dag bsams te yongs su bsngos na ni dngos por dmigs shing mtshan mar bzung na 'du shes @18b phyin ci log dang / sems phyin ci log dang / lta ba phyin ci log tu ji ltar mi 'gyur zhes gal bzung ste dris pa'o //
analyzed: de dag bsams te yongs su bsngos na ni dngos por dmigs shing mtshan mar bzung na 'du shes @18b phyin ci log dang / sems phyin ci log dang / lta ba phyin ci log tu ji ltar mi 'gyur zhes gal bzung ste dris pa'o //
translated: If one dedicates after thinking of them, then how could one not have a distorted perception, a distorted mind, and a distorted view, since one would be observing and apprehending them as real things?

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: byams pa gal te zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: byams pa gal te zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Maitreya, if...

original: lta ba phyin ci log tu 'gyur ba med do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: lta ba phyin ci log tu 'gyur ba med do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: ... there would be no distorted view.

original: theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpas yongs su bsngo ba skyon med pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpas yongs su bsngo ba skyon med pa bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches that a bodhisattva who is a beginner should dedicate without fault.

original: kun rdzob tu sangs rgyas dang nyan thos dang dge ba'i rtsa ba dang yongs su bsngo ba'i sems rnams la sems shing rtogs kyang /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu sangs rgyas dang nyan thos dang dge ba'i rtsa ba dang yongs su bsngo ba'i sems rnams la sems shing rtogs kyang /
translated: Although one thinks about and understands the buddhas, the roots of virtue, and the mind of dedication in a conventional sense,

original: don dam par de dag thams cad dngos po med par khong du chud pas /
analyzed: don dam par de dag thams cad dngos po med par khong du chud pas /
translated: ultimately one should realize that all of them are unreal things.

original: dge ba mdzad pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dang / 'phags pa nyan thos dang / de dag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang yongs su sngo bar byed pa'i bdag gis sems rnams la dngos por lta zhing mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i 'du shes med pa kun rdzob tu thabs mkhas pas yongs su bsngos na /

translated: Thus, a bodhisattva great being should dedicate the roots of virtue.

original: ba rnams la sems pa'i sems gang yin pa dang / yongs su bsngo ba'i sems gang yin pa dang / gang du bsngo bar bya ba'i bla na med pa'i byang chub kyang don dam par zad cing dngos po med par rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: ba rnams la sems pa'i sems gang yin pa dang / yongs su bsngo ba'i sems gang yin pa dang / gang du bsngo bar bya ba'i bla na med pa'i byang chub kyang don dam par zad cing dngos po med par rtogs par bya ste /
translated: The mind that thinks of the blessed buddhas, the noble disciples, and the roots of virtue, the mind that dedicates, and the unsurpassed enlightenment to which the dedication is made should all be understood to be ultimately exhausted and unreal.

original: kun rdzob tu yongs su bsngo bar bya ba bstan pa ste ;
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yongs su bsngo bar bya ba bstan pa ste ;
translated: The teaching on the conventional dedication🔽The reality of that very mind is also that.

original: sems de nyid kyi chos nyid kyang de yin pa dang zhes bya ba ni yongs su bsngo ba'i sems de'i rang bzhin yang zad cing med pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems de nyid kyi chos nyid kyang de yin pa dang zhes bya ba ni yongs su bsngo ba'i sems de'i rang bzhin yang zad cing med pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The nature of that mind that dedicates is also exhausted and nonexistent.

original: chos gang la yongs su bsngo ba'i chos de'i chos nyid kyang de yin no zhes bya ba ni bla na med pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba'i byang chub tu yang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: chos gang la yongs su bsngo ba'i chos de'i chos nyid kyang de yin no zhes bya ba ni bla na med pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba'i byang chub tu yang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This teaches that the dedication to unsurpassed enlightenment is also the nature of non-entityness.

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis thugs dang po bskyed nas zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis thugs dang po bskyed nas zhes bya ba nas /
translated: If a bodhisattva great being, from the time of arousing the mind of enlightenment up to sitting on the seat of enlightenment, were to dedicate all those wholesome roots to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, but with a mind that is not liberated,🔽this is the unsurpassed dedication of a bodhisattva great being.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i yongs su bsngo ba'i bla na med pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis dang po byang chub tu thugs bskyed nas /
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i yongs su bsngo ba'i bla na med pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis dang po byang chub tu thugs bskyed nas /
translated: This teaches that the dedication of the buddhas of the three times, from the time of first arousing the mind of enlightenment up to sitting on the seat of enlightenment,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba ji snyed cig mdzad pa dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis dge ba'i rtsa ba ji snyed cig mdzad pa dang / so so'i skye bo lha dang mi la sogs pa'i rigs su gtogs pa rnams kyis 'phags pa de dag la dge ba'i rtsa ba ji snyed cig bskyed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus te rjes su yi rang ba'i mchog dam pa bla
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba ji snyed cig mdzad pa dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis dge ba'i rtsa ba ji snyed cig mdzad pa dang / so so'i skye bo lha dang mi la sogs pa'i rigs su gtogs pa rnams kyis 'phags pa de dag la dge ba'i rtsa ba ji snyed cig bskyed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus te rjes su yi rang ba'i mchog dam pa bla
translated: Whatever roots of virtue the Buddhas have created, whatever roots of virtue the Shravakas and Pratyekabuddhas have created, whatever roots of virtue the ordinary beings, gods, humans, and so forth, have created in relation to those noble beings, gather all those roots of virtue together and rejoice in them with the most sublime, most excellent, and most exalted rejoicing.

original: na med pas rjes su yi rang nas de ltar rjes su yi rang ba'i bsod nams de yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos la don dam par dge ba mdzad pa'i 'phags pa rnams dang / so so'i skye bo rnams dang /
analyzed: na med pas rjes su yi rang nas de ltar rjes su yi rang ba'i bsod nams de yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos la don dam par dge ba mdzad pa'i 'phags pa rnams dang / so so'i skye bo rnams dang /
translated: Having rejoiced in that way, dedicate the merit of that rejoicing toward unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams dang / rjes su yi rang ba'i sems dang / yongs su bsngo ba'i sems dang / gong du yongs su bsngo ba'i byang chub kyi chos de dag thams cad zad cing 'gags la dngos po med de rang bzhin gyis stong par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams dang / rjes su yi rang ba'i sems dang / yongs su bsngo ba'i sems dang / gong du yongs su bsngo ba'i byang chub kyi chos de dag thams cad zad cing 'gags la dngos po med de rang bzhin gyis stong par shes par bya ste /
translated: The roots of virtue, the mind of sympathetic joy, the mind of complete dedication, and the qualities of enlightenment that are completely dedicated to the highest—all of these should be understood to be exhausted, ceased, and non-existent, and empty of essence.

original: kun rdzob tu thabs mkhas pas yongs su bsngo na bla na med pa'i yongs su bsngos par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu thabs mkhas pas yongs su bsngo na bla na med pa'i yongs su bsngos par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: If, on the conventional level, one dedicates with skillful means, then that is the highest dedication.

original: chos kyis @19b chos yongs su bsngo bar mi bya ste zhes bya ba ni yongs su bsngo bar bya ba dang / yongs su sngo bar byed pa'i chos de dag thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir stong pas stong pa la bsngor med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos kyis @19b chos yongs su bsngo bar mi bya ste zhes bya ba ni yongs su bsngo bar bya ba dang / yongs su sngo bar byed pa'i chos de dag thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir stong pas stong pa la bsngor med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Dharma does not dedicate Dharma” means that all of these dharmas that are dedicated and the dharmas that dedicate them are empty of essence, and so the meaning is that “emptiness does not dedicate to emptiness.”

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po mngon par 'du bya ba de /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po mngon par 'du bya ba de /
translated: If a bodhisattva great being does not dedicate that activity which is the basis of merit

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams kyis dben par shes te zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams kyis dben par shes te zhes bya ba nas /
translated: From knowing that they are empty of the aggregates, elements, and sense-fields up to🔽Subhuti, in that way the bodhisattva-mahāsattva dedicates that creation of a basis of merit to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.🔽 This teaches that the creation of a basis of merit is dedicated without fault if one dedicates it conventionally, knowing that ultimately the aggregates, elements, sense-fields, and so on up to the eighteen unshared qualities of a buddha are empty of those phenomena.

original: rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po mngon par 'du bya ba de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du ni bsod nams bya
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po mngon par 'du bya ba de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du ni bsod nams bya
translated: From not endowed with the nature of those phenomena up to the bodhisattva-mahāsattva dedicates that creation of a basis of merit to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.🔽 This teaches that the dedication is completely pure without fault if one dedicates it conventionally, knowing that ultimately the aggregates, elements, sense-fields, and so on up to the eighteen unshared qualities of a buddha are empty of those phenomena.🔽From Subhuti, in that way the bodhisattva-mahāsattva dedicates that creation of a basis of merit to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: ba'i dngos po mngon par 'du bya ba de don dam par phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la thug gi bar gyi chos rnams kyis dben par shes te /
analyzed: ba'i dngos po mngon par 'du bya ba de don dam par phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la thug gi bar gyi chos rnams kyis dben par shes te /
translated: This teaches that the dedication is completely pure without fault if one dedicates it conventionally, knowing that ultimately the aggregates, elements, sense-fields, and so on up to the eighteen unshared qualities of a buddha are empty of those phenomena.🔽From Subhuti, in that way the bodhisattva-mahāsattva dedicates that creation of a basis of merit to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.🔽 This teaches that the dedication is completely pure without fault if one dedicates it conventionally, knowing that ultimately the aggregates, elements, sense-fields, and so on up to the eighteen unshared qualities of a buddha are empty of those phenomena.🔽From Subhuti, in that way the bodhisattva-mahāsattva dedicates that creation of a basis of merit to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: chos de dag gi rang bzhin dang mi ldan par zhes nas kun rdzob tu yongs su bsngos na skyon med pa'i bsngo ba yongs su dag pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: chos de dag gi rang bzhin dang mi ldan par zhes nas kun rdzob tu yongs su bsngos na skyon med pa'i bsngo ba yongs su dag pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This teaches that the dedication is completely pure without fault if one dedicates it conventionally, knowing that ultimately the aggregates, elements, sense-fields, and so on up to the eighteen unshared qualities of a buddha are empty of those phenomena.

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po mngon par 'du bya ba de rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po mngon par 'du bya ba de nyid
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po mngon par 'du bya ba de rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po mngon par 'du bya ba de nyid
translated: If a bodhisattva great being knows that very conditioned entity of merit that is a meritorious action consisting of rejoicing to be

original: kyis dben par shes te zhes bya ba nas /🔽'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni don dam par rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po mngon par 'du byed pa de nyid kyang de'i rang
analyzed: kyis dben par shes te zhes bya ba nas / 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni don dam par rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po mngon par 'du byed pa de nyid kyang de'i rang
translated: isolated, up to🔽this is the perfection of wisdom of a bodhisattva great being,

original: bzhin gyis dben te stong par shes la /
analyzed: bzhin gyis dben te stong par shes la /
translated: then that very conditioned entity of merit that is a meritorious action consisting of rejoicing is, in the ultimate, isolated, that is, empty, by way of its own nature.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag dang / bsngo bar bya ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag dang / sngo bar byed pa'i sems de dag dang / gang du bsngo ba'i byang chub de nyid kyang de'i rang bzhin gyis dben zhing stong par shes /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag dang / bsngo bar bya ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag dang / sngo bar byed pa'i sems de dag dang / gang du bsngo ba'i byang chub de nyid kyang de'i rang bzhin gyis dben zhing stong par shes /
translated: One should know that the blessed buddhas, the roots of virtue dedicated, the mind that dedicates, and the enlightenment to which one dedicates are all empty of their own nature.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nas /
translated: As the Perfection of Wisdom says:

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar gyi chos de dag thams cad kyang de dag gi rang bzhin gyis dben zhing stong par shes pas byas la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar gyi chos de dag thams cad kyang de dag gi rang bzhin gyis dben zhing stong par shes pas byas la /
translated: One should know that all these phenomena, from the ten powers of the tathāgatas up to the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas, are empty of their own nature.

original: @20a * // kun rdzob tu yongs su bsngos na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang mi 'gal bar yongs su bsngos pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: @20a * // kun rdzob tu yongs su bsngos na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang mi 'gal bar yongs su bsngos pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: If one dedicates conventionally, one’s dedication is not in conflict with the perfection of wisdom.

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa de dag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo na /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa de dag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo na /
translated: Moreover, when a bodhisattva great being dedicates those roots of virtue of the buddha bhagavāns who have passed into parinirvāṇa, together with their śrāvaka saṅghas,

original: 'di ltar yongs su bsngo bar bya ste zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar yongs su bsngo bar bya ste zhes bya ba nas /
translated: he should dedicate them in the following way, up to🔽he will not have a distorted view.

original: lta ba phyin ci log tu mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa rnams kyis dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag la rjes su yi rang ba'i bsod nams yongs
analyzed: lta ba phyin ci log tu mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa rnams kyis dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag la rjes su yi rang ba'i bsod nams yongs
translated: When the buddha bhagavāns who have passed into parinirvāṇa, together with their śrāvaka saṅghas, rejoice in those roots of virtue,

original: su bsngo ba'i tshe /
analyzed: su bsngo ba'i tshe /
translated: at the time of dedicating the merit of rejoicing,

original: ji ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa de dag yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ste mngon du mi bzhugs shing dngos por mi snang ba de bzhin du dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag dang / yongs su bsngo ba de dag dang /
analyzed: ji ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa de dag yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ste mngon du mi bzhugs shing dngos por mi snang ba de bzhin du dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag dang / yongs su bsngo ba de dag dang /
translated: Just as the Blessed Buddhas, together with the community of śrāvakas, have passed into complete nirvāṇa, are not present, and do not appear as real things, in the same way, those wholesome roots, those dedications,

original: yongs su bsngo ba'i sems de dag kyang mya ngan las 'das pa dang 'dra bar don dam par dngos po med par rtogs par byas nas /
analyzed: yongs su bsngo ba'i sems de dag kyang mya ngan las 'das pa dang 'dra bar don dam par dngos po med par rtogs par byas nas /
translated: and those thoughts of dedication, having been realized to be ultimately without real existence, like nirvāṇa,

original: kun rdzob tu bla na med pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos na mtshan mar mi 'dzin pas 'du shes dang sems dang ldan pa lta ba phyin ci log tu mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu bla na med pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos na mtshan mar mi 'dzin pas 'du shes dang sems dang ldan pa lta ba phyin ci log tu mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: if they are dedicated to unsurpassed enlightenment in the conventional sense, then, since they are not grasped as having attributes, the bodhisattva does not become one who has distorted perception, thought, and view.

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: If, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: mtshan ma'i tshul gyis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su shes na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba ma yin no zhes bya ba nas /

analyzed: byams pa 'di la byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa de bzhin gshegs pa la skur bar 'gyur ba med par 'dod pas 'di ltar yongs su bsngo bar bya ste zhes
translated: Maitreya, here, a son or daughter of good family in the vehicle of the bodhisattvas who practices the perfection of wisdom, wishing not to slander the Tathāgata, should dedicate like this.

original: bya ba nas de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i yongs su bsngo ba de dug med cing bdud rtsi'i mthar phyin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su bsngo ba yongs su dag par bya ba'i thabs🔽bstan pa ste /
analyzed: bya ba nas de ltar spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i yongs su bsngo ba de dug med cing bdud rtsi'i mthar phyin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su bsngo ba yongs su dag par bya ba'i thabs🔽bstan pa ste /
translated: Up to The dedication of a bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices like this is poisonless and reaches the end of nectar. This teaches the method of purifying the dedication of the roots of virtue.

original: de'i thabs kyang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bla na med pa'i ye shes kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong par thugs su chud la /
analyzed: de'i thabs kyang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bla na med pa'i ye shes kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong par thugs su chud la /
translated: The method for that is as follows: the Tathagatas have realized that those roots of virtue of unsurpassed wisdom are ultimately empty of inherent nature,🔽and they dedicate them without attachment to that, by means of skillful means on the conventional level. In the same way, I too dedicate them.

original: kun rdzob tu thabs mkhas pas de la ma chags par yongs su bsngo ba mdzad pa de bzhin du bdag kyang yongs su bsngo'o zhes de bzhin gshegs pa tshad mar byas te yongs su bsngos na bsngo ba yongs su dag par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu thabs mkhas pas de la ma chags par yongs su bsngo ba mdzad pa de bzhin du bdag kyang yongs su bsngo'o zhes de bzhin gshegs pa tshad mar byas te yongs su bsngos na bsngo ba yongs su dag par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: If one makes the Tathagatas the standard and dedicates in this way, the dedication will be completely pure.

original: de la dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag gi ngang tshul gang yin pa dang / rang bzhin gang yin pa dang / mtshan nyid gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gang yin pa zhes bya ba'i rnam grangs te /
analyzed: de la dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag gi ngang tshul gang yin pa dang / rang bzhin gang yin pa dang / mtshan nyid gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gang yin pa zhes bya ba'i rnam grangs te /
translated: Here, what is the nature of those roots of virtue, what is their essence, what is their characteristic?

original: don dam par de dag gi rang bzhin med pa yin yang kun rdzob tu ji ltar bsngos pa'i 'bras bu 'thob par 'gyur ba thugs su chud de mkhyen la zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: don dam par de dag gi rang bzhin med pa yin yang kun rdzob tu ji ltar bsngos pa'i 'bras bu 'thob par 'gyur ba thugs su chud de mkhyen la zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: Although ultimately they have no intrinsic reality, one should understand that one will obtain the result of whatever one has dedicated conventionally.

original: chos nyid gang gis yod pa de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni don dam par stong pa nyid kyi chos nyid yin la kun rdzob tu ji ltar bsngos pa'i 'bras bu thob par byed pa de lta bu'i chos nyid du yod pa la rjes su yi rang ngo🔽zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: chos nyid gang gis yod pa de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni don dam par stong pa nyid kyi chos nyid yin la kun rdzob tu ji ltar bsngos pa'i 'bras bu thob par byed pa de lta bu'i chos nyid du yod pa la rjes su yi rang ngo zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: One should rejoice in the reality of the ultimate, which is emptiness, and in the reality of the conventional, which is the attainment of the result of whatever one has dedicated.🔽That dedication is free of poison and reaches the culmination of nectar.

original: yongs su bsngo ba de dug med cing bdud rtsi'i mthar phyin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la bdud rtsi zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa la bya ste /
analyzed: yongs su bsngo ba de dug med cing bdud rtsi'i mthar phyin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la bdud rtsi zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa la bya ste /
translated: Nectar should be understood as nirvana.

original: de ltar yongs su bsngos na bsngo ba skyon med pa yin pas mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar yongs su bsngos na bsngo ba skyon med pa yin pas mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If one dedicates in this way, the dedication is faultless, and one will attain nirvana.

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Furthermore, when a son or daughter of good lineage who is a follower of the Bodhisattva Vehicle practices the perfection of wisdom,

original: @22b dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams 'di ltar yongs su bsngo bar bya ste zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: @22b dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams 'di ltar yongs su bsngo bar bya ste zhes bya ba nas /
translated: they should dedicate the roots of virtue in the following way, up to

original: rang sangs rgyas de dag kyang khongs su chud pa ma yin /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas de dag kyang khongs su chud pa ma yin /
translated: those pratyekabuddhas are not included,

original: de dag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang yongs su chud pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang yongs su chud pa ma yin te /
translated: and their roots of virtue are not included.

original: gang khongs su chud pa ma yin pa de ni 'das pa ma yin /
analyzed: gang khongs su chud pa ma yin pa de ni 'das pa ma yin /
translated: That which is not included is not past,

original: ma 'ongs pa ma yin /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ma yin /
translated: is not future,🔽and is not present.

original: da ltar byung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du ni gzugs la sogs pa rtag tu btang snyoms su gnas pa la thug gi bar gyis chos thams cad don dam par dngos po med pas khams gsum gang na yang med la /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du ni gzugs la sogs pa rtag tu btang snyoms su gnas pa la thug gi bar gyis chos thams cad don dam par dngos po med pas khams gsum gang na yang med la /
translated: Up to the point of always remaining indifferent to form and so on, all phenomena ultimately have no entity and so do not exist anywhere in the three realms.

original: dus gsum gang du yang ma gtogs pa de bzhin du yongs su bsngo ba dang gang du bsngo bar bya ba'i bla na med pa'i byang chub dang / yongs su bsngo bar bya ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba mdzad pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dang /
analyzed: dus gsum gang du yang ma gtogs pa de bzhin du yongs su bsngo ba dang gang du bsngo bar bya ba'i bla na med pa'i byang chub dang / yongs su bsngo bar bya ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba mdzad pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dang /
translated: Just as they are not included in any of the three times, in the same way, one should understand that the dedication, the unsurpassed enlightenment to which it is dedicated, the roots of virtue that are dedicated, the blessed buddhas who perform the roots of virtue,

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas de dag kyang don dam par khams gsum gang na yang med pa dus gsum gang du yang ma gtogs par shes par bya ste yongs su bsngos na bsngo ba yongs su dag pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas de dag kyang don dam par khams gsum gang na yang med pa dus gsum gang du yang ma gtogs par shes par bya ste yongs su bsngos na bsngo ba yongs su dag pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: and the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas are also not included in any of the three times, and do not exist anywhere in the three realms. If one dedicates in this way, it is a pure dedication.

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe zhes bya ba nas de ltar shes na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bsngo ba dug med pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe zhes bya ba nas de ltar shes na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bsngo ba dug med pa yin te /
translated: If a bodhisattva mahāsattva, when practicing the perfection of wisdom, from that point up to “if he practices like that, the bodhisattva mahāsattva’s dedication is without poison,”

original: bdud rtsi'i mthar phyin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni gzugs la sogs pa rtag tu btang snyoms su gnas pa la thug gi bar gyis chos de dag thams cad gong du smos pa'i tshul du don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong pas khams gsum gang🔽na yang med la /🔽dus gsum gang du yang ma gtogs par de dag thams cad mtshan ma'i tshul lam /
analyzed: bdud rtsi'i mthar phyin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni gzugs la sogs pa rtag tu btang snyoms su gnas pa la thug gi bar gyis chos de dag thams cad gong du smos pa'i tshul du don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong pas khams gsum gang na yang med la / dus gsum gang du yang ma gtogs par de dag thams cad mtshan ma'i tshul lam /
translated: The passage up to “will reach the culmination of ambrosia” indicates that all those phenomena, up to and including the constant equanimity of form and so on, are ultimately empty of inherent nature in the manner explained above, and therefore do not exist anywhere in the three realms.🔽They are not included anywhere in the three times, and it is not suitable to dedicate them all in the manner of signs or in the manner of reference points.

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis yongs su bsngo bar mi rung ba'i gtan tshigs zhib tu bstan pa ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis yongs su bsngo bar mi rung ba'i gtan tshigs zhib tu bstan pa ste /
translated: The reason for this is taught in detail.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽de la rang bzhin med do zhes bya ba khams gsum gang na yang med cing /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / de la rang bzhin med do zhes bya ba khams gsum gang na yang med cing /
translated: Why is it so?🔽It is taught that “there is no inherent nature there” because it does not exist anywhere in the three realms,

original: dus gsum gang du yang ma gtogs pa de la so so'i rang gi mtshan nyid med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dus gsum gang du yang ma gtogs pa de la so so'i rang gi mtshan nyid med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: and “there is no individual characteristic there” because it is not included anywhere in the three times.

original: gang la rang bzhin med pa de ni dngos po med pa ste zhes bya ba ni de ltar rang gi mtshan nyid med pa de la don dam par spyi'i mtshan nyid kyang med de /
analyzed: gang la rang bzhin med pa de ni dngos po med pa ste zhes bya ba ni de ltar rang gi mtshan nyid med pa de la don dam par spyi'i mtshan nyid kyang med de /
translated: This means that since it lacks its own characteristic, ultimately it also lacks a universal characteristic.

original: dngos po yod par ma @23a * //🔽grub po zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽dngos po med pa ni dngos po med pas yongs su bsngo bar mi nus so zhes bya ba ni ji ltar bsngo bar bya ba dngos po med pa de bzhin du sngo bar byed pa yang dngos po med pa'i phyir med pas med pa yongs su bsngo bar
analyzed: dngos po yod par ma @23a * // grub po zhes bya ba'i don to // dngos po med pa ni dngos po med pas yongs su bsngo bar mi nus so zhes bya ba ni ji ltar bsngo bar bya ba dngos po med pa de bzhin du sngo bar byed pa yang dngos po med pa'i phyir med pas med pa yongs su bsngo bar
translated: It is not established as an existent entity.🔽A non-entity cannot be dedicated by a non-entity.

original: mi rung ngo zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: mi rung ngo zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: This shows that just as the object of dedication is a non-entity, the one who dedicates is also a non-entity, so it is not tenable to dedicate a non-entity.

original: thams cad la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //🔽byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo mtshan ma'i tshul lam /
analyzed: thams cad la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o // byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo mtshan ma'i tshul lam /
translated: This should be applied in the same way to everything.🔽If sons or daughters of noble family in the vehicle of the bodhisattvas dedicate those roots of virtue by way of signs

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo na de ni log par yongs su bsngo ba yin gyis /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo na de ni log par yongs su bsngo ba yin gyis /
translated: or by way of apprehending something, that is a mistaken dedication.

original: yang dag par yongs su bsngo ba ma yin no zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: yang dag par yongs su bsngo ba ma yin no zhes bya ba nas /
translated: It is not a perfect dedication.🔽

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de ltar chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong zhing dngos po med pa la dngos po yod par dmigs shing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de ltar chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong zhing dngos po med pa la dngos po yod par dmigs shing /
translated: From “it is not a correct dedication” up to “the eighteen unshared qualities of the Buddhas will not be completed” means that if one dedicates in the manner of signs, taking as existent things that are in fact empty of inherent existence and nonexistent,

original: mtshan ma'i tshul gyis yongs su bsngo na log par yongs su bsngo ba yin pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis kyang bsngags pa ma yin la de ltar mi bsngags pa'i yongs su bsngo ba des ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa sangs rgyas
analyzed: mtshan ma'i tshul gyis yongs su bsngo na log par yongs su bsngo ba yin pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis kyang bsngags pa ma yin la de ltar mi bsngags pa'i yongs su bsngo ba des ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa sangs rgyas
translated: it is a mistaken dedication, and thus the Bhagavan Buddhas do not praise it.

original: kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad la thug gi bar du rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad la thug gi bar du rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: And by such a dedication that is not praised, the qualities of complete purification, from the six perfections up to the eighteen unshared qualities of the Buddhas, will not be completed.

original: bdag gi don phun sum tshogs par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir kha zas dug can za ba dang 'dra'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi don phun sum tshogs par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir kha zas dug can za ba dang 'dra'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Because one’s own aim is not fulfilled, it is like eating poisoned food.

original: gang gis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur ba dang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gang gis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur ba dang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: By what means will the perfection of generosity not be completed?

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?🔽Because such a dedication is poisoned.

original: de ltar yongs su bsngo ba de ni dug dang bcas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad la thug gi bar du yongs su rdzogs par ma gyur
analyzed: de ltar yongs su bsngo ba de ni dug dang bcas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad la thug gi bar du yongs su rdzogs par ma gyur
translated: Up to here, it shows the fault that if the six perfections and so on up to the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha are not completed,

original: na / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya yang mi nus te /
analyzed: na / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya yang mi nus te /
translated: one will not be able to purify a buddhafield and bring sentient beings to maturity,

original: gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs par mi 'gyur ba'i skyon bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs par mi 'gyur ba'i skyon bstan pa'o //
translated: and so the fulfillment of others’ aims will not occur.

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Furthermore, when a bodhisattva mahāsattva practices the perfection of wisdom,🔽

original: bdag gis kyang chos nyid des bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs @23b su bsngo bar bya'o zhes yongs su brtag par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni bsngo ba yongs su dag pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis ji ltar
analyzed: bdag gis kyang chos nyid des bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs @23b su bsngo bar bya'o zhes yongs su brtag par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni bsngo ba yongs su dag pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis ji ltar
translated: Furthermore, when the bodhisattva mahāsattva practices the perfection of wisdom, from “I should also dedicate to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening with that reality” up to “I should imagine it” is the purity of dedication.

original: mkhyen cing thabs mkhas pa'i chos nyid kyis yongs su bsngos pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: mkhyen cing thabs mkhas pa'i chos nyid kyis yongs su bsngos pa de bzhin du /
translated: The blessed buddhas know that dedication with the reality of skillful means.🔽I should also dedicate in that way.

original: bdag gis kyang don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong zhing /
analyzed: bdag gis kyang don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong zhing /
translated: I should also realize that ultimately all phenomena are empty of inherent existence,

original: dmigs pa dang mtshan ma med par rtogs par byas la /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang mtshan ma med par rtogs par byas la /
translated: and that they are without reference points and without signs.

original: kun rdzob tu de la ma chags par bya ste /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu de la ma chags par bya ste /
translated: I should also not be attached to them conventionally.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su bsngos na thabs mkhas pa'i chos nyid dang ldan pa'i yongs su bsngo bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su bsngos na thabs mkhas pa'i chos nyid dang ldan pa'i yongs su bsngo bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: When the roots of virtue are dedicated, it is a dedication that possesses the reality of skillful means.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la bka' stsal pa zhes bya ba nas /🔽rab 'byor khyod ston pa'i bya ba byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su bsngo ba skyon med cing yongs su dag par bsngo ba rab 'byor gyis gong du bshad pa mtshan ma med cing mi dmigs pa'i tshul
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la bka' stsal pa zhes bya ba nas / rab 'byor khyod ston pa'i bya ba byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su bsngo ba skyon med cing yongs su dag par bsngo ba rab 'byor gyis gong du bshad pa mtshan ma med cing mi dmigs pa'i tshul
translated: Then the Lord said to the venerable Subhuti, etc.,🔽up to “Subhuti, you are performing the work of a teacher.”🔽In this way, the dedication of the roots of virtue is faultless and pure, as explained above by Subhuti.

original: gyis yongs su bsngo ba bstan pa de legs so zhes bstod pa ste /
analyzed: gyis yongs su bsngo ba bstan pa de legs so zhes bstod pa ste /
translated: The dedication by way of the method of signlessness and nonapprehension is praised as “good.”

original: mtshan ma med pa dang / dmigs pa med pa dang / skye ba med pa la sogs pa'i tshig rnams smos pa ni stong pa nyid kyi rnam grangs su zad do //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa dang / dmigs pa med pa dang / skye ba med pa la sogs pa'i tshig rnams smos pa ni stong pa nyid kyi rnam grangs su zad do //
translated: The terms “signless,” “nonapprehension,” “nonproduction,” etc., are merely synonyms for emptiness.

original: rab 'byor gal te stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di'i sems can de dag thams cad dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam thob par gyur zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor gal te stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di'i sems can de dag thams cad dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam thob par gyur zhes bya ba nas /
translated: they would be called unsurpassed,

original: bla na med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: they would be called unexcelled.

original: gong na med pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can ji snyed yod pa de dag thams cad kyi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: gong na med pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can ji snyed yod pa de dag thams cad kyi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang /
translated: The merit of all the sentient beings in the great billionfold world system who have attained the ten wholesome courses of action, the four concentrations, the four immeasurables,

original: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / mngon par shes pa lnga thob par gyur pa'i bsod nams pas kyang rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams dmigs pa dang bcas shing mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i skyon gyis ma chags ma gos par sems can thams cad dang thun mong du
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / mngon par shes pa lnga thob par gyur pa'i bsod nams pas kyang rjes su yi rang ba dang ldan pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams dmigs pa dang bcas shing mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i skyon gyis ma chags ma gos par sems can thams cad dang thun mong du
translated: the four formless absorptions, and the five kinds of superknowledge, compared to the wholesome roots of rejoicing,🔽is not even a fraction, not even a hundredth part, not even a thousandth part, not even a hundred thousandth part, not even a hundred thousandth of a hundred thousandth part.

original: bya ste / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pa'i bsod nams khyad par du 'phags par che ba bstan pa ste /🔽rab dang / @24a * //

translated: The praise of the qualities of surpassing all the wholesome roots of those with reference points is shown by rejoicing and making offerings.

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams dang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the gods of the Catur­mahā­rāja­kāyika realm and so forth, up to:

original: mnyam pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa med pa zhes bya'o //

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na sems can ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed do

translated: The phrase “equal to the unequaled” refers to the fact that all sentient beings in the great trichiliocosm have generated the mind of unsurpassed and complete enlightenment.

original: // byang chub sems dpar gyur pa rnams kyis phyogs bcu dus gsum du zhugs pa rnams kyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas su bcas pa rnams kyis dang por sems bskyed pa nas /
analyzed: // byang chub sems dpar gyur pa rnams kyis phyogs bcu dus gsum du zhugs pa rnams kyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas su bcas pa rnams kyis dang por sems bskyed pa nas /
translated: The bodhisattvas who have entered the ten directions and three times have generated the mind of enlightenment in the presence of the buddhas, the bhagavans, together with the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: dam pa'i chos ma nub kyi bar du pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la spyad de /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos ma nub kyi bar du pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la spyad de /
translated: From the initial generation of the mind of enlightenment until the sublime Dharma has not disappeared, they have practiced all the qualities of the buddhas, such as the six perfections.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba ji snyed cig bskyed pa de dag la rjes su yi rangs nas dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i tshul gyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pa'i bsod nams pas kyang /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba ji snyed cig bskyed pa de dag la rjes su yi rangs nas dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i tshul gyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pa'i bsod nams pas kyang /
translated: Having rejoiced in all the roots of virtue that have been generated, they dedicate them to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening in a manner that involves reference points.

original: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo la la zhig bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed de byang chub sems dpar gyur pas /🔽phyogs bcu na dus gsum du bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas su bcas pa rnams kyis dang po sems bskyed pa nas /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo la la zhig bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed de byang chub sems dpar gyur pas / phyogs bcu na dus gsum du bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas su bcas pa rnams kyis dang po sems bskyed pa nas /
translated: Compared to that, if a son or daughter of good lineage were to generate the thought of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening and become a bodhisattva,

original: dam pa'i chos ma nub kyi par du pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la spyad de /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos ma nub kyi par du pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la spyad de /
translated: and if they were to rejoice in all the roots of virtue of all sentient beings in the three times and dedicate them to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening in a manner that does not involve reference points,🔽then the latter would generate merit immeasurably greater than the former.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba ji snyed cig bskyed pa de dag la dmigs su med pa dang gnyis su med pa la sogs pa'i tshul gyis rjes su yi rangs nas /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba ji snyed cig bskyed pa de dag la dmigs su med pa dang gnyis su med pa la sogs pa'i tshul gyis rjes su yi rangs nas /
translated: and whatever roots of virtue they have produced, he rejoices in them by way of non-apprehension, non-duality, and so on.

original: rjes su yi rang ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de yang dmigs su med pa dang gnyis su med pa la sogs pa'i tshul gyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos na /
analyzed: rjes su yi rang ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de yang dmigs su med pa dang gnyis su med pa la sogs pa'i tshul gyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos na /
translated: And that root of virtue of rejoicing, he dedicates to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment by way of non-apprehension, non-duality, and so on.

original: de'i bsod nams dmigs pa can gyi bsngo ba snga ma'i bsod nams pas khyad par du 'phags par che ba bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de'i bsod nams dmigs pa can gyi bsngo ba snga ma'i bsod nams pas khyad par du 'phags par che ba bstan pa ste /
translated: The greatness of the superiority of his merit over the merit of the previous dedication with reference is taught.

original: rab @25b dang gtso bo la sogs pa ni khyad par du 'phags pa'i rnam grangs su zad de snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: rab @25b dang gtso bo la sogs pa ni khyad par du 'phags pa'i rnam grangs su zad de snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The words “excellent,” “foremost,” and so on are just synonyms for “superior,” as before.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to the Lord:

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni mtshan ma med pa dang dmigs su med pa'i rjes su yi rang ba de rab dang / gtso bo dang / dam pa dang / mchog la sogs pa ji tsam gyis 'gyur ba bstan pa ste /

translated: The passage from “unequalled” up to “equal” indicates the extent to which rejoicing in the absence of signs and the absence of reference points is excellent, foremost, sublime, supreme, and so on.

original: don dam par dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag rang bzhin gyis stong zhing de bzhin nyid du ro gcig pas blang dor med pa dang / skye ba dang / 'gag pa la sogs pa med pa dang / de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du ro gcig par rtogs par bya ste kun rdzob tu rjes su yi rangs nas /
analyzed: don dam par dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag rang bzhin gyis stong zhing de bzhin nyid du ro gcig pas blang dor med pa dang / skye ba dang / 'gag pa la sogs pa med pa dang / de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du ro gcig par rtogs par bya ste kun rdzob tu rjes su yi rangs nas /
translated: In terms of the ultimate, since those roots of virtue are empty by nature and are of one taste in suchness, they are free from acceptance and rejection, free from arising and ceasing, and so on, and are of one taste in the nature of suchness, unmistaken suchness, and so on.

original: de ltar rjes su yi rang ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos na rab dang gtso bo la sogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar rjes su yi rang ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngos na rab dang gtso bo la sogs par 'gyur te /

analyzed: @27b stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because of being the nature of emptiness, it has the nature of being unborn and unceasing. This is the meaning.

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni mi rtag mi 'jig pa'i slad du 'khor ba'i gnyen po'o zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba'i chos rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i mtha' gnyis las bzlog pa'i phyir 'khor ba'i gnyen po zhes bya'o //🔽bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos rin po che thams cad stobs pa'i slad du /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni mi rtag mi 'jig pa'i slad du 'khor ba'i gnyen po'o zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba'i chos rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i mtha' gnyis las bzlog pa'i phyir 'khor ba'i gnyen po zhes bya'o // bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos rin po che thams cad stobs pa'i slad du /
translated: The Blessed One said, The perfection of wisdom is the remedy for cyclic existence because it is impermanent and does not perish. It is called the remedy for cyclic existence because it turns away from the two extremes of permanence and impermanence, which are the characteristics of cyclic existence.🔽The Blessed One said, The perfection of wisdom is the protector of those beings who have no protector because it bestows all precious dharmas.🔽Because it bestows all precious dharmas.

original: sems can mgon ma mchis pa rnams kyi mgon bgyid pa'o zhes bya ba ni sems can nyon mongs pa'i dbang du gyur cing /
analyzed: sems can mgon ma mchis pa rnams kyi mgon bgyid pa'o zhes bya ba ni sems can nyon mongs pa'i dbang du gyur cing /
translated: The Blessed One said, The perfection of wisdom is the great mantra, the mantra of wisdom, the mantra that pacifies all suffering.

original: 'khor ba'i brtson ra nas ma thar pa rnams la rnam par byang ba'i chos rin po che rnams bstan pas sems can rnams 'khor ba'i brtson ra nas thar par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i brtson ra nas ma thar pa rnams la rnam par byang ba'i chos rin po che rnams bstan pas sems can rnams 'khor ba'i brtson ra nas thar par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it teaches the precious Dharma of purification to those who have not escaped from the prison of cyclic existence, it causes sentient beings to escape from the prison of cyclic existence.🔽The Blessed One’s perfection of wisdom is the maker of the ten powers because it is invincible.

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni thub pa ma mchis pa'i slad du stobs bcu bgyid pa'o zhes bya ba ni bdud dang mu stegs can phas kyi rgol ba rnams kyis mi thub pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang ldan par🔽byed pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni thub pa ma mchis pa'i slad du stobs bcu bgyid pa'o zhes bya ba ni bdud dang mu stegs can phas kyi rgol ba rnams kyis mi thub pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang ldan par🔽byed pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that it makes the Tathāgata endowed with the ten powers because it cannot be overcome by Māra, non-Buddhists, or opponents.

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'gro ba dang ldog pa ma mchis pa'i slad du rnam pa bcu gnyis rgyud gsum du 'khor ba'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / mi bskor ba zhes bya ba yang med la kun rdzob tu chos kyi 'khor lo rnam pa bcu gnyis lan gsum du bskor ba'i rang bzhin can no zhes bstod pa ste /🔽de la rnam pa bcu gnyis lan gsum du 'khor lo bskor ba ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'gro ba dang ldog pa ma mchis pa'i slad du rnam pa bcu gnyis rgyud gsum du 'khor ba'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / mi bskor ba zhes bya ba yang med la kun rdzob tu chos kyi 'khor lo rnam pa bcu gnyis lan gsum du bskor ba'i rang bzhin can no zhes bstod pa ste / de la rnam pa bcu gnyis lan gsum du 'khor lo bskor ba ni /
translated: It is said that it is not turned or not not turned, but it is the nature of the wheel of Dharma that is turned three times with its twelve aspects in the conventional sense.🔽This is the praise.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam rnams kyi rang bzhin ston pa'i tshe /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam rnams kyi rang bzhin ston pa'i tshe /
translated: The wheel of Dharma is turned three times with its twelve aspects when the nature of the four noble truths, suffering, origin, cessation and path, is taught.

original: phung po lnga la 'di ni sbug bsngal ba yin no zhes bya ba dang / phung po lnga 'byung ba'i rgyu las dang nyon mongs pa la 'di ni phung po kun 'byung ba yin no zhes bya ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi phung po 'gags pa'i rang bzhin mya ngan 'das pa la 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa'o zhes bya ba dang /🔽mya ngan las @28a * //
analyzed: phung po lnga la 'di ni sbug bsngal ba yin no zhes bya ba dang / phung po lnga 'byung ba'i rgyu las dang nyon mongs pa la 'di ni phung po kun 'byung ba yin no zhes bya ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi phung po 'gags pa'i rang bzhin mya ngan 'das pa la 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa'o zhes bya ba dang / mya ngan las @28a * //
translated: The five aggregates are suffering, the cause of the arising of the five aggregates is the origin of suffering, the cessation of the mass of suffering is the cessation of suffering,🔽and the noble eightfold path which causes the attainment of nirvana is the path to the cessation of suffering.

original: 'das pa thob par byed pa'i lam 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa 'di ni mya ngan 'das pa thob par byed pa'i rgyu'am lam yin no zhes bya bar bden pa bzhi po de dag ni rang bzhin nyid tshe bstan pa'i rgyud gcig go //

translated: These four truths are the single continuum of the teaching of the nature of reality.

original: sdug bsngal ni yongs su shes par bya'o //🔽kun 'byung ba ni spang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni yongs su shes par bya'o // kun 'byung ba ni spang bar bya ba'o //

original: 'gog pa ni mngon sum du bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa ni mngon sum du bya ba'o //

original: lam ni bsgom par bya ba'o zhes ston pa ni rgyud gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: lam ni bsgom par bya ba'o zhes ston pa ni rgyud gnyis pa'o //

original: sdug bsngal ni bdag gis shes so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni bdag gis shes so //
translated: The third stream is the teaching that one has understood suffering,

original: kun 'byung ba ni bdag gis spangs so //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba ni bdag gis spangs so //

original: 'gog pa ni bdag gis mngon sum du byas so //

original: lam ni bdag gis bsgoms so zhes bya bar ston pa ni rgyud gsum pa ste /
