original: de ltar 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po de dag la rnam pa gsum du phye ste bstan pa rnam pa bcu gnyis rgyud gsum du 'khor ba'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba zhes bya'o //🔽bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi slad du chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid ston pa'o zhes bya ba don dam par chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid
analyzed: de ltar 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po de dag la rnam pa gsum du phye ste bstan pa rnam pa bcu gnyis rgyud gsum du 'khor ba'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba zhes bya'o // bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi slad du chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid ston pa'o zhes bya ba don dam par chos thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid
translated: Thus, the teaching of the twelve aspects by dividing each of the four noble truths into three is called the turning of the wheel of the Dharma of the twelve aspects that revolve in three streams.🔽Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom reveals the nature of all phenomena because of the emptiness that is the essencelessness of all phenomena.

original: stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin no zhes ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin no zhes ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it teaches that ultimately all phenomena are empty by nature, having the essence of essencelessness.

translated: This passage teaches that just as the Blessed Buddha, the Teacher, is to be revered, honored, and so forth by gods and humans,

translated: Then the venerable Śāradvatīputra said to the Blessed One...🔽up to The perfection of wisdom should be accomplished because all phenomena are not accomplished.

analyzed: ji ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mngon par bsgrub pa ma mchis pa'i slad du /

translated: From the perfection of wisdom should be accomplished up to the perfection of wisdom should be accomplished is the question about the reason why those phenomena from form up to the knowledge of all aspects are non-existent and not to be accomplished.

translated: From the perfection of wisdom should be accomplished up to the perfection of wisdom should be accomplished is the teaching of the reason why the phenomena from form up to the knowledge of all aspects are non-existent and not to be accomplished.

original: don dam par chos de dag thams cad dngos po med pas mngon par 'du bya ba dang / skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang / dmigs pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir mngon par bsgrub du yang med de /

analyzed: de ltar rtogs pa nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //

translated: He said, “Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom that is accomplished in that way, what dharma does it cause to be attained?” All phenomena have the nature of being non-produced, non-ceasing, and so forth.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu de ltar mngon par bsgrubs pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni chos gang yang thob par mi byed de nam chos gang yang thob par mi byed pa de'i tshe shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i grangs su 'gro'o zhes
translated: “Śāradvatī­putra, the perfection of wisdom that is thus accomplished does not cause any phenomenon to be attained. When it does not cause any phenomenon to be attained, it is counted as the perfection of wisdom.”

translated: He asks, What dharma does it not obtain?🔽 The Blessed One replies, It does not obtain unwholesome dharmas, up to it does not obtain unconditioned dharmas.

translated: This teaches that ultimately, all contaminated and uncontaminated dharmas are unreal, so no cause of obtaining those dharmas exists.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

translated: The perfection of wisdom does not approach any dharma in a manner of apprehending it for the sake of anything at all.

translated: The meaning is that, because of the realization that all dharmas are insubstantial, it does not stand in the manner of an objective support in order to cause the attainment of any dharma at all.

analyzed: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to // bcom ldan 'das ci lags /

translated: The perfection of wisdom does not cause the attainment of the knowledge of all modes, nor does it apprehend it.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par mi byed dmigs par mi byed do zhes bya ba ni don dam par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid stong pa nyid du ro gcig pas thob par bya ba dang thob par byed pa gnyis tha dad du dbye zhing dmigs su med do zhes bstan pa'o //

translated: This shows that ultimately the perfection of wisdom and the knowledge of all modes are of one taste in emptiness, and that the two, the object to be attained and the means of attainment, cannot be differentiated and apprehended as different.

analyzed: brgya byin gyis gsol pa /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang thob par mi bgyid /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied:🔽Kauśika, the perfection of wisdom does not cause attainment in the same way as the name, the sign, and the formative activity.

translated: “Well then, Blessed One, how does one attain it?” He asks this in order to clarify how one attains the knowledge of all aspects without apprehending, without taking up, and so on.

original: mi dmigs pa dang / mi len pa dang / mi gnas pa dang / mi 'dor ba dang / mngon par chags pa med pa de ltar thob par byed de zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par mi rtog pa yin zhing gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rnam par spangs pa dang /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa dang / mi len pa dang / mi gnas pa dang / mi 'dor ba dang / mngon par chags pa med pa de ltar thob par byed de zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par mi rtog pa yin zhing gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rnam par spangs pa dang /
translated: “One attains it without apprehending, without taking up, without dwelling, without rejecting, and without attachment.” The perfection of wisdom is nonconceptual and free from the duality of object and subject.

original: blang dor med cing mnyam pa nyid du gyur pa nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: blang dor med cing mnyam pa nyid du gyur pa nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par byed pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It is the attainment of the knowledge of all modes, which is without acceptance and rejection, and is evenness itself.

original: gang yang thob par byed pa med do zhes bya ba ni de ltar rnam par mi rtog pa yin pas mtshan ma dang bcas shing dmigs pa'i tshul gyis thob par byed pa ni gang yang med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gang yang thob par byed pa med do zhes bya ba ni de ltar rnam par mi rtog pa yin pas mtshan ma dang bcas shing dmigs pa'i tshul gyis thob par byed pa ni gang yang med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: And also, “there is no attainment” means that, since it is thus non-conceptual, there is no attainment by way of the sign and the objective.

original: koo shi ka de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni chos thams cad thob par mi byed de gang yang thob par mi byed do zhes bya ba ni gong du chos gang yang thob par mi byed pa'i gtan tshigs bshad pa'i don mjug bsdus te
analyzed: koo shi ka de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni chos thams cad thob par mi byed de gang yang thob par mi byed do zhes bya ba ni gong du chos gang yang thob par mi byed pa'i gtan tshigs bshad pa'i don mjug bsdus te
translated: Kauśika, thus the perfection of wisdom does not cause the attainment of any dharma at all, and does not cause the attainment of anything at all. This is the summary meaning of the explanation of the reason why it does not cause the attainment of any dharma at all.

original: bstan pa'o // brgya byin gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: bstan pa'o // brgya byin gyis gsol pa /
translated: Śatakratu said:

original: bcom ldan 'das de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di chos thams cad skye ba ma mchis pa dang / 'gag pa ma mchis pa dang / mngon par 'du bgyi ba ma mchis pa dang / dmigs pa ma mchis pa dang / 'jigs pa ma mchis pa'i slad du nye bar gnas pa ngo mtshar che'o zhes bya ba @31b ni gong du chos thams cad skye ba dang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di chos thams cad skye ba ma mchis pa dang / 'gag pa ma mchis pa dang / mngon par 'du bgyi ba ma mchis pa dang / dmigs pa ma mchis pa dang / 'jigs pa ma mchis pa'i slad du nye bar gnas pa ngo mtshar che'o zhes bya ba @31b ni gong du chos thams cad skye ba dang /
translated: Blessed One, it is amazing that this perfection of wisdom is present in the non-arising, non-cessation, non-performance, non-apprehension, and non-fear of all phenomena.

original: 'gag pa la sogs pa med par rtogs pa nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub pa yin la /
analyzed: 'gag pa la sogs pa med par rtogs pa nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par bsgrub pa yin la /
translated: This is saying that the very realization of the non-arising, non-cessation, and so forth of all phenomena is the accomplishment of the perfection of wisdom.

original: don dam par chos gang yang thob par byed pa med par bshad pas /
analyzed: don dam par chos gang yang thob par byed pa med par bshad pas /
translated: Since it explains that ultimately there is nothing whatsoever to attain,

original: brgya byin mgu nas 'khor rnams kyang mgu ba dang dad pa bskyed pa'i phyir de lta bu ngo mtshar che'o zhes shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bstod pa'o //
analyzed: brgya byin mgu nas 'khor rnams kyang mgu ba dang dad pa bskyed pa'i phyir de lta bu ngo mtshar che'o zhes shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bstod pa'o //
translated: Śakra is pleased and in order to generate pleasure and faith in the retinue, he praises the perfection of wisdom by saying, “It is amazing like that!”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba nas /🔽de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ring du bgyid pa lags so zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa chos thams cad thob par byed pa'i dngos por 'du shes shing rnam par rtog gam /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba nas / de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ring du bgyid pa lags so zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa chos thams cad thob par byed pa'i dngos por 'du shes shing rnam par rtog gam /
translated: Then the venerable Subhuti said to the Lord:

original: chos thams cad thob par mi byed pa'i dngos por 'du shes shing rnam par rtog na yang thob par byed pa dang / thob par mi byed pa'i mtha' gnyis su 'dzin pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don dang 'gal ba'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dor zhing ring du byed pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad thob par mi byed pa'i dngos por 'du shes shing rnam par rtog na yang thob par byed pa dang / thob par mi byed pa'i mtha' gnyis su 'dzin pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don dang 'gal ba'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dor zhing ring du byed pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: If one imagines or conceptualizes the perfection of wisdom as a thing which causes the attainment of all dharmas, or as a thing which does not cause the attainment of all dharmas, then one rejects and turns away from the perfection of wisdom, because one holds to the two extremes of attainment and non-attainment, and one is in conflict with the meaning of the perfection of wisdom.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said:

original: rab 'byor rnam grangs gang gis zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor rnam grangs gang gis zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Subhuti, by what method?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ring du byed pa'i rnam grangs so zhes bya ba'i bar du ni thob par byed pa dang / thob par mi byed pa'i mtha' gnyis su 'dzin cing rnam par rtog pa 'ba' zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dor zhing ring du byed par ma zad kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las chos thams cad dngos po med pa dang /🔽stong pa sha stag tu ston pas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ring du byed pa'i rnam grangs so zhes bya ba'i bar du ni thob par byed pa dang / thob par mi byed pa'i mtha' gnyis su 'dzin cing rnam par rtog pa 'ba' zhig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dor zhing ring du byed par ma zad kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las chos thams cad dngos po med pa dang / stong pa sha stag tu ston pas /
translated: The passage up to “the enumeration of the perfection of wisdom being made distant” teaches that not only does the apprehension and conception of the two extremes of attainment and non-attainment abandon and make distant the perfection of wisdom, but also the teaching in the perfection of wisdom of all phenomena as being unreal and empty🔽causes the thought “The perfection of wisdom is empty, hollow, and without substance”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gsog gsob ste snying po med pa'o snyam du sems shing de ltar rnam par rtog na yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dor zhing ring du byed pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gsog gsob ste snying po med pa'o snyam du sems shing de ltar rnam par rtog na yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dor zhing ring du byed pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: to arise, and when such a conception occurs, the perfection of wisdom is abandoned and made distant.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yid ches pas /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yid ches pas /
translated: Subhūti said, “Blessed One, through having confidence in the perfection of wisdom,

original: chos gang la yid ches par 'gyur ba lags zhes bya ba nas gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong pas /
analyzed: chos gang la yid ches par 'gyur ba lags zhes bya ba nas gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong pas /
translated: From What Dharma should one have conviction in? up to All phenomena such as form are ultimately empty of intrinsic nature,

original: dngos po yod par yid ches par byar mi rung ba'i 'khor rnams la zhib tu bshad pa'i gling @32a * //
analyzed: dngos po yod par yid ches par byar mi rung ba'i 'khor rnams la zhib tu bshad pa'i gling @32a * //
translated: so it is not suitable to have conviction in existent things.

original: bslang ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das la rab 'byor gyis zhus pa'o //
analyzed: bslang ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das la rab 'byor gyis zhus pa'o //
translated: In order to explain this in detail to the retinue, Subhūti asked the Bhagavān.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said,

original: rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yid ches pas gzugs la yid ches par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yid ches pas gzugs la yid ches par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Subhūti, by having conviction in the perfection of wisdom, one does not have conviction in form, and so on,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la yid ches par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don rtogs te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la yid ches par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don rtogs te /
translated: up to one does not have conviction in omniscience. Having realized the meaning of the perfection of wisdom,

original: don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong par yid ches na gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du chos thams cad la dngos po yod par 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong par yid ches na gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du chos thams cad la dngos po yod par 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: If one has confidence in the ultimate emptiness of all phenomena, one will not grasp at the existence of any phenomenon, from form up to omniscience.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yid ches pas /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yid ches pas /
translated: Subhūti asks, “Blessed One, how is it that by having confidence in the perfection of wisdom,

original: gzugs la yid ches par mi 'gyur ba lags zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gzugs la yid ches par mi 'gyur ba lags zhes bya ba nas /
translated: one does not have confidence in form,🔽up to one does not have confidence in omniscience?”

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la yid ches par mi 'gyur ba lags zhes bya ba'i bar du ni gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du chos thams cad la mi dmigs pa'i don 'khor rnams la zhib tu bshad🔽pa'i gleng bslang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la yid ches par mi 'gyur ba lags zhes bya ba'i bar du ni gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du chos thams cad la mi dmigs pa'i don 'khor rnams la zhib tu bshad pa'i gleng bslang ba'i phyir /
translated: This is a request to the Blessed One to explain in detail to the retinue the meaning of the non-apprehension of all phenomena, from form up to omniscience.

original: bcom ldan 'das la rab 'byor gyis zhus pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la rab 'byor gyis zhus pa'o //
translated: Subhūti asks the Blessed One to do this.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replies,

original: rab 'byor gzugs su mi dmigs pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzugs su mi dmigs pas /
translated: Subhūti, because form is not apprehended,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yid ches par 'gyur te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yid ches par 'gyur te /
translated: one will have confidence in the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yid ches pas /
analyzed: de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yid ches pas /
translated: In that way, by having confidence in the perfection of wisdom,

original: gzugs la yid ches par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gzugs la yid ches par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas /
translated: one will not have confidence in form.

original: de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yid ches pas /
analyzed: de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yid ches pas /
translated: In that way, by having confidence in the perfection of wisdom,🔽one will not have confidence in the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la yid ches par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong par rtogs te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la yid ches par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong par rtogs te /
translated: In that way, all phenomena such as form are realized to be ultimately empty of inherent nature.

original: de dag gang la yang dngos po yod par mi dmigs shing mtshan mar mi 'dzin par gyur na /
analyzed: de dag gang la yang dngos po yod par mi dmigs shing mtshan mar mi 'dzin par gyur na /
translated: When one does not apprehend anything as having substantial existence and does not grasp at signs,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo rtogs shing yid ches par 'gyur te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo rtogs shing yid ches par 'gyur te /
translated: one will realize and have confidence in the profound meaning of the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo rtogs shing yid ches par gyur na /
analyzed: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo rtogs shing yid ches par gyur na /
translated: In that way, by realizing and having confidence in the profound meaning of the perfection of wisdom,

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa @32b thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du chos thams cad la dngos po yod pas yid ches par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa @32b thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du chos thams cad la dngos po yod pas yid ches par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It is taught that one will not have confidence in all phenomena, from form up to omniscience, because of the existence of entities.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni pha rol tu phyin pa chen po'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad yongs su dag pa'i tshe yang bzang zhing che bar rnam par rtog pa med la /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni pha rol tu phyin pa chen po'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad yongs su dag pa'i tshe yang bzang zhing che bar rnam par rtog pa med la /
translated: He said, “Blessed One, in this way, the perfection of wisdom is a great perfection.” This is a praise, because when all phenomena such as form are completely purified, there is no conception of them as good and great.

original: yongs su ma dag pa'i tshe yang ngan zhing chung bar rnam par rtog pa med de /
analyzed: yongs su ma dag pa'i tshe yang ngan zhing chung bar rnam par rtog pa med de /
translated: And when they are completely impure, there is no conception of them as bad and small.

original: de ltar lhun gyis grub par rnam par mi rtog cing yon tan che ba'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa chen mo'o zhes bstod pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar lhun gyis grub par rnam par mi rtog cing yon tan che ba'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa chen mo'o zhes bstod pa'o //
translated: Thus, because it is spontaneously present, nonconceptual, and has great qualities, it is a great perfection.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: “Subhūti, what do you think?

original: rgyu gang gis na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di pha rol tu phyin pa chen mo yin zhes bya ba ni ji ltar pha rol tu phyin pa chen mo yin pa'i gtan tshigs dris pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu gang gis na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di pha rol tu phyin pa chen mo yin zhes bya ba ni ji ltar pha rol tu phyin pa chen mo yin pa'i gtan tshigs dris pa'o //
translated: This is the question about the reason why it is a great perfection.

original: gsol pa / gzugs che bar mi bgyid chung bar mi bgyid do zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gsol pa / gzugs che bar mi bgyid chung bar mi bgyid do zhes bya ba nas /
translated: He said, It does not make form great or small,🔽up to it does not make enlightenment, the buddhas, and the qualities of the buddhas great.

original: byang chub dang / sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams che bar mi bgyid do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni pha rol tu phyin pa chen mo yin pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub dang / sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams che bar mi bgyid do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni pha rol tu phyin pa chen mo yin pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches the reason why it is a great perfection.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i rang bzhin yin pas ;
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i rang bzhin yin pas ;
translated: The perfection of wisdom, having the nature of non-conceptuality,

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad yongs su dag pa'i tshe yang bzang zhing che bar mi rtog la yongs su ma dag pa'i tshe yang ngan zhing chung bar mi rtog ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad yongs su dag pa'i tshe yang bzang zhing che bar mi rtog la yongs su ma dag pa'i tshe yang ngan zhing chung bar mi rtog ste /
translated: does not conceive of form and all phenomena as good and great when they are completely pure, nor does it conceive of them as bad and small when they are completely impure.

original: de ltar mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing rnam par mi rtog pa'i yon tan che ba'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di pha rol tu phyin pa chen mo yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing rnam par mi rtog pa'i yon tan che ba'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di pha rol tu phyin pa chen mo yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Thus, because of the great quality of not apprehending characteristics and of non-conceptuality, it is shown that this perfection of wisdom is the great perfection.

original: gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gzugs 'du bar mi bgyid yangs par mi bgyid do zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gzugs 'du bar mi bgyid yangs par mi bgyid do zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Moreover, the perfection of wisdom does not make form increase or decrease, and so on up to

original: byang chub dang / sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams 'du bar mi bgyid yangs par mi bgyid do zhes bya ba'i bar du yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di pha rol tu phyin pa chen mo yin pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub dang / sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams 'du bar mi bgyid yangs par mi bgyid do zhes bya ba'i bar du yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di pha rol tu phyin pa chen mo yin pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: it does not make enlightenment, the Buddha, and the qualities of the Buddha increase or decrease. This shows the reason why this perfection of wisdom is the great perfection.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i rang bzhin yin pas gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad yongs su dag pa'i tshe yang chos @33a * //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i rang bzhin yin pas gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad yongs su dag pa'i tshe yang chos @33a * //
translated: The perfection of wisdom has the nature of non-conceptuality. Therefore, when all phenomena such as form are completely purified, the perfection of wisdom does not increase.

original: kyi dbyings nyid du bsdu ba'i rnam par rtog pa yang med la /
analyzed: kyi dbyings nyid du bsdu ba'i rnam par rtog pa yang med la /
translated: It is a great perfection because it is not a conceptualization that is subsumed within the basic field of phenomena.

original: yongs su ma dag pa'i tshe yang kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin du so sor 'phros shing yangs pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang med pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa chen mo yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su ma dag pa'i tshe yang kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin du so sor 'phros shing yangs pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang med pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa chen mo yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: And it is a great perfection because it is not a conceptualization that is individually projected and expanded in the form of an imagined nature even when it is impure.

original: gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gzugs tshad mchis par mi bgyid tshad ma mchis par yang mi bgyid do zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gzugs tshad mchis par mi bgyid tshad ma mchis par yang mi bgyid do zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Moreover, the perfection of wisdom does not make form finite or infinite.

original: byang chub dang sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams tshad mchis par mi bgyid tshad ma mchis par mi bgyid do zhes bya ba'i bar du yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di pha rol tu phyin pa chen mo yin pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa
analyzed: byang chub dang sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams tshad mchis par mi bgyid tshad ma mchis par mi bgyid do zhes bya ba'i bar du yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di pha rol tu phyin pa chen mo yin pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa
translated: This is a demonstration of the reason why this perfection of wisdom is a great perfection, from “it does not make form finite or infinite” up to “it does not make awakening, buddha, and the qualities of a buddha finite or infinite.”

original: ste / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i rang bzhin yin pas gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad la tshad yod pa dang tshad med pa'i rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung ba'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa chen mo yin no zhes
analyzed: ste / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i rang bzhin yin pas gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad la tshad yod pa dang tshad med pa'i rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung ba'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa chen mo yin no zhes
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the great perfection because the perfection of wisdom, having the nature of non-conceptuality, does not give rise to the concepts of limited or unlimited with regard to all phenomena such as form.

original: bstan pa'o // gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gzugs rgya chen por mi bgyid rgya chung ngur mi bgyid do zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bstan pa'o // gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gzugs rgya chen por mi bgyid rgya chung ngur mi bgyid do zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Moreover, the perfection of wisdom does not make form extensive or limited, and so on up to🔽it does not make enlightenment, Buddha, and the qualities of a Buddha extensive or limited.

original: byang chub dang sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams rgya chen por mi bgyid rgya chung ngur mi bgyid pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di pha rol tu phyin pa chen mo yin pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste
analyzed: byang chub dang sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams rgya chen por mi bgyid rgya chung ngur mi bgyid pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di pha rol tu phyin pa chen mo yin pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste
translated: This teaches the reason why this perfection of wisdom is the great perfection.

original: / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i rang bzhin yin pas /
analyzed: / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i rang bzhin yin pas /
translated: The perfection of wisdom, having the nature of non-conceptuality,

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad yongs su dag pa'i tshe yang rgya che bar rnam par mi rtog la /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad yongs su dag pa'i tshe yang rgya che bar rnam par mi rtog la /
translated: When all phenomena such as form and so on are completely pure, it is non-conceptual with regard to vastness.

original: yongs su ma dag pa'i tshe yang rgya chung bar rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa chen mo yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su ma dag pa'i tshe yang rgya chung bar rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa chen mo yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: And when they are completely impure, it is non-conceptual with regard to smallness. Therefore, it is the great perfection.

original: gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gzugs mthu dang ldan par mi bgyid /
analyzed: gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gzugs mthu dang ldan par mi bgyid /
translated: Moreover, the perfection of wisdom does not make form powerful🔽nor does it make it powerless.

original: mthu ma mchis par mi bgyid do zhes bya ba nas byang chub dang sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams mthu dang ldan par mi bgyid /
analyzed: mthu ma mchis par mi bgyid do zhes bya ba nas byang chub dang sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams mthu dang ldan par mi bgyid /
translated: Up to enlightenment, buddhahood, and the qualities of a buddha, it does not make them powerful🔽nor does it make them powerless.

original: mthu ma mchis par mi bgyid do zhes bya ba'i bar du yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di pha rol tu phyin pa chen mo yin pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: mthu ma mchis par mi bgyid do zhes bya ba'i bar du yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di pha rol tu phyin pa chen mo yin pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches the reason why this perfection of wisdom is the great perfection.

original: shes rab kyi pha @33b rol tu phyin pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i rang bzhin yin pas gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad mthu dang ldan par rnam par rtog pa yang med la /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha @33b rol tu phyin pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i rang bzhin yin pas gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad mthu dang ldan par rnam par rtog pa yang med la /
translated: Since the perfection of wisdom is the nature of nonconceptuality, there is no conception of all phenomena such as form as having power,

original: mthu chung bar rnam par rtog pa yang med de /
analyzed: mthu chung bar rnam par rtog pa yang med de /
translated: nor is there conception of them as having little power.

original: de ltar rnam par mi rtog pa lhun gyis grub pa'i yon tan che ba'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa chen mo yin no zhes bstan pa'o /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par mi rtog pa lhun gyis grub pa'i yon tan che ba'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa chen mo yin no zhes bstan pa'o /
translated: Thus, because of the greatness of the qualities of spontaneous nonconceptuality, it is the great perfection.

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam grangs des na 'di lta ste /🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa chen mo'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar gong du bshad pa'i rim pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di chos thams cad
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam grangs des na 'di lta ste / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa chen mo'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar gong du bshad pa'i rim pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di chos thams cad
translated: Bhagavan, for these reasons, this perfection of wisdom🔽is the great perfection of bodhisattva great beings.

original: dngos po med par rtog pas yongs su dag pa'i tshe yang yon tan du lta ba'i rnam par rtog pa med la /
analyzed: dngos po med par rtog pas yongs su dag pa'i tshe yang yon tan du lta ba'i rnam par rtog pa med la /
translated: Thus, by the stages explained above, when this perfection of wisdom is conceived as the nonexistence of all phenomena, it is pure, and at that time there is no conception of it as a good quality.

original: yongs su ma dag pa'i tshe yang skyon du lta ba'i rnam par rtog pa med de /
analyzed: yongs su ma dag pa'i tshe yang skyon du lta ba'i rnam par rtog pa med de /
translated: Even when it is impure, there is no discursive thought that regards it as a fault.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i yon tan che ba'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa chen mo yin pa'i don mjug bsdus te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i yon tan che ba'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa chen mo yin pa'i don mjug bsdus te bstan pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the great perfection of wisdom is concluded and taught because of the greatness of the nonconceptual qualities.

original: bcom ldan 'das gal te yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa la gsar du zhugs pas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gal te yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa la gsar du zhugs pas /
translated: Blessed One, if a bodhisattva mahāsattva who has newly entered the vehicle

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten zhes bya ba nas byang chub dang sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams mthu dang ldan par mi byed mthu med par mi byed do zhes bgyi bar 'du shes su gyur na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten zhes bya ba nas byang chub dang sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams mthu dang ldan par mi byed mthu med par mi byed do zhes bgyi bar 'du shes su gyur na /
translated: thinks, 'I will rely on the perfection of wisdom,' up to 'I will not make awakening, buddhahood, and the qualities of a buddha powerful or powerless,'

original: bcom ldan 'das de ltar 'du shes su gyur pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma lags so zhes bya ba'i bar du ni gal te theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa'i byang chub sems
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ltar 'du shes su gyur pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma lags so zhes bya ba'i bar du ni gal te theg pa la gsar du zhugs pa'i byang chub sems
translated: Blessed One, a bodhisattva great being who has such a conception is not practicing the perfection of wisdom.

original: dpa' rnams pha rol tu phyin pa drug la brten nas /
analyzed: dpa' rnams pha rol tu phyin pa drug la brten nas /
translated: Up to this point, if bodhisattvas who are new to the vehicle rely on the six perfections,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad che bar mi byed chung bar mi byed pa dang / 'du bar mi byed yangs par mi byed pa dang / tshad yod par mi byed tshad med par mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad che bar mi byed chung bar mi byed pa dang / 'du bar mi byed yangs par mi byed pa dang / tshad yod par mi byed tshad med par mi byed pa dang /
translated: they think, “This perfection of wisdom does not make all phenomena such as form greater or smaller, does not make them collected or dispersed, does not make them limited or unlimited,

original: rgya chen por mi byed /
analyzed: rgya chen por mi byed /
translated: does not make them vast🔽or narrow, does not make them powerful

original: rgya chung bar mi byed pa dang / mthu dang ldan par mi byed /
analyzed: rgya chung bar mi byed pa dang / mthu dang ldan par mi byed /
translated: or powerless.

original: mthu med par mi byed pa yin no snyam du sems shing dngos po dang mtshan mar bzung ste /
analyzed: mthu med par mi byed pa yin no snyam du sems shing dngos po dang mtshan mar bzung ste /
translated: They conceive of things and signs.

original: de ltar 'du shes su gyur na dmigs pa dang bcas shing mtshan ma dang bcas par spyod pa @34a * //
analyzed: de ltar 'du shes su gyur na dmigs pa dang bcas shing mtshan ma dang bcas par spyod pa @34a * //
translated: If one has such a perception, one is practicing with a reference point and with signs.

original: yin pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par mi chud do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yin pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par mi chud do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is taught that one does not enter into the practice of the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gzugs che bar bgyid pa'am /
analyzed: gang gzugs che bar bgyid pa'am /
translated: To make form greater or

original: chung bar bgyid pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang mthun pa'i 'bras bu ma lags so zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: chung bar bgyid pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang mthun pa'i 'bras bu ma lags so zhes bya ba nas /
translated: smaller is not a result that accords with the perfection of wisdom.

original: gang byang chub dang sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams mthu dang ldan par bgyid pa'am /
analyzed: gang byang chub dang sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams mthu dang ldan par bgyid pa'am /
translated: To make enlightenment, buddhahood, and the qualities of a buddha powerful or🔽not powerful is not a result that accords with the perfection of wisdom.

original: mthu ma mchis par bgyid pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang mthun pa'i 'bras bu ma lags te zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de ltar dngos por lta zhing mtshan mar 'dzin pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par
analyzed: mthu ma mchis par bgyid pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang mthun pa'i 'bras bu ma lags te zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de ltar dngos por lta zhing mtshan mar 'dzin pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par
translated: Up to this point, it is taught that to view things in that way and to apprehend signs is not the practice of the perfection of wisdom.

original: mi chud pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /🔽don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pas yongs su dag pa'i rang bzhin du gnas pa la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas che ba dang / chung ba dang / 'du ba dang / yangs pa dang / tshad yod pa dang /
analyzed: mi chud pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste / don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pas yongs su dag pa'i rang bzhin du gnas pa la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas che ba dang / chung ba dang / 'du ba dang / yangs pa dang / tshad yod pa dang /
translated: The explanation of the reason why it cannot be contained.

original: tshad med pa dang rgya chen po dang / rgya chung ba dang / mthu dang ldan pa dang / mthu med par bya zhing bsgyur du med pas de ltar che chung la sogs par byed pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mthu dang 'bras bu ma yin te /
analyzed: tshad med pa dang rgya chen po dang / rgya chung ba dang / mthu dang ldan pa dang / mthu med par bya zhing bsgyur du med pas de ltar che chung la sogs par byed pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mthu dang 'bras bu ma yin te /
translated: Since all phenomena are empty by nature on the ultimate level, they abide in a completely pure nature. Since it is not possible to make the perfection of wisdom greater or smaller, more numerous or less numerous, limited or unlimited, vast or narrow, powerful or powerless, or to transform it, the creation of greater or lesser size and so forth is not the power or result of the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i rang bzhin du gnas pa la che chung la sogs pa byed cing rnam par rtog par 'du shes par gyur na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma yin no zhes bya
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i rang bzhin du gnas pa la che chung la sogs pa byed cing rnam par rtog par 'du shes par gyur na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ma yin no zhes bya
translated: If one were to think that the perfection of wisdom, which abides in the nature of nonconceptuality, can be made greater or smaller and so forth and to conceptualize it, one would not be practicing the perfection of wisdom.

original: ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: and so on.

original: bcom ldan 'das gang de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Blessed One, when one practices the perfection of wisdom in this way,

original: gzugs che bar bgyid pa'am /
analyzed: gzugs che bar bgyid pa'am /
translated: one does not make form greater🔽or smaller,

original: chung bar bgyid pa'am zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: chung bar bgyid pa'am zhes bya ba nas /
translated: and so on, up to

original: byang chub dang / sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams mthu dang ldan par bgyid pa'am /
analyzed: byang chub dang / sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams mthu dang ldan par bgyid pa'am /
translated: one does not make the qualities of a Buddha powerful🔽or powerless. That would be a great object of observation for them.

original: mthu ma mchis par bgyid pa de ni de'i dmigs pa chen por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de ltar chos thams cad don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong zhing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang rnam par mi rtog pa'i rang bzhin yin
analyzed: mthu ma mchis par bgyid pa de ni de'i dmigs pa chen por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de ltar chos thams cad don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong zhing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang rnam par mi rtog pa'i rang bzhin yin
translated: Thus, all phenomena are ultimately empty by nature, and the perfection of wisdom has the nature of non-conceptuality.

original: te / ci yang mi byed pa la chos thams cad che ba dang / chung ba dang / 'du ba dang / yangs pa dang / tshad yod pa dang / tshad med pa dang / rgya che ba dang / rgya chung ba dang / mthu dang ldan pa dang /
analyzed: te / ci yang mi byed pa la chos thams cad che ba dang / chung ba dang / 'du ba dang / yangs pa dang / tshad yod pa dang / tshad med pa dang / rgya che ba dang / rgya chung ba dang / mthu dang ldan pa dang /
translated: Since it does not do anything at all, all phenomena are not greater or smaller, not collected or dispersed, not limited or unlimited, not vast or narrow, not powerful or powerless, not defiled or purified, not arising or ceasing, not increasing or decreasing, not pure or impure, not real or unreal, not true or false, not existent or non-existent, not past, future, or present.

original: mthu med par byed par lta zhing @34b mtshan mar 'dzin na dmigs pa can du gyur pas byang chub sems dpa' de'i skyon chen por 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mthu med par byed par lta zhing @34b mtshan mar 'dzin na dmigs pa can du gyur pas byang chub sems dpa' de'i skyon chen por 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: If they were to see them as powerless, and to apprehend them as having signs, then they would have a reference point, and that would be a great fault for those bodhisattvas.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dmigs pa'i 'du shes can la byang chub ces bgyi ba ma mchis te zhes bya ba ni de ltar dmigs pa dang bcas shing /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i 'du shes can la byang chub ces bgyi ba ma mchis te zhes bya ba ni de ltar dmigs pa dang bcas shing /
translated: Because there is no awakening for those who have the perception of a reference point.

original: mtshan mar 'dzin pa skyon chen por 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan mar 'dzin pa skyon chen por 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: This shows the reason why having a reference point and apprehending signs is a great fault.

original: de ltar dmigs pa'i 'du shes can du gyur na bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar dmigs pa'i 'du shes can du gyur na bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that if one has the perception of a reference point, one will not attain unsurpassed awakening.

original: de ni 'di ltar sems can skye ba ma mchis pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa skye ba ma mchis par lta'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar sems can skye ba ma mchis pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa skye ba ma mchis par lta'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Because sentient beings are non-arisen, one should see the perfection of wisdom as non-arisen.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi stobs yongs su 'grub pa ma mchis pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i stobs yongs su 'grub pa ma mchis par lta'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu🔽phyin pa don dam par dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa la /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi stobs yongs su 'grub pa ma mchis pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i stobs yongs su 'grub pa ma mchis par lta'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa don dam par dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin yin pa la /
translated: The power of the perfection of wisdom is not established because the power of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening is not established.

original: dngos po dang mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing dmigs pa'i 'du shes can du mi bya ba'i don bstan pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po dang mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing dmigs pa'i 'du shes can du mi bya ba'i don bstan pa ste /
translated: Up to here, it is the explanation of the meaning of not apprehending things and not making the perception of reference points in the ultimate nature of the perfection of wisdom, which is non-entityness.

original: de ni 'di ltar sems can skye ba ma mchis pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa skye ba ma mchis par lta'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar sems can skye ba ma mchis pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa skye ba ma mchis par lta'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Thus, the perfection of wisdom is seen as non-arisen because sentient beings are non-arisen.

original: mu stegs can gyis brtags pa'i sems can dngos po med pas skye ba med pa'i phyin shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang don dam par skye ba med par shes par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mu stegs can gyis brtags pa'i sems can dngos po med pas skye ba med pa'i phyin shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang don dam par skye ba med par shes par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This teaches that because the sentient beings imputed by the tīrthikas are non-entities, they are non-arisen. Therefore, the perfection of wisdom should be understood as ultimately non-arisen.

original: de ni gang zag la bdag med par rtogs pa'i sgo nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa skye ba med par lta ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ni gang zag la bdag med par rtogs pa'i sgo nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa skye ba med par lta ba bstan pa'o //
translated: This teaches the view of the non-production of the perfection of wisdom through the realization of the selflessness of persons.

original: gzugs skye ba ma mchis pa'i slad du /
analyzed: gzugs skye ba ma mchis pa'i slad du /
translated: Because form is non-produced,🔽the perfection of wisdom should be viewed as non-produced.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa skye ba ma mchis par blta'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gzugs la sogs pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la thug gi bar gyi chos rnams skye ba med pa bstan pas chos la
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa skye ba ma mchis par blta'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gzugs la sogs pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la thug gi bar gyi chos rnams skye ba med pa bstan pas chos la
translated: This and so forth teaches the non-production of phenomena from form up to unsurpassed perfect complete enlightenment.

original: bdag med par rtogs pa'i sgo nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa skye ba med par lta ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bdag med par rtogs pa'i sgo nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa skye ba med par lta ba bstan pa'o //
translated: This teaches the view of the non-production of the perfection of wisdom through the realization of the selflessness of phenomena.

original: skye ba med pa'i 'gres la ji ltar bshad pa de bzhin du rang bzhin med pa'i 'gres dang / dngos po med pa'i 'gres dang / stong pa nyid kyi 'gres dang / dben pa'i 'gres dang / med pa'i @35a * //
analyzed: skye ba med pa'i 'gres la ji ltar bshad pa de bzhin du rang bzhin med pa'i 'gres dang / dngos po med pa'i 'gres dang / stong pa nyid kyi 'gres dang / dben pa'i 'gres dang / med pa'i @35a * //
translated: Just as it is explained in the repetition of non-production, so it is in the repetition of naturelessness, the repetition of non-entityness, the repetition of emptiness, the repetition of isolation, and the repetition of non-existence.

original: 'gres dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i 'gres dang / rnam par 'jigs pa med pa'i 'gres dang / mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba med pa'i 'gres dang / stobs yongs su 'grub pa med pa'i 'gres rnams la yang sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'gres dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i 'gres dang / rnam par 'jigs pa med pa'i 'gres dang / mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba med pa'i 'gres dang / stobs yongs su 'grub pa med pa'i 'gres rnams la yang sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: And the same should be applied to the repetition of the inconceivable, the repetition of the fearless, the repetition of the non-attainment of perfect buddhahood, and the repetition of the non-attainment of the powers.

original: skye ba med pa dang ; rang bzhin med pa la sogs pa'i tshig bcu po 'di dag kyang dngos po med pa'i rnam grangs su rig par bya'o //🔽bcom ldan 'das rnam grangs des kyang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: skye ba med pa dang ; rang bzhin med pa la sogs pa'i tshig bcu po 'di dag kyang dngos po med pa'i rnam grangs su rig par bya'o // bcom ldan 'das rnam grangs des kyang 'di lta ste /
translated: These ten terms beginning with non-arising and naturelessness should be known as synonyms for non-entityness.🔽Blessed One, for these reasons this perfection of wisdom is the great perfection of the bodhisattva great beings.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa chen mo'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di skye ba med cing rang bzhin med pa la
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa chen mo'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di skye ba med cing rang bzhin med pa la
translated: Thus, this perfection of wisdom, which is non-arising and natureless,

original: sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin zhing rnam par rtog pa med pas chos gang la yang che chung dang bzang ngan la sogs par mi byed cing mtshan mar mi 'dzin pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa chen mo yin no zhes shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin
analyzed: sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin zhing rnam par rtog pa med pas chos gang la yang che chung dang bzang ngan la sogs par mi byed cing mtshan mar mi 'dzin pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa chen mo yin no zhes shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin
translated: Thus it is the great perfection.

original: pa yon tan che ba'i don mjug bsdus te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: pa yon tan che ba'i don mjug bsdus te bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the summary and teaching of the meaning of the great qualities of the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum pa rgya cher bshad pa las le'u nyi shu drug go //🔽/ de nas tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bus /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum pa rgya cher bshad pa las le'u nyi shu drug go // / de nas tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bus /
translated: This concludes the twenty-sixth chapter on the perfection of wisdom in the commentary on the one hundred thousand verse Prajnaparamita.

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Then the Venerable Shariputra said to the Blessed One...🔽...how long has it been since she began practicing the perfection of wisdom?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ni yun ring po ji srid cig nas spyad pa lags zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de ltar gong du bshad pa'i rim pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yon tan che zhing rgya che ba sh'a
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ni yun ring po ji srid cig nas spyad pa lags zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de ltar gong du bshad pa'i rim pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yon tan che zhing rgya che ba sh'a
translated: ...This is the sequence of explanations above. This perfection of wisdom has great qualities and is vast.

original: ri'i bus thos nas dad pa skyes te /
analyzed: ri'i bus thos nas dad pa skyes te /
translated: The son of the mountain heard this and faith arose in him.🔽He asked, “In what place did the bodhisattva who has faith and interest in this profound perfection of wisdom die and be reborn here?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di lta bu la dad cing mos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de gnas gang nas tshe 'phos te 'dir skyes pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed nas yun ji srid cig lon pa dang /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di lta bu la dad cing mos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de gnas gang nas tshe 'phos te 'dir skyes pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed nas yun ji srid cig lon pa dang /
translated: How long has it been since he generated the mind of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening?

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ji snyed cig la bsnyen bkur byas pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad nas yun ji srid cig lon par zhus pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ji snyed cig la bsnyen bkur byas pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad nas yun ji srid cig lon par zhus pa'o //
translated: How many bhagavān buddhas has he served? How long has it been since he practiced the six perfections?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said,🔽“Son of a good family, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Gadgadasvara, having died in the world system called Sarva­gandha­sugandhā, was reborn here.

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par @35b rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas tshad med grangs med pa bsnyen bkur nas 'dir 'ongs shing 'dir skyes pa
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par @35b rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas tshad med grangs med pa bsnyen bkur nas 'dir 'ongs shing 'dir skyes pa
translated: “Śāradvatī­putra, that great bodhisattva being has served countless, immeasurable tathāgatas, arhats, and perfectly awakened buddhas in the world systems of the ten directions, and has come here and been born here.

original: ste zhes bya ba nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la mos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de gang nas tshe 'phos te 'dir skyes pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa ji snyed cig la bsnyen bkur byas pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ste zhes bya ba nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la mos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de gang nas tshe 'phos te 'dir skyes pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa ji snyed cig la bsnyen bkur byas pa bstan pa'o //
translated: ” This passage explains from where the bodhisattva who has conviction in this profound transcendent perfection of wisdom has transmigrated and been born here, and how many tathāgatas he has served.

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong grangs med tshad med dpag tu med par sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pa'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong grangs med tshad med dpag tu med par sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pa'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: “Śāradvatī­putra, that great bodhisattva being has practiced the transcendent perfection of generosity for countless, immeasurable hundreds of thousands of quintillions of eons.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad pa nas yun ji srid lon pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad pa nas yun ji srid lon pa bstan pa'o //
translated: From “He practiced the perfection of wisdom” up to “He practiced the six perfections” shows how long he has been practicing.

original: de ni bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong grangs med tshad med dpag tu med pa nas /🔽bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par zhugs pa ste zhes bya bas ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed nas yun ji srid lon par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ni bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong grangs med tshad med dpag tu med pa nas / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par zhugs pa ste zhes bya bas ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed nas yun ji srid lon par bstan pa'o //
translated: “For countless, immeasurable, and innumerable hundreds of thousands of quintillions of eons”🔽shows how long it has been since he first developed the aspiration to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de sems dang po bskyed phyin chad sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing 'dir 'ongs pa'o zhes bya ba nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing 'dir 'ongs pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams nas
analyzed: de sems dang po bskyed phyin chad sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing 'dir 'ongs pa'o zhes bya ba nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing 'dir 'ongs pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams nas
translated: “Since he first developed the aspiration to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, he has practiced the perfection of generosity and has come here,” and similarly, “he has practiced the perfection of wisdom and has come here” shows how he has come from the worlds of the ten directions.

original: tshe 'phos zhing 'dir skye tshe rabs snga ma la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la goms pa'o //
analyzed: tshe 'phos zhing 'dir skye tshe rabs snga ma la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la goms pa'o //
translated: When they pass away from that life and are reborn here, they have been familiar with the perfection of wisdom in previous lives.

original: des de nas bzung ste de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas grangs med tshad med dpag tu med pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa mtshungs pa med pa bsnyen bkur nas 'dir 'ongs shing 'dir skyes pa ste zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: des de nas bzung ste de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas grangs med tshad med dpag tu med pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa mtshungs pa med pa bsnyen bkur nas 'dir 'ongs shing 'dir skyes pa ste zhes bya bas ni /
translated: From that time on, they have served countless, immeasurable, and uncountable Tathagatas, Arhats, and Perfectly Awakened Ones, and have come here and been reborn here.

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams nas tshe 'pho zhing 'dir skye ba'i tshe /
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams nas tshe 'pho zhing 'dir skye ba'i tshe /
translated: This shows that when they pass away from a life in a world system in the ten directions and are reborn here,

original: sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur byed pa dang ma bral ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur byed pa dang ma bral ba bstan pa'o //
translated: they are not separated from serving many Buddhas.

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des /
translated: “ Shariputra, when those Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di mthong ngam thos nas zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di mthong ngam thos nas zhes bya ba nas /
translated: see or hear this perfection of wisdom,

original: don dang tshul gyis rjes su 'brang bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de ltar tshe rabs snga ma la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la goms par byas pa'i rgyus tshe 'di la yang shes @36a * //🔽rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di mthong ba tsam mam /
analyzed: don dang tshul gyis rjes su 'brang bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de ltar tshe rabs snga ma la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la goms par byas pa'i rgyus tshe 'di la yang shes @36a * // rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di mthong ba tsam mam /
translated: The passage up to will follow after it in terms of meaning and method teaches the benefit of seeing and hearing the perfection of wisdom in this life through the cause of having cultivated the perfection of wisdom in previous lives.

original: thos pa tsam gyis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mthong zhing thos pa dang 'dra bar dad pa skye ba dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo ji lta ba dang / tshul ji lta ba bzhin du phyin ci ma log par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
analyzed: thos pa tsam gyis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mthong zhing thos pa dang 'dra bar dad pa skye ba dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo ji lta ba dang / tshul ji lta ba bzhin du phyin ci ma log par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
translated: The passage from Subhūti, if a son of a good family or daughter of a good family up to will follow after it in terms of meaning and method teaches the benefit of generating faith in the perfection of wisdom through merely seeing or hearing it in this life, and of realizing the profound meaning and method of the perfection of wisdom just as they are without error.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mnyan pa'am blta bar nus sam zhes bya ba ni gong du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mthong ngam thos na ston pa mthong zhing thos par sems par 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa la 'khor
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mnyan pa'am blta bar nus sam zhes bya ba ni gong du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mthong ngam thos na ston pa mthong zhing thos par sems par 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa la 'khor
translated: The statement Blessed One, is it possible to listen to or behold the perfection of wisdom? refers to the above explanation that if one sees or hears the perfection of wisdom, one thinks that one sees or hears the Teacher.

original: gyi nang nas kha cig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di don dam par yang dngos po yod de mnyan cing bltar yod pa zhig yin nam snyam du the tshom za ba bsal ba'i phyir zhus pa'o //🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa ;
analyzed: gyi nang nas kha cig shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di don dam par yang dngos po yod de mnyan cing bltar yod pa zhig yin nam snyam du the tshom za ba bsal ba'i phyir zhus pa'o // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa ;
translated: The question Blessed One, is it possible to listen to or look at the perfection of wisdom? is asked by someone in the assembly who doubts, thinking, If the perfection of wisdom is seen or heard, the Teacher is seen and heard.

original: rab 'byor de ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ni ma yin no //
translated: The Blessed One said, Subhūti, that is not so.🔽Subhūti, in the perfection of wisdom there is no listening, no looking. The perfection of wisdom itself does not listen or look.

original: rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ni nyan pa med do lta ba med do shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyang mi nyan mi lta'o zhes bya ba ni don dam par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rang bzhin
analyzed: rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ni nyan pa med do lta ba med do shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyang mi nyan mi lta'o zhes bya ba ni don dam par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rang bzhin
translated: This is because ultimately the perfection of wisdom is empty of inherent nature, and what is empty of inherent nature does not listen or look.🔽The word itself is used to exclude the listener and so on.

original: gyis stong pas gzhan gyis blta zhing mnyan par bya ba'i dngos po yang ma yin la /
analyzed: gyis stong pas gzhan gyis blta zhing mnyan par bya ba'i dngos po yang ma yin la /
translated: It is not a thing to be seen or heard by others because it is empty.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid gzhan las nyan cing lta ba'i dngos po yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽chos la sems pa med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de dag gis mi thos mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba nas chos la sems pa med pa'i phyir byang chub dang sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas kyi chos ni de dag gis mi thos
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid gzhan las nyan cing lta ba'i dngos po yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to // chos la sems pa med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni de dag gis mi thos mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba nas chos la sems pa med pa'i phyir byang chub dang sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas kyi chos ni de dag gis mi thos
translated: It is not a thing to be heard or seen from others, the perfection of wisdom itself.🔽The perfection of wisdom is not heard or seen by them because phenomena are without mind.

original: mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa chos thams cad la mnyan cing bltar med pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa chos thams cad la mnyan cing bltar med pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: From “The perfection of wisdom is not heard or seen by them because phenomena are without mind” up to “Awakening, Buddha, and the qualities of a Buddha are not heard or seen by them because phenomena are without mind,” the text teaches the reason why the perfection of wisdom and so on are not heard or seen:

original: chos la sems pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni don dam par chos thams cad dngos po med par lta ba dang / nyan par sems pa yang mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos la sems pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni don dam par chos thams cad dngos po med par lta ba dang / nyan par sems pa yang mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the Dharma has no thought, means that ultimately all dharmas are seen as unreal, and it is impossible to think of hearing and seeing.

original: de dag gis mi thos mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thos shing mthong na /
analyzed: de dag gis mi thos mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thos shing mthong na /
translated: They do not hear and do not see, means that when they hear and see the perfection of wisdom,

original: ston pa thos shing mthong bar sems pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis @36b mi thos mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ston pa thos shing mthong bar sems pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis @36b mi thos mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: those bodhisattvas who think of hearing and seeing the Teacher do not hear and do not see.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la brtson par bgyid pa de yun ring po ji srid cig nas spyod spyod pa lags zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la brtson par bgyid pa de yun ring po ji srid cig nas spyod spyod pa lags zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin
translated: Subhūti said, “Blessed One, how long have those bodhisattva great beings who strive in this deep perfection of wisdom been practicing? ”

original: pa zab mo 'di la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis spyod pa'i yon tan bstan pa dang / dmigs pa dang bcas par spyod pa rnams kyi skyon zhib tu bstan pa'i gleng bslang ba'i phyir zhus pa'o //
analyzed: pa zab mo 'di la mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis spyod pa'i yon tan bstan pa dang / dmigs pa dang bcas par spyod pa rnams kyi skyon zhib tu bstan pa'i gleng bslang ba'i phyir zhus pa'o //
translated: This is the introduction to the teaching of the good qualities of practicing this profound perfection of wisdom by way of non-apprehension, and to the detailed teaching of the faults of those who practice with apprehension.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said:🔽Subhuti, this must be analyzed and explained.

original: rab 'byor 'di ni rnam par phye zhing bshad dgos pa ste zhes bya ba ni tshe rabs snga ma yun ring po nas mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa la spyod spyod pa dang / dmigs pa'i tshul gyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa la spyod pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di thos nas skur ba 'debs shing rab tu spong ba dag kyang yod de /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ni rnam par phye zhing bshad dgos pa ste zhes bya ba ni tshe rabs snga ma yun ring po nas mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa la spyod spyod pa dang / dmigs pa'i tshul gyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa la spyod pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di thos nas skur ba 'debs shing rab tu spong ba dag kyang yod de /
translated: This teaches that there are those who, having practiced for a long time in former lives the six perfections and so forth by way of non-apprehension, and having practiced the six perfections and so forth by way of apprehension, having heard this profound perfection of wisdom, deprecate it and utterly reject it.

original: de dag kyang rnam par phye ste bshad dgos so zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang rnam par phye ste bshad dgos so zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: And it is they who must be analyzed and explained.

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la la sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po la la sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
translated: Subhūti, some bodhisattva great beings, starting from the production of the first thought,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis brtson par byed pa dang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis brtson par byed pa dang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: apply themselves to this deep perfection of wisdom in a way that does not apprehend anything, and so on up to🔽Subhūti, those bodhisattva great beings apply themselves to this deep perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de lta bu dag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la brtson par byed do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de lta bu dag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la brtson par byed do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa
translated: In this passage, “apply themselves to this deep perfection of wisdom” and so on up to “in a way that does not apprehend anything” refers to the six perfections and so on.

original: la yun ring po nas spyod spyod pas don dam par chos thams cad stong pa nyid du rtogs shing /
analyzed: la yun ring po nas spyod spyod pas don dam par chos thams cad stong pa nyid du rtogs shing /
translated: They have practiced for a long time in a way that does not apprehend anything and have realized that ultimately all phenomena are emptiness.

original: chos gang la yang 'phel ba dang 'grib pa med par mthong bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di thos na yang skur ba mi 'debs mi spong zhing sems dang po bskyed pa nas pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa dang mi
analyzed: chos gang la yang 'phel ba dang 'grib pa med par mthong bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di thos na yang skur ba mi 'debs mi spong zhing sems dang po bskyed pa nas pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa dang mi
translated: Because they see that no dharma increases or decreases, when they hear this profound perfection of wisdom, they do not deprecate it, do not reject it, and from the first production of the thought of enlightenment are not separated from the six perfections and so forth.

original: 'bral ba'i yon tan dang ldan pa de lta bu'i byang chub sems dpa' dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: 'bral ba'i yon tan dang ldan pa de lta bu'i byang chub sems dpa' dag kyang yod do //
translated: There are also such bodhisattvas who have the qualities of being endowed with.

original: de dag ni tshe rabs snga ma yun ring po nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la goms par byed byed pas /
analyzed: de dag ni tshe rabs snga ma yun ring po nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la goms par byed byed pas /
translated: They have long since in previous lives familiarized themselves again and again with this profound perfection of wisdom.

original: tshe 'di la yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la skur ba mi 'debs shing brtson @37a * //
