analyzed: de ltar rang bzhin gyis stong zhing yongs su dag par rtogs pa la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The realization that it is empty of nature and pure in that way is called the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de lta bu ni dmigs pa dang bcas shing mtshan mar 'dzin pa rnams kyis rtogs par mi nus shing gting dpag dka' ba'i phyir zab mo zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de lta bu ni dmigs pa dang bcas shing mtshan mar 'dzin pa rnams kyis rtogs par mi nus shing gting dpag dka' ba'i phyir zab mo zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: That perfection of wisdom is called “profound” because it cannot be realized by those who have an objective support and who apprehend signs, because it is difficult to fathom.

original: gzugs la ji ltar bshad pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: gzugs la ji ltar bshad pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as it is explained with regard to form,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du chos thams cad la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du chos thams cad la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: it should be applied in the same way to all phenomena up to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor gzugs @39a * //
analyzed: rab 'byor gzugs @39a * //
translated: Subhūti, form

original: ni sngon gyi mtha' ma bcings ma grol ba ste zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: ni sngon gyi mtha' ma bcings ma grol ba ste zhes bya ba nas /
translated: is not bound and is not liberated, up to

original: rab 'byor da ltar byung ba dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni chos thams cad ma bcings ma grol bar bstan pa de nyid gsal bar bshad pa'i phyir dus gsum dang sbyar nas bstan pa
analyzed: rab 'byor da ltar byung ba dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni chos thams cad ma bcings ma grol bar bstan pa de nyid gsal bar bshad pa'i phyir dus gsum dang sbyar nas bstan pa
translated: Subhūti, the nature of the non-existence of the present is the knowledge of all aspects. This is taught in connection with the three times in order to clarify the teaching that all phenomena are neither bound nor liberated.

original: ste / dmigs pa can kha cig gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad 'das pa'i dus na ni bya ba byas zin pa'i rang bzhin du yod /
analyzed: ste / dmigs pa can kha cig gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad 'das pa'i dus na ni bya ba byas zin pa'i rang bzhin du yod /
translated: Some essentialists believe that all phenomena, such as form, exist in the past as having the nature of having performed their function.

original: da ltar byung ba'i dus na ni bya ba byed pa'i rang bzhin du yod /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i dus na ni bya ba byed pa'i rang bzhin du yod /
translated: They exist in the present as having the nature of performing their function.🔽They exist in the future as having the nature of performing their function.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na ni bya ba byed par 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin du yod par lta ba las bzlog pa'i phyir don dam par gzugs nyid kyang dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na ni bya ba byed par 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin du yod par lta ba las bzlog pa'i phyir don dam par gzugs nyid kyang dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin yin la /
translated: To refute this, it is said that ultimately form itself is not an entity that exists.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba zhes bya ba'i dus kyang gzugs nyid zhig pa dang / ma byung ba dang / gnas pa las gdags su zad kyi de las gud na sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / da ltar byung ba zhes bya ba'i dngos po med de dus gsum char yang rang bzhin gyis stong zhing de bzhin nyid du ro gcig ste /
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba zhes bya ba'i dus kyang gzugs nyid zhig pa dang / ma byung ba dang / gnas pa las gdags su zad kyi de las gud na sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / da ltar byung ba zhes bya ba'i dngos po med de dus gsum char yang rang bzhin gyis stong zhing de bzhin nyid du ro gcig ste /
translated: The past, future, and present are merely imputed on the basis of form disintegrating, not having arisen, and enduring. Apart from that, there is no entity called past, future, or present. The three times are all empty of nature and are of one taste in suchness.

original: mi 'gyur ba yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir bcings pa dang grol ba med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir bcings pa dang grol ba med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Because of the complete perfection of the unchanging, there is no bondage or liberation.

original: gzugs la ji ltar bshad pa de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du chos thams cad la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs la ji ltar bshad pa de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du chos thams cad la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Just as it is explained with regard to form, so it is to be applied to all phenomena up to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni brtson 'grus chung ba /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni brtson 'grus chung ba /
translated: The Lord: Subhuti, it is hard for those who have little faith,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed pa /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed pa /
translated: who have not planted wholesome roots,

original: sdig pa'i grogs po'i sug par lhung ba /
analyzed: sdig pa'i grogs po'i sug par lhung ba /
translated: who have fallen into the power of bad spiritual friends,

original: bdud kyi dbang du gyur pa /
analyzed: bdud kyi dbang du gyur pa /
translated: who have come under the influence of Mara,

original: le lo can brtson 'grus btang ba /
analyzed: le lo can brtson 'grus btang ba /
translated: who are lazy, who have given up striving,🔽who have lost mindfulness, who are without clear comprehension, to have faith in this perfection of wisdom.

original: dran pa nyams pa shes bzhin dang mi ldan pa rnams kyis mos par dka'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni chos thams cad rnam par dag pa bstan pa'i sgo nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di mos par dka' zhing zab par bshad pa'i skabs
analyzed: dran pa nyams pa shes bzhin dang mi ldan pa rnams kyis mos par dka'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni chos thams cad rnam par dag pa bstan pa'i sgo nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di mos par dka' zhing zab par bshad pa'i skabs
translated: This is the section on the explanation of the profundity of the perfection of wisdom, which is hard to believe in, by way of the teaching on the purity of all phenomena.

original: dbye ba'i phyir rab 'byor gyis glengs pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa'o //
analyzed: dbye ba'i phyir rab 'byor gyis glengs pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa'o //
translated: In order to analyze this, Subhūti asks, and the Lord replies.

original: rab 'byor gzugs rnam par dag pa gang yin pa de ni 'bras bu rnam par dag pa'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzugs rnam par dag pa gang yin pa de ni 'bras bu rnam par dag pa'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Subhūti, whatever purity of form that is the purity of effect, and so on up to:🔽Subhūti, whatever purity of the knowledge of all aspects that is the purity of effect.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par dag pa gang yin pa de ni 'bras bu rnam @39b par dag pa'o zhes bya'i bar du ni chos thams cad rnam par dag pa bstan pa'i sgo nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mos par dka' zhing🔽zab par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par dag pa gang yin pa de ni 'bras bu rnam @39b par dag pa'o zhes bya'i bar du ni chos thams cad rnam par dag pa bstan pa'i sgo nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mos par dka' zhing zab par bstan pa ste /
translated: This passage from “Subhūti, whatever purity of form that is the purity of effect” up to “Subhūti, whatever purity of the knowledge of all aspects that is the purity of effect” teaches that the perfection of wisdom is difficult to believe and profound because it teaches the purity of all phenomena.

original: de la rab 'byor gzugs rnam par dag pa gang yin pa de ni 'bras bu rnam par dag pa'o zhes bya ba ni don dam par gzugs kyi rang bzhin stong zhing /
analyzed: de la rab 'byor gzugs rnam par dag pa gang yin pa de ni 'bras bu rnam par dag pa'o zhes bya ba ni don dam par gzugs kyi rang bzhin stong zhing /
translated: In this passage, “Subhūti, whatever purity of form that is the purity of effect” means that ultimately the nature of form is empty and that the nature of form is not different from the nature of emptiness.

original: rnam par dag pa gang yin pa de nyid mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba yang dag pa'i mtha'i rang bzhin pha rol tu phyin pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa'i 'bras bu yin gyis de las gud na 'bras bu gzhan med de /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa gang yin pa de nyid mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba yang dag pa'i mtha'i rang bzhin pha rol tu phyin pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa'i 'bras bu yin gyis de las gud na 'bras bu gzhan med de /
translated: That very purity is called nirvana, the nature of the limit of reality, the fruit of the perfections, the factors of enlightenment, and so on, and there is no other fruit apart from that.

original: de bas na don dam par gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad rnam par dag pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa 'bras bu zhes bya ba de dag de bzhin nyid du ro gcig ste /
analyzed: de bas na don dam par gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad rnam par dag pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa 'bras bu zhes bya ba de dag de bzhin nyid du ro gcig ste /
translated: Therefore, ultimately all phenomena such as form and so on are pure, and nirvana is called the fruit, and they are of one taste in suchness.

original: rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin du tha mi dad do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin du tha mi dad do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It is taught that they are not different in the nature of purity.

original: gzugs la ji ltar bshad pa de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs la ji ltar bshad pa de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Just as it is explained for form, it should be applied in the same way up to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang gzugs yongs su dag pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang gzugs yongs su dag pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, the purity of form is the purity of the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa gang yin pa de ni gzugs yongs su dag pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa gang yin pa de ni gzugs yongs su dag pa ste /
translated: The purity of the perfection of wisdom is the purity of form.

original: de ltar na gzugs yongs su dag pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa 'di la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med so so ma yin tha mi dad do zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de ltar na gzugs yongs su dag pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa 'di la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med so so ma yin tha mi dad do zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Thus, the purity of form and the purity of the perfection of wisdom are not two and cannot be divided into two, are not separate, and are not cut off.

original: de ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su dag pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa 'di la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med so so ma yin tha mi dad do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad yongs su dag pa dang /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su dag pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa 'di la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med so so ma yin tha mi dad do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad yongs su dag pa dang /
translated: Thus, the purity of the knowledge of all aspects and the purity of the perfection of wisdom are not two and cannot be divided into two, are not separate, and are not cut off.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa gnyis don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid du ro gcig ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa gnyis don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid du ro gcig ste /
translated: Thus, the purity of all phenomena such as form and the purity of the perfection of wisdom are ultimately of one taste in the emptiness of inherent nature.

original: tha mi dad par bstan pa'i sgo nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di zab cing mos par dka' ba bstan pa ste /
analyzed: tha mi dad par bstan pa'i sgo nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di zab cing mos par dka' ba bstan pa ste /
translated: This shows the perfection of wisdom to be profound and difficult to believe in terms of the door of non-difference.

original: de la gnyis su med pa ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid du ro gcig pa'i phyir ro //🔽gnyis su byar med pa ni de ltar stong pa nyid du ro gcig pa la tha dad du dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la gnyis su med pa ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid du ro gcig pa'i phyir ro // gnyis su byar med pa ni de ltar stong pa nyid du ro gcig pa la tha dad du dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therein, non-duality is because of the single taste of emptiness of intrinsic nature.🔽Indivisibility is because of the indivisibility of the different divisions in the single taste of emptiness in that way.

original: so so ma yin pa ni de ltar stong pa nyid du ro gcig pa la bye @40a * //🔽brag dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so so ma yin pa ni de ltar stong pa nyid du ro gcig pa la bye @40a * // brag dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Non-separateness is because of the indivisibility of the different divisions in the single taste of emptiness in that way.

original: tha mi dad pa ni de ltar stong pa nyid du ro gcig pa la gzhan gyis par mi chod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa ni de ltar stong pa nyid du ro gcig pa la gzhan gyis par mi chod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Non-difference is because of the uninterruptedness of the single taste of emptiness in that way.

original: gzugs la ji ltar bshad pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: gzugs la ji ltar bshad pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as it was explained in relation to form,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du chos thams cad la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du chos thams cad la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: it should be applied in the same way to all phenomena up to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang bdag rnam par dag pa gang yin pa de ni gzugs rnam par dag pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang bdag rnam par dag pa gang yin pa de ni gzugs rnam par dag pa /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, the purity of the self is the purity of form.

original: gzugs rnam par dag pa gang yin pa de ni bdag rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs rnam par dag pa gang yin pa de ni bdag rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: The purity of form is the purity of the self.

original: de ltar na bdag rnam par dag pa dang / gzugs rnam par dag pa 'di la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med so so ma yin tha mi dad do zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de ltar na bdag rnam par dag pa dang / gzugs rnam par dag pa 'di la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med so so ma yin tha mi dad do zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Thus, the purity of the self and the purity of form are non-dual and indivisible.

original: de ltar mthong ba po rnam par dag pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par dag pa 'di la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med so so ma yin tha mi dad do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni mu stegs can gyis brtags pa'i bdag dang /
analyzed: de ltar mthong ba po rnam par dag pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par dag pa 'di la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med so so ma yin tha mi dad do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni mu stegs can gyis brtags pa'i bdag dang /
translated: In the same way, the purity of the seer and the purity of omniscience are non-dual and indivisible.

original: sems can dang / srog dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu bu dang / gang zag dang / shed can dang / shed bdag dang / byed pa po dang / tshor ba po dang / shes pa po dang / mthong ba po dang / bdag rnam pa bcu gnyis po de dag rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir rnam par dag pa dang /
analyzed: sems can dang / srog dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu bu dang / gang zag dang / shed can dang / shed bdag dang / byed pa po dang / tshor ba po dang / shes pa po dang / mthong ba po dang / bdag rnam pa bcu gnyis po de dag rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir rnam par dag pa dang /
translated: because sentient beings, living beings, creatures, humans, individuals, humankind, humankind as a whole, those who possess, those who possess intention, agents, those who feel, those who know, those who see, and the self are empty of inherent nature.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du chos thams cad rnam par dag pa re re dang sbyar te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du chos thams cad rnam par dag pa re re dang sbyar te /
translated: In the same way, connect this with each, up to all phenomena, up to the knowledge of all aspects, are pure.

original: rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin du tha mi dad pa bstan pa'i sgo nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di zab cing mos par dka' ba bstan pa'o //🔽rab 'byor gzhan yang bdag yongs su dag pas gzugs yongs su dag pa /🔽gzugs yongs su dag pas /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin du tha mi dad pa bstan pa'i sgo nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di zab cing mos par dka' ba bstan pa'o // rab 'byor gzhan yang bdag yongs su dag pas gzugs yongs su dag pa / gzugs yongs su dag pas /
translated: This is the explanation of the perfection of wisdom as profound and difficult to believe, through the teaching that the nature of purity is not different.🔽Subhūti, furthermore, the self is pure because form is pure.

original: bdag yongs su dag pa ste /
analyzed: bdag yongs su dag pa ste /
translated: Form is pure because the self is pure.

original: de ltar na bdag yongs su dag pa dang / gzugs yongs su dag pa 'di la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med so so ma yin tha mi dad do zhes bya ba nas /🔽de ltar na mthong ba po yongs su dag pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su dag pa 'di la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med so so ma yin tha mi dad do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni mu stegs can gyis brtags pa'i bdag rnam pa bcu gnyis po re re dang /
analyzed: de ltar na bdag yongs su dag pa dang / gzugs yongs su dag pa 'di la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med so so ma yin tha mi dad do zhes bya ba nas / de ltar na mthong ba po yongs su dag pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su dag pa 'di la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med so so ma yin tha mi dad do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni mu stegs can gyis brtags pa'i bdag rnam pa bcu gnyis po re re dang /
translated: Thus, the purity of the self and the purity of form are non-dual, not divided into two, not broken apart, and not cut apart.🔽Thus, the purity of the seer and the purity of omniscience are non-dual, not divided into two, not broken apart, and not cut apart.

original: gzugs la @40b sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du chos thams cad dang sbyar te /
analyzed: gzugs la @40b sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du chos thams cad dang sbyar te /
translated: Thus, each of the twelve aspects of the self imputed by the tīrthikas is applied to all phenomena from form up to omniscience.

original: bdag rnams yongs su dag par rtogs pas gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad yongs su dag par rtogs pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad yongs su dag par rtogs pas bdag rnams yongs su dag par rtogs pa ngo bo nyid kyis stong zhing yongs su dag pa'i rang bzhin du tha mi dad par bshad pa'i sgo nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab
analyzed: bdag rnams yongs su dag par rtogs pas gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad yongs su dag par rtogs pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad yongs su dag par rtogs pas bdag rnams yongs su dag par rtogs pa ngo bo nyid kyis stong zhing yongs su dag pa'i rang bzhin du tha mi dad par bshad pa'i sgo nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab
translated: The explanation that they are not different in being empty of inherent nature and having the nature of complete purity is the profound perfection of wisdom,

original: cing mos par dka' bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: cing mos par dka' bar bstan pa'o //
translated: which is taught to be difficult to believe.🔽  Moreover, Subhūti, form is completely pure because of the complete purity of desire.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang 'dod chags rnam par dag pas gzugs rnam par dag pa gzugs rnam par dag pas 'dod chags rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang 'dod chags rnam par dag pas gzugs rnam par dag pa gzugs rnam par dag pas 'dod chags rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: Desire is completely pure because of the complete purity of form.

original: de ltar na 'dod chags rnam par dag pa dang gzugs rnam par dag pa 'di la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med so so ma yin tha mi dad do zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de ltar na 'dod chags rnam par dag pa dang gzugs rnam par dag pa 'di la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med so so ma yin tha mi dad do zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Thus, Subhūti, the complete purity of desire and the complete purity of form are not two and cannot be made two.

original: de ltar na gti mug rnam par dag pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par dag pa 'di la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med so so ma yin tha mi dad do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin 'dod chags dang /
analyzed: de ltar na gti mug rnam par dag pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par dag pa 'di la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med so so ma yin tha mi dad do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin 'dod chags dang /
translated: Thus, the purity of delusion and the purity of the knowledge of all aspects are not two and are not divided.🔽The three imagined natures of attachment,

original: zhe sdang dang / gti mug gsum don dam par dngos po med de /🔽rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pas rtogs na kun brtags pa'i gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du chos thams cad rnam par dag par rtogs pa dang / kun brtags pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad rnam par dag par rtogs na 'dod chags dang /
analyzed: zhe sdang dang / gti mug gsum don dam par dngos po med de / rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pas rtogs na kun brtags pa'i gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du chos thams cad rnam par dag par rtogs pa dang / kun brtags pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad rnam par dag par rtogs na 'dod chags dang /
translated: aversion, and delusion are ultimately not things.🔽If one realizes that they are pure by nature, one realizes that all phenomena, from imagined form up to the knowledge of all aspects, are pure.

original: zhe sdang dang / gti mug gsum rnam par dag par rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhe sdang dang / gti mug gsum rnam par dag par rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: If one realizes that all phenomena, from imagined form up to the knowledge of all aspects, are pure, one realizes that attachment, aversion, and delusion are pure.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gsum rnam par dag pa re re dang / gzugs la sogs pa chos thams cad rnam par dag pa dang sbyar te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gsum rnam par dag pa re re dang / gzugs la sogs pa chos thams cad rnam par dag pa dang sbyar te /
translated: The three of desire, hatred, and ignorance are each purified, and all phenomena such as form are purified.

original: de ltar rang bzhin gyis stong zhing rnam par dag pa la tha dad du dbyer med par bstan pa'i sgo nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di zab cing mos par dka' ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar rang bzhin gyis stong zhing rnam par dag pa la tha dad du dbyer med par bstan pa'i sgo nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di zab cing mos par dka' ba bstan pa'o //
translated: Thus, this perfection of wisdom is taught to be profound and difficult to believe in terms of the door of teaching that the natural emptiness and purity are not divided into different parts.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang 'dod chag yongs su dag pas gzugs yongs su dag pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang 'dod chag yongs su dag pas gzugs yongs su dag pa /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, form is purified by the complete purity of desire.

original: gzugs yongs su dag pas 'dod chags yongs su dag pa ste /🔽de ltar na 'dod chags @41a * //
analyzed: gzugs yongs su dag pas 'dod chags yongs su dag pa ste / de ltar na 'dod chags @41a * //
translated: Desire is purified by the complete purity of form.

original: yongs su dag pa dang / gzugs yongs su dag pa 'di la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med so so ma yin tha mi dad do zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: yongs su dag pa dang / gzugs yongs su dag pa 'di la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med so so ma yin tha mi dad do zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Thus, the complete purity of desire and the complete purity of form are not two and cannot be made two, are not distinct and are not broken apart.

original: de ltar na gti mug yongs su dag pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su dag pa 'di la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med so so ma yin tha mi dad do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni 'dod chags dang /🔽zhe sdang dang / gti mug gsum gyi chos nyid yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su dag par rtogs na gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos nyid yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su dag par rtogs pa dang /
analyzed: de ltar na gti mug yongs su dag pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su dag pa 'di la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med so so ma yin tha mi dad do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gsum gyi chos nyid yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su dag par rtogs na gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos nyid yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su dag par rtogs pa dang /
translated: Thus, the purity of delusion and the purity of the knowledge of all aspects are not two and are not divided.🔽Up to “there is no difference,” it is said that if one realizes the purity of the nature of the perfect, which is the reality of the three—attachment, aversion, and delusion—one realizes the purity of the nature of the perfect, which is the reality of all phenomena from form up to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad yongs su dag par rtogs na 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gsum yongs su dag par rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad yongs su dag par rtogs na 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gsum yongs su dag par rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: If one realizes the purity of all phenomena, such as form, one realizes the purity of the three—attachment, aversion, and delusion.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gsum yongs su dag pa re re dang / gzugs la sogs pa chos thams cad yongs su dag pa dang sbyar te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gsum yongs su dag pa re re dang / gzugs la sogs pa chos thams cad yongs su dag pa dang sbyar te /
translated: The three of desire, hatred, and delusion are each purified, and all phenomena such as form and so forth are purified.

original: de ltar rang bzhin gyis stong zhing yongs su dag pa la tha dad du dbyer med par bstan pa'i sgo nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di zab cing mos par dka' ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar rang bzhin gyis stong zhing yongs su dag pa la tha dad du dbyer med par bstan pa'i sgo nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di zab cing mos par dka' ba bstan pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is taught that this perfection of wisdom is profound and difficult to believe in terms of teaching that it is indivisible into different parts in the sense of being empty of nature and completely pure.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang ma rig pa rnam par dag pas 'du byed rnam par dag pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang ma rig pa rnam par dag pas 'du byed rnam par dag pa /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, formations are purified by the purification of ignorance.

original: 'du byed rnam par dag pas ma rig pa rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: 'du byed rnam par dag pas ma rig pa rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: Ignorance is purified by the purification of formations.

original: de ltar na ma rig pa rnam par dag pa dang / 'du byed rnam par dag pa 'di la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med so so ma yin tha mi dad do zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de ltar na ma rig pa rnam par dag pa dang / 'du byed rnam par dag pa 'di la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med so so ma yin tha mi dad do zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Thus, the purification of ignorance and the purification of formations are not two and cannot be made two, are not distinct and are not broken apart.

original: de ltar na lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid rnam par dag pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par dag pa 'di la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med so so ma yin tha mi dad do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni ma rig pa nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi
analyzed: de ltar na lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid rnam par dag pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par dag pa 'di la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med so so ma yin tha mi dad do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni ma rig pa nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi
translated: Up to here, the purity of the phenomena from ignorance up to the knowledge of all aspects🔽is taught.

original: chos rnams gcig rnam par dag par rtogs pas de'i 'og ma yang rnam par dag par rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos rnams gcig rnam par dag par rtogs pas de'i 'og ma yang rnam par dag par rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: By realizing the purity of one phenomenon, the purity of the subsequent ones will be realized.

original: de ltar chos de dag rnam par dag cing rang bzhin gyis stong pa la tha dad du dbyer med pa bstan pa'i sgo nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di zab @41b cing mos par dka' ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar chos de dag rnam par dag cing rang bzhin gyis stong pa la tha dad du dbyer med pa bstan pa'i sgo nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di zab @41b cing mos par dka' ba bstan pa'o //
translated: Thus, this perfection of wisdom is taught to be profound and difficult to believe by way of teaching that those phenomena are pure and undifferentiable as different divisions in the emptiness of their nature.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pas gzugs rnam par dag pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pas gzugs rnam par dag pa /
translated: Subhūti, furthermore, form is pure because the perfection of wisdom is pure.

original: gzugs rnam par dag pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs rnam par dag pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: The purity of the knowledge of all aspects is due to the purity of form.🔽Thus, the purity of the perfection of wisdom, the purity of form, and the purity of the knowledge of all aspects are not two and cannot be divided into two, are not broken apart, and are not cut apart.

original: de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa dang / gzugs rnam par dag pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par dag pa 'di la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med so so ma yin tha mi dad do zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa rnam par byang ba'i
analyzed: de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa dang / gzugs rnam par dag pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par dag pa 'di la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med so so ma yin tha mi dad do zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa rnam par byang ba'i
translated: This is the purity of each of all the phenomena of purification, such as the perfection of wisdom, and so on.

original: chos thams cad las chos re re rnam par dag pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga dang / phyi nang gi skye mched bcu gnyis dang / rnam par shes pa drug dang / 'dus te reg pa drug dang / 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba drug rnams rnam par dag pa dang /
analyzed: chos thams cad las chos re re rnam par dag pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga dang / phyi nang gi skye mched bcu gnyis dang / rnam par shes pa drug dang / 'dus te reg pa drug dang / 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba drug rnams rnam par dag pa dang /
translated: The purity of the five aggregates of form and so on, the twelve inner and outer sense bases, the six consciousnesses, the six contacts, and the six feelings that arise from contact.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par dag pa la tha dad du dbyer med par bstan pa'i sgo nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di zab cing mos par dka' ba bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par dag pa la tha dad du dbyer med par bstan pa'i sgo nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di zab cing mos par dka' ba bstan pa ste /
translated: This shows that the perfection of wisdom is profound and difficult to believe, in terms of the fact that the five aggregates, the twelve sense spheres, the six consciousnesses, the six contacts, the six feelings conditioned by contact, and the knowledge of all aspects are not different in terms of the purity of the three aspects.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'ba' zhig la phung po lnga dang / skye mched bcu gnyis dang / rnam par shes pa drug dang / 'dus te reg pa drug dang / 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba drug rnams dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang yang sbyar te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'ba' zhig la phung po lnga dang / skye mched bcu gnyis dang / rnam par shes pa drug dang / 'dus te reg pa drug dang / 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba drug rnams dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang yang sbyar te /
translated: The five aggregates, the twelve sense spheres, the six consciousnesses, the six contacts, the six feelings conditioned by contact, and the knowledge of all aspects are connected to the perfection of wisdom alone.

original: chos gsum rnam par dag pa la tha dad du dbyer med pa bshad pa de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: chos gsum rnam par dag pa la tha dad du dbyer med pa bshad pa de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Just as it is explained that the purity of the three aspects is not different, in the same way, it should be applied up to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi 'gres tha ma la ltag 'og gnyis ka las rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid smos pa gong ma ni kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi 'gres tha ma la ltag 'og gnyis ka las rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid smos pa gong ma ni kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de /
translated: In the last permutation of the knowledge of all aspects, the knowledge of all aspects is mentioned both above and below. The one above is the knowledge of all aspects of the imagined nature.

original: kun rdzob tu chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid rnam pa thams cad du mkhyen pa nyid la bya'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid rnam pa thams cad du mkhyen pa nyid la bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as the knowledge of all aspects of the characteristics of all phenomena in a conventional sense.

original: 'og ma ni yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la bya ste /
analyzed: 'og ma ni yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la bya ste /
translated: The one below is the knowledge of all aspects of the perfected nature.

original: don dam par chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du ro gcig cing tha mi dad par thugs su chud pa la bya bar rig par bya'o //🔽rab 'byor gzhan yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen @42a * //🔽pa nyid rnam par dag pas gzugs rnam par dag pa /
analyzed: don dam par chos thams cad stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du ro gcig cing tha mi dad par thugs su chud pa la bya bar rig par bya'o // rab 'byor gzhan yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen @42a * // pa nyid rnam par dag pas gzugs rnam par dag pa /
translated: It should be understood as the realization that ultimately all phenomena are of one taste, of the same nature, as emptiness.🔽Furthermore, Subhūti, the purification of form is due to the purification of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: gzugs rnam par dag pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs rnam par dag pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: The purification of the perfection of wisdom is due to the purification of form.

original: de ltar na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par dag pa dang / gzugs rnam par dag pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa 'di la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med so so ma yin tha mi dad do zhes bya ba nas de ltar na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par dag pa dang /
analyzed: de ltar na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par dag pa dang / gzugs rnam par dag pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa 'di la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med so so ma yin tha mi dad do zhes bya ba nas de ltar na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par dag pa dang /
translated: Thus, the purity of the knowledge of all aspects and the purity of form and the purity of the perfection of wisdom are not two and are not divided, are not broken apart, and are not cut apart.

original: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba rnam par dag pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa 'di la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med so so ma yin tha mi dad do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par dag pa thog mar smos nas /
analyzed: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba rnam par dag pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa 'di la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med so so ma yin tha mi dad do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par dag pa thog mar smos nas /
translated: Thus, the purity of the knowledge of all aspects and the purity of the sensory element of the eyes and the purity of the perfection of generosity are not two and are not divided, are not broken apart, and are not cut apart.

original: gzugs la sogs pa phung po lnga dang / skye mched bcu gnyis dang / rnam par shes pa drug dang / 'dus te reg pa drug dang / 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba drug la thug gi bar du chos rnams pha rol tu phyin pa drug re re dang sbyar te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa phung po lnga dang / skye mched bcu gnyis dang / rnam par shes pa drug dang / 'dus te reg pa drug dang / 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba drug la thug gi bar du chos rnams pha rol tu phyin pa drug re re dang sbyar te /
translated: The six perfections are applied to the five aggregates beginning with form, the twelve sense fields, the six consciousnesses, the six contacts, and the six feelings.

original: chos de dag rnam par dag pa la tha dad du dbyer med pa'i sgo nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di zab cing mos par dka' ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: chos de dag rnam par dag pa la tha dad du dbyer med pa'i sgo nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di zab cing mos par dka' ba bstan pa'o //
translated: This shows that this perfection of wisdom is profound and difficult to believe in, in terms of the purity of those phenomena, which cannot be divided into different parts.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang 'dus byas rnam par dag pas 'dus ma byas rnam par dag pa ste zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang 'dus byas rnam par dag pas 'dus ma byas rnam par dag pa ste zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, the conditioned is pure because of the purity of the unconditioned, and the unconditioned is pure because of the purity of the conditioned.

original: de ltar na de ltar byung ba rnam par dag pa dang / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa rnam par dag pa 'di la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med so so ma yin tha mi dad do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni 'dus byas dang /
analyzed: de ltar na de ltar byung ba rnam par dag pa dang / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa rnam par dag pa 'di la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med so so ma yin tha mi dad do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni 'dus byas dang /
translated: Thus, the purity of what has arisen in this way and the purity of the past and future are not two and cannot be divided into two. They are not broken apart, not cut apart, and not different.

original: 'dus ma byas rnam par dag pa la tha dad du dbyer med pa dang / dus gsum rnam par dag pa la tha dad du dbyer med pa bstan pa'i sgo nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di zab cing mos par dka' ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas rnam par dag pa la tha dad du dbyer med pa dang / dus gsum rnam par dag pa la tha dad du dbyer med pa bstan pa'i sgo nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di zab cing mos par dka' ba bstan pa'o //
translated: This shows that the perfection of wisdom is profound and difficult to believe, by way of teaching that the unconditioned is indivisible in its purity, and that the three times are indivisible in their purity.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum pa rgya cher bshed pa las le'u nyi shu bdun pa'o /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum pa rgya cher bshed pa las le'u nyi shu bdun pa'o /
translated: This concludes the twenty-seventh chapter of the extensive commentary on the perfection of wisdom in one hundred thousand lines, called The Ornament of Clear Realization.

original: // / de nas tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bus bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gong du chos thams cad rnam par dag pa la tha dad du dbyer med pa bstan pa'i sgo nas shes rab kyi
analyzed: // / de nas tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bus bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gong du chos thams cad rnam par dag pa la tha dad du dbyer med pa bstan pa'i sgo nas shes rab kyi
translated: Then the venerable Śāradvatīputra said to the Blessed One... and so on. This shows that the perfection of wisdom is profound and difficult to believe, by way of teaching that all phenomena are indivisible in their purity, as explained above.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa @42b 'di zab cing mos par dka' ba bshad pa'i don sh'a ri'i bus rtogs nas rnam par dag cing zab pa'i don de nyid 'khor rnams la gsal zhing zhib tu bshad pa'i gleng bslang ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis chos thams cad shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir zab pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa @42b 'di zab cing mos par dka' ba bshad pa'i don sh'a ri'i bus rtogs nas rnam par dag cing zab pa'i don de nyid 'khor rnams la gsal zhing zhib tu bshad pa'i gleng bslang ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis chos thams cad shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir zab pa bstan pa ste /
translated: The meaning of the explanation of this profound perfection, which is difficult to believe, was understood by Śāriputra. He then raised the discussion by clearly and precisely explaining that very pure and profound meaning to the assembly.🔽The Lord taught the profundity of all phenomena because of their utter purity.

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam par dag pa 'di zab po zhes bya ba ni gong du rnam par dag pa bshad pa de dmigs pa can rnams kyis rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir zab po zhes gsol pa'o //🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam par dag pa 'di zab po zhes bya ba ni gong du rnam par dag pa bshad pa de dmigs pa can rnams kyis rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir zab po zhes gsol pa'o // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said, “This purity, Śāriputra, is profound.” The explanation of purity above is profound because it is difficult for those who objectify to understand.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni shes bya dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa thams cad bag chags kyang ma lus par spangs shing cis kyang ma gos te /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni shes bya dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa thams cad bag chags kyang ma lus par spangs shing cis kyang ma gos te /
translated: The Lord said, “Because of utter purity.” All the obscurations of the knowable and the afflictions, together with their traces, are abandoned without exception. Nothing at all stains them.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa de rtog pa can rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir zab bo zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa de rtog pa can rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir zab bo zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It is profound because that complete purity is not the domain of conceptual thought.

original: sha ra dva ti'i bus gsol pa /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bus gsol pa /
translated: Śāradvatīputra said:

original: gang rnam par dag pa'i slad du zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad rnam par dag pa bshad pa'i gleng bslang ba'i phyir zhus pa'o //
analyzed: gang rnam par dag pa'i slad du zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad rnam par dag pa bshad pa'i gleng bslang ba'i phyir zhus pa'o //
translated: “Because of complete purity” is the request for the introduction to the explanation of the complete purity of all phenomena, such as form.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu gzugs rnam par dag pa zab po zhes bya ba nas /🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par dag pa'i phyir rnam par dag pa zab po zhes bya ba'i bar du ni gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos de dag thams cad don dam par rang bzhin gyis
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu gzugs rnam par dag pa zab po zhes bya ba nas / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par dag pa'i phyir rnam par dag pa zab po zhes bya ba'i bar du ni gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos de dag thams cad don dam par rang bzhin gyis
translated: “Śāradvatīputra, the complete purity of form is profound, and so on up to🔽the complete purity of the knowledge of all aspects is profound.”

original: stong zhing rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: stong zhing rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: All those phenomena, from form up to the knowledge of all aspects, are ultimately empty of intrinsic nature and completely pure.

original: ces kyang ma gos pa de mtshan mar 'dzin cing rtog pa can rnams kyis rtogs shing yid ches par dka' ba'i phyir zab po zhes bstan pa'o //🔽gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das rnam par dag pa ni snang ba'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: ces kyang ma gos pa de mtshan mar 'dzin cing rtog pa can rnams kyis rtogs shing yid ches par dka' ba'i phyir zab po zhes bstan pa'o // gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das rnam par dag pa ni snang ba'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Also, profound is taught because it is difficult for those who hold to signs and have concepts to understand and have confidence in that which is not sullied by those.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par dag pa'i phyir rnam par dag pa snang ba'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos rnams yongs su dag cing
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par dag pa'i phyir rnam par dag pa snang ba'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos rnams yongs su dag cing
translated: The request, Bhagavan, purity is illumination... up to ...purity is illumination because of the purity of omniscience explains that phenomena from the six perfections up to omniscience are completely pure

original: cis kyang ma bsgribs te /
analyzed: cis kyang ma bsgribs te /
translated: and are not obscured by anything

analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i phyir rnam par dag pa ni snang ba'o zhes bshad pa'o //

translated: The request, Bhagavan, purity is the absence of a life-force...

analyzed: nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la 'pho ba med cing nying gi mtshams sbyor ba med pa ni rnam par dag pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos rnams rang bzhin gyis stong zhing rnam par dag pas phung po 'di bor te / pha rol tu 'pho ba yang med la / phung po phyi ma len pa'i nying mtshams sbyor ba yang med pa bstan pa'o //

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos rnams don dam par yongs su dag cing rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos rnams don dam par yongs su dag cing rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba ste /
translated: The phenomena from form up to omniscience are ultimately pure and naturally radiant.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyis ma gos pa'i phyir rnam par dag pa la kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyis ma gos pa'i phyir rnam par dag pa la kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa bstan pa'o //
translated: Since they are not sullied by defilements such as attachment, this teaches the absence of defilement in purity.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das rnam par dag pa ni thob par bgyi ba dang / mngon par rtogs par bgyi ba ma mchis pa'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das rnam par dag pa ni thob par bgyi ba dang / mngon par rtogs par bgyi ba ma mchis pa'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: He said, “Blessed One, purity is not something to be attained or realized.”🔽Up to, “The attainment and realization of omniscience is purity.”

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya ba med pa dang / mngon par rtogs par bya ba med pa ni rnam par dag pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos rnams don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong zhing rnam par dag pa yin pas
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya ba med pa dang / mngon par rtogs par bya ba med pa ni rnam par dag pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos rnams don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong zhing rnam par dag pa yin pas
translated: The phenomena from form up to omniscience are ultimately empty of intrinsic nature and pure.

original: de las 'bras bu thob par bya ba dang / rtogs par bya ba gang yang med pa nyid rnam par dag pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de las 'bras bu thob par bya ba dang / rtogs par bya ba gang yang med pa nyid rnam par dag pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: There is nothing to be attained or realized, and that is purity.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das rnam par dag pa ni mngon par ma grub pa'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das rnam par dag pa ni mngon par ma grub pa'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: He says, “Blessed One, purity is not something to be accomplished. ”🔽Up to, “The non-accomplishment of omniscience is purity. ”

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mngon par ma grub pa ni rnam par dag pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos rnams don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong zhing dngos po
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mngon par ma grub pa ni rnam par dag pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos rnams don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong zhing dngos po
translated: The phenomena of form and so on up to omniscience are ultimately empty of inherent nature and are

original: med pas mngon par bsgrub par bya ba dang / mngon par sgrub par byed pa gnyis ka dngos po yod par ma grub pa nyid rnam par dag pa yin no @43b zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: med pas mngon par bsgrub par bya ba dang / mngon par sgrub par byed pa gnyis ka dngos po yod par ma grub pa nyid rnam par dag pa yin no @43b zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: non-entities. Therefore, both the object to be accomplished and the agent of accomplishment are not established as existent entities. That itself is purity.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das rnam par dag pa ni 'dod pa'i khams su skye ba ma lags so zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das rnam par dag pa ni 'dod pa'i khams su skye ba ma lags so zhes bya ba nas /
translated: He says, “Blessed One, purity is not born in the desire realm. ”

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu gzugs med pa'i khams rang bzhin gyis mi dmigs pa'i phyir rnam par dag pa ni skye ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du ni chos thams cad ngo bo nyid kyis stong zhing rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin de bzhin nyid de
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu gzugs med pa'i khams rang bzhin gyis mi dmigs pa'i phyir rnam par dag pa ni skye ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du ni chos thams cad ngo bo nyid kyis stong zhing rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin de bzhin nyid de
translated: This passage teaches that all phenomena are empty of their very essence and that the nature of their purity is suchness,

original: ni khams gsum gang du'ang skye ba med pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: ni khams gsum gang du'ang skye ba med pa bstan pa ste /
translated: which is not produced in any of the three realms.

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams zhes bya ba yang kun brtags pa tsam du zad de don dam par khams gsum nyid kyang rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams zhes bya ba yang kun brtags pa tsam du zad de don dam par khams gsum nyid kyang rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
translated: The so-called desire realm, the form realm, and the formless realm are nothing more than imputations. Ultimately, the three realms themselves are empty of intrinsic nature.

original: dmigs su med pa der skye bar 'gyur ba lta ga la yod de /
analyzed: dmigs su med pa der skye bar 'gyur ba lta ga la yod de /
translated: How could something that is non-apprehensible be produced?

original: de ltar gang du skye ba'i gnas dang / skye bar 'gyur ba gnyis ka mi dmigs pa nyid rnam par dag pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar gang du skye ba'i gnas dang / skye bar 'gyur ba gnyis ka mi dmigs pa nyid rnam par dag pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Thus, the non-apprehension of both the place of production and that which is produced is taught to be purity.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das rnam par dag pa ni 'tshal ba ma mchis pa'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das rnam par dag pa ni 'tshal ba ma mchis pa'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: He said, Blessed One, purity is not knowing.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽sha ra dva ti'i bu rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir rnam par dag pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mi shes so zhes bya ba'i bar du ni rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong zhing dngos po
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / sha ra dva ti'i bu rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir rnam par dag pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mi shes so zhes bya ba'i bar du ni rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong zhing dngos po
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽Up to Sharadviati, because of emptiness of intrinsic identity, purity does not know the knowledge of all aspects.

original: med pa yin pas shes par byed pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos rnams shes par byed pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: med pa yin pas shes par byed pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos rnams shes par byed pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches that since what is called purity is empty of its own identity and is not a thing, it is not the nature of a knower, so it does not cause knowledge of phenomena from form up to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: chos la sems med pa'i phyir rnam par dag pa la shes pa med do zhes bya ba ni rnam par dag pa'i chos nyid la rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir chos rnams la mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i shes pa med do zhes bya ba'i don te //
analyzed: chos la sems med pa'i phyir rnam par dag pa la shes pa med do zhes bya ba ni rnam par dag pa'i chos nyid la rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir chos rnams la mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i shes pa med do zhes bya ba'i don te //
translated: Because phenomena are without mind, there is no cognition in purification. This means that because the reality of purification is without conceptualization, there is no cognition apprehending the signs of phenomena.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sman par mi bgyid gnod par mi bgyid do zhes bya ba ni don dam par rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sman par mi bgyid gnod par mi bgyid do zhes bya ba ni don dam par rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: The request, “Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom does not benefit or harm the knowledge of all aspects” indicates that ultimately the perfection of wisdom, which is non-conceptual cognition,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de bzhin nyid du ro gcig cing shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir gcig gi rgyu gcig ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //🔽bcom ldan 'das @44a * //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de bzhin nyid du ro gcig cing shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir gcig gi rgyu gcig ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o // bcom ldan 'das @44a * //
translated: and the knowledge of all aspects are of one taste in suchness and are completely pure, so one is not the cause of the other.

original: kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa gnyis ka yang chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin du ro gcig cing /
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa gnyis ka yang chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin du ro gcig cing /
translated: The Blessed One said, Because of complete purity, which means that both the perfection of wisdom and the knowledge of all aspects have the same taste in the nature of the completely pure dharmadhatu.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir gcig gi rgyu gcig ma yin no zhes gong du bshad pa'i don de nyid bsnan te bstan pa'o //🔽gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sman par mi bgyid cing gnod par mi bgyid pa lags zhes bya ba ni gong du sh'a ri'i bus bshad pa'i don de nyid bcom ldan 'das kyis
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir gcig gi rgyu gcig ma yin no zhes gong du bshad pa'i don de nyid bsnan te bstan pa'o // gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sman par mi bgyid cing gnod par mi bgyid pa lags zhes bya ba ni gong du sh'a ri'i bus bshad pa'i don de nyid bcom ldan 'das kyis
translated: This is an addition to the meaning explained above, that they are not the cause of each other because of complete purity.🔽Śāriputra said, Blessed One, how is the perfection of wisdom neither beneficial nor harmful to the knowledge of all aspects?

original: bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: bka' stsal nas /
translated: This is Śāriputra's question, which follows the meaning explained above by the Blessed One,

original: 'khor rnams brtan par yid ches par 'gyur ba'i phyir sh'a ri'i bus zhus pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor rnams brtan par yid ches par 'gyur ba'i phyir sh'a ri'i bus zhus pa'o //
translated: in order to make the retinue firmly believe.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu chos kyi dbyings gnas pa nyid kyi phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la phan par mi byed gnod par mi byed do zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu chos kyi dbyings gnas pa nyid kyi phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la phan par mi byed gnod par mi byed do zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang
translated: “Śāradvatī­putra, the perfection of wisdom does not benefit or harm the knowledge of all aspects, because the expanse of reality remains just as it is.”

original: / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa gnyis ka yang don dam par chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin du ro gcig ste /
analyzed: / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa gnyis ka yang don dam par chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin du ro gcig ste /
translated: This shows that both the perfection of wisdom and the knowledge of all aspects are ultimately of one taste in the nature of the expanse of reality.

original: tha mi dad la chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin yang mi 'gyur ba yongs su rdzogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas phan pa dang gnod pa'i khar ma las pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: tha mi dad la chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin yang mi 'gyur ba yongs su rdzogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas phan pa dang gnod pa'i khar ma las pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: The expanse of reality is also the nature of the unchanging, completely perfect essence, and so it is beyond benefit and harm.

original: des kyang rnam par dag pa la phan pa dang / gnod pa byed pa med pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i sgo nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di zab cing mos par dka' ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: des kyang rnam par dag pa la phan pa dang / gnod pa byed pa med pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i sgo nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di zab cing mos par dka' ba bstan pa'o //
translated: This also shows that this perfection of wisdom is profound and difficult to master, in terms of the characteristic of the absence of benefit and harm in the context of purity.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa ni chos gang yang yongs su len pa ma mchis so zhes bya ba ni don dam pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dngos po med cing shin
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa ni chos gang yang yongs su len pa ma mchis so zhes bya ba ni don dam pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dngos po med cing shin
translated: He said, Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom, which is pure, does not take up any phenomenon at all. This is the ultimate, nonconceptual perfection of wisdom, which is not an entity and is very subtle.

original: tu rnam par dag pa yin pas chos gang la yang rnam par rtog cing mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: tu rnam par dag pa yin pas chos gang la yang rnam par rtog cing mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: He said, Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom is not the appropriation of any dharma at all. This teaches that the perfection of wisdom of ultimate non-conceptuality is non-existent and extremely pure, so it is not the nature of conceptualizing and grasping signs of any dharma.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de gzung ba dang / @44b 'dzin pa gnyis ka'i skyon gyis ma gos shing shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir chos gang yang yongs su len pa med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de gzung ba dang / @44b 'dzin pa gnyis ka'i skyon gyis ma gos shing shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir chos gang yang yongs su len pa med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Sharadvatiputra, it is because of complete purity. This teaches that the perfection of wisdom of non-conceptuality is not the appropriation of any dharma at all because it is unstained by the faults of both the apprehended and the apprehender, and is extremely pure.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa /
translated: He said, Blessed One, how is it that the perfection of wisdom, being pure, does not take up any dharma at all?

original: chos gang yang yongs su len pa ma mchis pa lags zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa'i don de nyid bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal na /
analyzed: chos gang yang yongs su len pa ma mchis pa lags zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa'i don de nyid bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal na /
translated: This is the very meaning that was explained above. When the Blessed One said it,

original: 'khor rnams brten par yid ches par bya ba'i phyir sh'a ri'i bus zhus pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor rnams brten par yid ches par bya ba'i phyir sh'a ri'i bus zhus pa'o //
translated: in order to make the retinue trustingly steady, it was asked by Śāriputra.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽Śāradvatīputra, the perfection of wisdom, being pure, does not take up any dharma at all because the realm of phenomena is immovable.

original: sha ra dva ti'i bu chos kyi dbyings mi g-yo ba'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa chos gang yang yongs su len pa med do zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam
analyzed: sha ra dva ti'i bu chos kyi dbyings mi g-yo ba'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa chos gang yang yongs su len pa med do zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam
translated: This is the perfection of nonconceptual wisdom.

original: par dag pa de chos kyi dbyings mi 'gyur ba yongs su rdzogs pa'i rang bzhin yin pas gzugs la sogs pa'i chos gang la yang rnam par rtog cing mtshan mar mi 'dzin pa'i sgo nas g-yo ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: par dag pa de chos kyi dbyings mi 'gyur ba yongs su rdzogs pa'i rang bzhin yin pas gzugs la sogs pa'i chos gang la yang rnam par rtog cing mtshan mar mi 'dzin pa'i sgo nas g-yo ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: Since that pure form is the nature of the unchanging, perfect dharmadhātu, it is taught that it is unmoving because it does not conceive of or grasp any phenomena such as form as having characteristics.

original: 'dis kyang yongs su len pa med pa'i sgo nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di zab cing mos par dka' ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis kyang yongs su len pa med pa'i sgo nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di zab cing mos par dka' ba bstan pa'o //
translated: This also teaches that this perfection of wisdom is profound and difficult to believe in terms of being without appropriation.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Su­bhūti said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das bdag rnam par dag pa'i slad du gzugs rnam par dag pa'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bdag rnam par dag pa'i slad du gzugs rnam par dag pa'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: “Blessed One, form is pure because of the purity of the self.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du bdag rnam par dag pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par dag pa lags /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du bdag rnam par dag pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam par dag pa lags /
translated: He said, “Blessed One, why is the knowledge of all aspects pure because of the purity of the self?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

analyzed: rab 'byor rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni gang zag la bdag med pa dang / chos la bdag med pa nyid rnam par dag pa yin pa bstan pa'i sgo nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di zab cing mos par dka' ba bstan pa ste /

original: ji ltar mu stegs can gyis brtags pa'i bdag rnams kun rdzob tu yang yod par ma grub pa de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du chos thams cad kyang don dam par yod pa ma yin te /

analyzed: skabs 'dir gzugs la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad la thug gi bar du ni tshig gi mjug las shin tu rnam par dag pa'i gtan tshigs su bdag med pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad med pa ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'o zhes smos la / rgyun tu zhugs pa'i 'bras bu man chad rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i gtan tshigs su rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes smos pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la
translated: In this context, from form up to the eighteen distinct qualities of a buddha, the conclusion of the words states, “because of the absence of self, the eighteen distinct qualities of a buddha do not exist, which is extremely pure.”🔽From the result of stream enterer up to the knowledge of all aspects, the extremely pure reason is stated as “because of the emptiness of its own mark.”🔽This is stated in order to dispel the assertions of some śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas

original: sogs pa kha cig rang gi mtshan nyid la mngon par zhes pa rnams bsal ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: sogs pa kha cig rang gi mtshan nyid la mngon par zhes pa rnams bsal ba'i phyir te /
translated: that “the emptiness of its own mark” refers to the emptiness of the object’s own characteristics.

original: gang zag dang chos gnyis ka'i rang gi mtshan nyid yod par ma grub ste /
analyzed: gang zag dang chos gnyis ka'i rang gi mtshan nyid yod par ma grub ste /
translated: The individual characteristics of both persons and phenomena are not established as existent.

original: stong pa nyid kyi phyir rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa bdag rnam par dag pas chos rnams kyang rnam par dag pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi phyir rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa bdag rnam par dag pas chos rnams kyang rnam par dag pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Because of emptiness, the fruits of stream enterer and so on are pure because the self is pure.

analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das gnyis su ma mchis shing rnam par dag pa ni thob par bgyi ba ma lags /
translated: He said, “Bhagavan, non-duality and purity are not to be attained,

original: mngon par rtogs par bgyi ba ma lags so zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs par bgyi ba ma lags so zhes bya ba nas /
translated: are not to be realized, and so on up to

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said,🔽“Because there is no affliction and no purification.”

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa med cing rnam par byang ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni chos thams cad don dam par rang bzhin gyis dag cing de bzhin du ro gcig pas sngon yang kun nas nyon mongs pa med la /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa med cing rnam par byang ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni chos thams cad don dam par rang bzhin gyis dag cing de bzhin du ro gcig pas sngon yang kun nas nyon mongs pa med la /
translated: Because all phenomena are ultimately pure by nature and are of one taste, they are not afflicted before

original: phyis kyang rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba med de /
analyzed: phyis kyang rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba med de /
translated: and are not purified later.

original: de ltar nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba gnyis su med pa la rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu thob par bya ba yang med la /

translated: Thus, in the nonduality of afflictions and thorough purities, there is no attainment of the fruits of stream-enterer and so on.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po la sogs pa mngon par rtogs par bya ba med par bstan pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po la sogs pa mngon par rtogs par bya ba med par bstan pa'i sgo nas /
translated: And in the nonduality of afflictions and thorough purities, there is no realization of the first bodhisattva stage and so on.

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di zab cing mos par dka' ba bstan pa'o //
translated: Through teaching this, the profundity and difficulty of conviction in this perfection of wisdom is shown.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das bdag kun tu mtha' yas pa'i slad du gzugs kun tu mtha' yas pa'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das bdag kun tu mtha' yas pa'i slad du gzugs kun tu mtha' yas pa'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Subhūti said, “Blessed One, form is infinite because the self is infinite.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du bdag kun tu mtha' yas pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kun tu mtha' yas pa rnam par dag pa lags /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du bdag kun tu mtha' yas pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kun tu mtha' yas pa rnam par dag pa lags /
translated: Subhūti said, “Blessed One, why is the knowledge of all aspects infinite because the self is infinite?”

original: bcom ldan @45b 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan @45b 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Subhūti, the self is not apprehended as the self.

original: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni bu stegs can gyis brtags pa'i bdag rnams dngos po yod par ma grub pas rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtha' las 'das pa dang thog ma dang tha ma med pa
analyzed: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni bu stegs can gyis brtags pa'i bdag rnams dngos po yod par ma grub pas rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtha' las 'das pa dang thog ma dang tha ma med pa
translated: Up to “because of the emptiness of the unlimited” and “because of the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end,” the selves imagined by the tīrthikas are not established as existent things, and therefore they are beyond the extremes of eternalism and nihilism, and they are without beginning or end.

original: mtha' las 'das pa de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos thams cad kyang don dam par mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid kyi phyir kun tu mtha' yas pa rnam par dag pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mtha' las 'das pa de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos thams cad kyang don dam par mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid kyi phyir kun tu mtha' yas pa rnam par dag pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Just as they are beyond the extremes, in the same way, all phenomena, from form up to omniscience, are ultimately beyond the extremes, because of the emptiness of the unlimited and the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end. Thus, they are completely limitless and pure.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das gang de ltar rtogs pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa de lta bu'i rnam par dag pa zab cing mos par dka' ba de lta bu'i don rtogs
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das gang de ltar rtogs pa ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa de lta bu'i rnam par dag pa zab cing mos par dka' ba de lta bu'i don rtogs
translated: He said, Blessed One, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who realizes it in that way is the perfection of wisdom. This is the realization of the meaning of such profound and difficult-to-conceive purity as explained above.🔽

original: shing yid ches pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab yongs su dag pa yin no zhes rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la mdor gsol pa'o //
analyzed: shing yid ches pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab yongs su dag pa yin no zhes rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la mdor gsol pa'o //
translated: He said, Blessed One, the bodhisattva-mahāsattva who realizes this is the perfection of wisdom. This is Subhūti's concise statement to the Blessed One that the bodhisattva's pure wisdom is the realization and confidence in the meaning of such profound and difficult-to-conceive purity as explained above.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de ltar rnam par dag pa'i chos zab mo rtogs pa'i shes bya dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa bag chags yan chad ma lus par spangs shing /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de ltar rnam par dag pa'i chos zab mo rtogs pa'i shes bya dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa bag chags yan chad ma lus par spangs shing /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽Subhūti, it is because of complete purity. This is the concise teaching that the bodhisattva's perfection of wisdom is the realization of such profound pure phenomena and the complete abandonment of the obscurations of knowables and afflictions, including their traces,

original: rnam par dag pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no zhes mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no zhes mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: because of complete purity.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du gang de ltar rtogs pa de byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lags zhes bya ba ni gong du mdor bshad pa'i don de nyid 'khor rnams kyi zhib tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du gang de ltar rtogs pa de byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lags zhes bya ba ni gong du mdor bshad pa'i don de nyid 'khor rnams kyi zhib tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir
translated: He said, Why is it that the realization of that by the bodhisattva-mahāsattva is the perfection of wisdom?

original: rab 'byor gyis zhus pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis zhus pa'o //
translated: This is Subhūti's question in order to have the meaning of what was explained above in brief understood in detail by the retinue.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis lam gyi rnam pa shes pa'i shes rab kyis de lta bu'i chos zab mo rtogs bar 'gyur ba'i phyir gang de ltar rtogs pa de byang chub sems dpa'i shes🔽rab kyi pha rol tu phyin @46a * //
