translated: The Blessed One said:🔽It is because of the knowledge of the aspects of the path.

original: pa yin no zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: pa yin no zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches that because the bodhisattvas realize such profound dharmas through the wisdom that is the knowledge of the aspects of the path, the realization of that is the bodhisattva's perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: 'dis kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di de ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod yul yin gyis /
translated: This also shows how the perfection of wisdom is the domain of the bodhisattvas.🔽

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin par bstan pa'i sgo nas zab cing mos par dka' ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin par bstan pa'i sgo nas zab cing mos par dka' ba bstan pa'o //
translated: This also teaches the profundity and difficulty of belief in the perfection of wisdom by way of showing that this perfection of wisdom is the domain of the bodhisattvas, but is not the domain of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.🔽The Lord: So it is, Subhuti, so it is.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /🔽tshu rol gyi 'gram mam /

original: par dka' ba bstan pa ste /
analyzed: par dka' ba bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches the profundity and difficulty of belief in the perfection of wisdom by way of showing that the perfection of wisdom does not stand in the near shore, the far shore, or in between the two.

analyzed: tshu rol gyi 'gram zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas kyi mtha'o //

analyzed: pha rol gyi 'gram zhes bya ba ni 'dus ma byas kyi mtha' la bya ste /
translated: The far shore is the limit of the unconditioned.

original: don dam par 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas pa'i chos thams cad dngos po med pas de gnyis gang gi mtha' la yang mi gnas shing de ltar mtha' gnyis med pas de gnyis kyi dbus kyang med pa'i phyir /

translated: In ultimate truth, all conditioned and unconditioned phenomena are unreal, so they do not stand at either limit. And since there are no two limits, there is no middle between them.

analyzed: dbus na yang mi gnas pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: So they do not stand in the middle either. This is the perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattvas.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

translated: Subhūti, it is because of complete purity. This means that because there is no conceptualization that stands at the two limits, there is purity.

analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ci'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: He asked, “Bhagavān, why is it that when bodhisattva mahāsattvas practice the perfection of wisdom

analyzed: tshu rol gyi 'gram mam /

translated: This is the meaning of what was mentioned above in brief. Since the Bhagavān has spoken,

analyzed: 'khor rnams brtan par yid ches par 'gyur ba'i phyir zhus pa'o // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: rab 'byor dus gsum mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad rang bzhin @46b gyis stong zhing skye ba dang / 'gag pa med pa la 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus kyang med de /
translated: All phenomena are empty by nature, without arising or ceasing, and there is no past, future, or present time.

analyzed: de ltar dus gsum mnyam pa nyid dang 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas gnyis ka yang stong pa nyid du ro gcig ste mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di tshu rol dang pha rol dang gnyis ka'i dbus
translated: Thus, the three times are the same, and both the compounded and the uncompounded are of one taste in emptiness, because they are the same. Therefore, this perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva does not stand in the middle between this shore and the other shore, or in both.

original: na yang mi gnas so zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: na yang mi gnas so zhes bstan pa'o //

translated: Subhūti asks, “If one conceives and understands the perfection of wisdom as extremely pure and as an object of observation in the manner of an object of observation that is without an objective support and without signs, then one repudiates the perfection of wisdom and makes it insubstantial.

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don dang mi mthun pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ring du spong ba yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Since it is not in accord with the meaning of the perfection of wisdom, one is far removed from the perfection of wisdom.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said,

original: rab 'byor de de bzhin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor de de bzhin te /
translated: “Subhūti, it is just so.

original: rab 'byor legs so legs so //
analyzed: rab 'byor legs so legs so //
translated: Subhūti, excellent, excellent!

original: rab 'byor de ni ming du yang chags pa yin mtshan mar yang chags pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gong du rab 'byor gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la dmigs pa'i tshul du 'du shes na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gsog
analyzed: rab 'byor de ni ming du yang chags pa yin mtshan mar yang chags pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gong du rab 'byor gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la dmigs pa'i tshul du 'du shes na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gsog
translated: “Subhūti, that is attachment to names and attachment to signs.”

original: tu 'byin cing ring du spong ba yin par bshad pa de de bzhin te legs so zhes bstod nas /
analyzed: tu 'byin cing ring du spong ba yin par bshad pa de de bzhin te legs so zhes bstod nas /
translated: This is the praise of Subhūti’s statement above, “If one perceives the perfection of wisdom as an object, one accumulates the perfection of wisdom and abandons it for a long time.”

original: de ltar dmigs pa'i tshul du 'du shes su byed na chos thams cad la ming dang mtshan mar 'dzin cing chags pa'i skyon du yang 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar dmigs pa'i tshul du 'du shes su byed na chos thams cad la ming dang mtshan mar 'dzin cing chags pa'i skyon du yang 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: “If one perceives in that way as an object, one also has the fault of apprehending and being attached to the names and signs of all phenomena.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na ming du yang chags shing mtshan mar yang chags pa lags zhes bya ba ni ming dang @47a * //
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na ming du yang chags shing mtshan mar yang chags pa lags zhes bya ba ni ming dang @47a * //
translated: He asked, “Blessed One, how is it that one is attached to names and attached to signs?”

original: mtshan mar 'dzin cing chags pa'i don gong du mdor bshad pa de zhib tu bshad pa'i phyir zhus pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan mar 'dzin cing chags pa'i don gong du mdor bshad pa de zhib tu bshad pa'i phyir zhus pa'o //
translated: This is the question in order to explain in detail the meaning of apprehending and being attached to names and signs that was explained above in brief.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor 'di la rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ming du 'dzin tam mtshan mar 'dzin na zhes bya ba nas /

translated: “Subhūti, here a son of a good family or a daughter of a good family in the Bodhisattva Vehicle who apprehends the perfection of wisdom as a name, as a sign, up to

original: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas rlom sems su byed cing /
analyzed: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas rlom sems su byed cing /
translated: he conceits himself with the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la chags pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gsog tu 'byin to //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la chags pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gsog tu 'byin to //
translated: Because of attachment to the perfection of wisdom, he makes the perfection of wisdom into a heap.🔽He makes the perfection of wisdom distant.”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ring du spong ngo zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la dmigs pa'i tshul du 'du shes su byed na ming dang mtshan mar 'dzin pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ring du spong ngo zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la dmigs pa'i tshul du 'du shes su byed na ming dang mtshan mar 'dzin pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don
translated: Up to here, if one makes the perfection of wisdom into an object, apprehending it as a name and a sign, one does not understand the meaning of the perfection of wisdom.

original: dang mi mthun pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gsog tu 'byin cing ring du spong ba yin par bstan pa dang / de ltar ming dang mtshan mar 'dzin pa nyid yang dag pa yin gyi gzhan ni log pa yin no zhes don de nyid bsnyems shing rlom sems su byed na yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gsog tu 'byin cing ring du spong ba yin no zhes
analyzed: dang mi mthun pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gsog tu 'byin cing ring du spong ba yin par bstan pa dang / de ltar ming dang mtshan mar 'dzin pa nyid yang dag pa yin gyi gzhan ni log pa yin no zhes don de nyid bsnyems shing rlom sems su byed na yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gsog tu 'byin cing ring du spong ba yin no zhes
translated: And if one arrogantly and conceitedly thinks that just this grasping at names and signs is correct and everything else is mistaken, it is taught that one is casting away the perfection of wisdom and abandoning it.

original: bstan pa'o // rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: bstan pa'o // rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said:

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yang de ltar legs par bshad cing legs par bstan pa la chags pa dang ma chags pa de dag kyang mchis pa ngo mtshar che'o zhes bya ba
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yang de ltar legs par bshad cing legs par bstan pa la chags pa dang ma chags pa de dag kyang mchis pa ngo mtshar che'o zhes bya ba
translated: Blessed One, it is amazing that for bodhisattva great beings this perfection of wisdom is so well explained and so well taught, and that there are those who are attached and those who are not attached to it.

original: ni chags pa dang ma chags pa'i mtshan nyid 'og nas zhib tu bshad pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir rab 'byor gyis gsol pa ste /🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don dang sbyar na don dam par chags pa dang ma chags pa yang brjod du med pa'i rigs pa las kun rdzob tu 'di dag ni chags pa'o //
analyzed: ni chags pa dang ma chags pa'i mtshan nyid 'og nas zhib tu bshad pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir rab 'byor gyis gsol pa ste / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don dang sbyar na don dam par chags pa dang ma chags pa yang brjod du med pa'i rigs pa las kun rdzob tu 'di dag ni chags pa'o //
translated: Subhuti said, Lord, it is wonderful how far this perfection of wisdom of the Bodhisattvas, the great beings, goes to the help of the five perfections.

original: 'di dag ni ma chags pa'o zhes so sor phye ste bshad pa ngo mtshar che ste legs so zhes gsol pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni ma chags pa'o zhes so sor phye ste bshad pa ngo mtshar che ste legs so zhes gsol pa'o //
translated: When applied to the meaning of the perfection of wisdom, it is said, Wonderful is the perfection of wisdom of the Bodhisattvas, the great beings, which, although in the ultimate sense attachment and non-attachment are inexpressible, nevertheless distinguishes and explains in the conventional sense that 'these are attachments' and 'these are non-attachments.'

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bus tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bus tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Then the venerable Subhuti said to the venerable Sariputra, What do you think, Sariputra?

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid stong pa zhes bya bar 'du shes na chags pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni sh'a ri'i bus rab 'byor la chags pa @47b dang ma chags pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa dris pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos rnams la dmigs pa dang bcas shing mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i tshul gyis stong pa zhes bya bar 'du shes na yang stong pa'i mtha' la chags pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid stong pa zhes bya bar 'du shes na chags pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni sh'a ri'i bus rab 'byor la chags pa @47b dang ma chags pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa dris pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos rnams la dmigs pa dang bcas shing mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i tshul gyis stong pa zhes bya bar 'du shes na yang stong pa'i mtha' la chags pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o
translated: The passage from “Śāriputra, if you think that the notion ‘the knowledge of all aspects is empty’ is a designation, then you are attached” up to “Śāriputra, if you think that the notion ‘the knowledge of all aspects is signless’ is a designation, then you are attached” teaches that if you think that the phenomena from form up to the knowledge of all aspects are empty in the manner of having an object and having a sign, then you are attached to the extreme of emptiness.

original: // tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo thabs mi mkhas pas 'das pa'i chos rnams la 'das pa'i chos zhes bya bar 'du shes na chags pa'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: // tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo thabs mi mkhas pas 'das pa'i chos rnams la 'das pa'i chos zhes bya bar 'du shes na chags pa'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The passage from “Venerable Śāradvatīputra, if you think that the notion ‘past phenomena are past phenomena’ is a designation, then you are attached” up to “Venerable Śāradvatīputra, if you think that the notion ‘future phenomena are future phenomena’ is a designation, then you are attached” teaches that if you think that the phenomena from form up to the knowledge of all aspects are past, future, or present in the manner of having an object and having a sign, then you are attached to the extreme of the three times.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la spyod na chags pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni dus gsum gyi chos rnams dmigs pa'i tshul gyis yod par 'dzin pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams la dmigs pa dang bcas shing mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i tshul gyis spyod na yang yod pa'i mtha' la chags pa yin no zhes bstan
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la spyod na chags pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni dus gsum gyi chos rnams dmigs pa'i tshul gyis yod par 'dzin pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams la dmigs pa dang bcas shing mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i tshul gyis spyod na yang yod pa'i mtha' la chags pa yin no zhes bstan
translated: The passage from “If they practice the knowledge of all aspects, it is attachment” teaches that if they practice the dharmas of the three times by way of apprehending them as existent and if they practice the dharmas of purification from the six perfections up to the knowledge of all aspects by way of apprehending them and by way of apprehending their signs, then they are attached to the extreme of existence.

original: pa'o // tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gang yang 'di skad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa rnams kyi chags pa med pa gang zhes zer ba ni zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: pa'o // tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu gang yang 'di skad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa rnams kyi chags pa med pa gang zhes zer ba ni zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The passage from “Venerable Śāradvatīputra, with regard to what you have asked, ‘What is the nonattachment of bodhisattva mahāsattvas who practice the perfection of wisdom?’” up to

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs mkhas pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe chags pa med pa dag go zhes bya ba'i bar du ni phung po lnga dang
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs mkhas pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe chags pa med pa dag go zhes bya ba'i bar du ni phung po lnga dang
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatīputra, those are the skillful means of bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom, and they are unattached.”🔽🔽

original: dus gsum la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis mtshan mar mi 'dzin pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rnams stong pa nyid bcva brgyad dang sbyar te /
analyzed: dus gsum la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis mtshan mar mi 'dzin pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rnams stong pa nyid bcva brgyad dang sbyar te /
translated: The passage from “Venerable Śāradvatīputra, those bodhisattva great beings are unattached” up to “when they practice the perfection of wisdom through skill in means” teaches that they are unattached because they do not apprehend signs by way of observing the three times and the eighteen emptinesses in combination with the bodhisattva practices such as the six perfections.

original: de dag la dmigs pa dang bcas pas mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing 'khor gsum yongs su dag par spyod pa ni chags pa med pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de dag la dmigs pa dang bcas pas mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing 'khor gsum yongs su dag par spyod pa ni chags pa med pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: They do not apprehend signs by observing those, and their practice is completely pure in the three spheres.

original: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so zhes bya ba nas chags pa de dag la chags par gyur na /
analyzed: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so zhes bya ba nas chags pa de dag la chags par gyur na /
translated: Then Śatakratu, head of the gods, said to the venerable Su­bhūti, “Venerable Su­bhūti!

analyzed: chags pa med pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par mi nus so zhes bya ba'i bar du ni gong du yod pa dang med pa'i @48a * //
translated: Up to “one cannot practice the perfection of wisdom free from attachment” teaches the characteristics of attachment to the extremes of existence and nonexistence as above.

original: mtha' la chags pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i don de nyid 'khor rnams la rnam pa gzhan gyis zhib tu bstan pa'i phyir chags pa'i mtshan nyid brgya byin gyis rab 'byor la dris pa dang / rab 'byor gyis byang chub kyi sems dang pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad la dmigs pa dang bcas shing mtshan ma dang bcas par 'du shes na yang byang chub sems dpa'i chags pa yin te /
analyzed: mtha' la chags pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa'i don de nyid 'khor rnams la rnam pa gzhan gyis zhib tu bstan pa'i phyir chags pa'i mtshan nyid brgya byin gyis rab 'byor la dris pa dang / rab 'byor gyis byang chub kyi sems dang pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa rnam par byang ba'i chos thams cad la dmigs pa dang bcas shing mtshan ma dang bcas par 'du shes na yang byang chub sems dpa'i chags pa yin te /
translated: In order to teach the meaning of that to the retinue in detail with another aspect, Śatakratu asked Subhūti about the characteristics of attachment, and Subhūti said, “If bodhisattvas apprehend and have the notion that all phenomena of purification, such as the thought of awakening and the six perfections, exist, that is the bodhisattva’s attachment.”

original: de ltar chags par gyur na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don dang mi mthun pas chags pa med pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par ma nus so zhes chags pa'i nyes dmigs dang bcas par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar chags par gyur na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don dang mi mthun pas chags pa med pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par ma nus so zhes chags pa'i nyes dmigs dang bcas par bstan pa'o //
translated: Thus, since it is incompatible with the meaning of the perfection of wisdom, it is said that one is unable to practice the perfection of wisdom free from attachment, together with the drawbacks of attachment.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni koo shi ka gzugs kyi rang bzhin yongs su bsngo bar mi nus so zhes bya ba nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yongs su bsngo bar mi nus so zhes bya ba'i bar du ni chags pa dang bcas shing 'du shes dang🔽bcas pa'i yongs su bsngo ba mi rigs pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de ni koo shi ka gzugs kyi rang bzhin yongs su bsngo bar mi nus so zhes bya ba nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yongs su bsngo bar mi nus so zhes bya ba'i bar du ni chags pa dang bcas shing 'du shes dang bcas pa'i yongs su bsngo ba mi rigs pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: Kauśika, the nature of form cannot be dedicated, up to the nature of the knowledge of all aspects cannot be dedicated. This teaches the reason why it is illogical to dedicate with attachment and with discriminations.

original: gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos rnams don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos rnams don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
translated: The dharmas from form up to the knowledge of all aspects are ultimately empty of intrinsic nature.

original: stong pa'i rang bzhin la dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i 'du shes kyis yongs su bsngo ba med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa'i rang bzhin la dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i 'du shes kyis yongs su bsngo ba med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It is not with a perception that has an empty nature as its object that one dedicates.

original: koo shi ka gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gzhan zhig bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par bstan tam zhes bya ba nas ;
analyzed: koo shi ka gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gzhan zhig bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par bstan tam zhes bya ba nas ;
translated: Moreover, Kauśika, a bodhisattva great being should teach others to be fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, and so on, up to

original: de ltar na rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo des chags pa'i mtha' thams cad yongs su spangs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la bdag nyid chags pa med par bya ba bstan
analyzed: de ltar na rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo des chags pa'i mtha' thams cad yongs su spangs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la bdag nyid chags pa med par bya ba bstan
translated: In that way, that son of a good family or daughter of a good family has given up all the extremes of attachment.

original: nas / gzhan la chos ston pa'i tshe yang chags pa med par bstan cing bskul ba'i thabs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: nas / gzhan la chos ston pa'i tshe yang chags pa med par bstan cing bskul ba'i thabs bstan pa ste /
translated: Having taught that one should oneself be without attachment to this deep perfection of wisdom, it teaches the method of encouraging others to teach the Dharma without attachment.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams la spyod pa'i tshe ci nas kyang bdag chos de rnams la spyod do snyam du sems pa'i rnam par @48b rtog pa de
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams la spyod pa'i tshe ci nas kyang bdag chos de rnams la spyod do snyam du sems pa'i rnam par @48b rtog pa de
translated: When they practice the factors of complete purification, from the six transcendent perfections up to omniscience, they do so in such a way that they never have the thought “I am practicing these teachings.”🔽

original: lta bu mi 'byung bar gzhan rnams la yang dag par bstan cing yang dag par bskul ba dang / yang dag par spro ba bskyed pa dang / yang dag par dga' ba bskyed par bya'o zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: lta bu mi 'byung bar gzhan rnams la yang dag par bstan cing yang dag par bskul ba dang / yang dag par spro ba bskyed pa dang / yang dag par dga' ba bskyed par bya'o zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: When one practices the elements of purification, from the six perfections up to the knowledge of all aspects, one should teach others, exhort them, and encourage them, so that the thought “I am practicing these dharmas” does not arise.

original: de la yang dag par bstan pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'jug pa'i lam mi shes pa la lam phyin ci ma log par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de la yang dag par bstan pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'jug pa'i lam mi shes pa la lam phyin ci ma log par bstan pa'o //
translated: Here, “teaching” is teaching the unerring path to those who do not know the path to enter into unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: yang dag par bskul ba ni lam log par zhugs pa rnams kyi kha lo sgyur zhing 'chos pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par bskul ba ni lam log par zhugs pa rnams kyi kha lo sgyur zhing 'chos pa'o //
translated: “Exhorting” is turning and correcting those who have entered the wrong path.

original: yang dag par spro ba bskyed pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob tu mi re zhing sems zhum pa rnams la gzengs bstod cing spro ba bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par spro ba bskyed pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob tu mi re zhing sems zhum pa rnams la gzengs bstod cing spro ba bskyed pa'o //
translated: Encouragement means to praise and encourage those who are discouraged and do not hope to attain supreme enlightenment.

original: yang dag par dga' bar bya ba ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par zhugs pa rnams bsngags shing bstod nas dga' bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par dga' bar bya ba ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par zhugs pa rnams bsngags shing bstod nas dga' bar byed pa'o //
translated: Rejoicing means to rejoice in those who have set out for supreme enlightenment, praising and extolling them.

original: yang dag pa'i rjes su song ba'i yid kyis zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa dang / mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'i sems kyis gzhan la bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rjes su song ba'i yid kyis zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa dang / mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'i sems kyis gzhan la bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: With a mind that has gone into reality means with a mind free from the concepts of objective referents and signs. The meaning is that one should teach others.

original: rma byung bar mi 'gyur zhing sangs rgyas kyis gnang ba'i yang dag par bskul bas yang dag par bskul ba yin te zhes bya ba ni de ltar rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rma byung bar mi 'gyur zhing sangs rgyas kyis gnang ba'i yang dag par bskul bas yang dag par bskul ba yin te zhes bya ba ni de ltar rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: One should exhort with an exhortation approved by the Buddha means that when one is practicing the purified dharmas in that way, one should exhort others to do the same.

original: chos de rnams la spyod pa'i rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung bar gzhan rnams la chos bstan na skyon du mi 'gyur zhing sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi bstan pa dang mthun par yang dag par ston cing bskul ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos de rnams la spyod pa'i rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung bar gzhan rnams la chos bstan na skyon du mi 'gyur zhing sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi bstan pa dang mthun par yang dag par ston cing bskul ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that if one teaches the Dharma to others without conceptualizing those dharmas, one will not commit any offense, and one will teach and exhort in accordance with the teaching of the Lord Buddha.🔽Thus, that son of a good family or daughter of a good family has completely abandoned all extremes of attachment.

original: de ltar na rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo des chags pa'i mtha' thams cad yongs su spangs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni de ltar gong du smos pa'i tshul du yang dag par bstan na dmigs pa dang bcas shing mtshan ma dang bcas par lta ba'i
analyzed: de ltar na rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo des chags pa'i mtha' thams cad yongs su spangs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni de ltar gong du smos pa'i tshul du yang dag par bstan na dmigs pa dang bcas shing mtshan ma dang bcas par lta ba'i
translated: The meaning is that if one teaches in the manner stated above, one will completely abandon the faults of seeing with reference points and with signs,

original: skyon dang / yod pa dang med pa'i mtha' la chags pa'i skyon thams cad yongs su spangs pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: skyon dang / yod pa dang med pa'i mtha' la chags pa'i skyon thams cad yongs su spangs pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: and the faults of attachment to the extremes of existence and nonexistence.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la legs so zhes bya ba gnang ste /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la legs so zhes bya ba gnang ste /
translated: Then the Lord approved of the venerable Subhūti, saying, “Excellent, excellent, Subhūti!

original: rab 'byor de ltar khyod byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' @49a * //
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar khyod byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' @49a * //
translated: Well said, Subhuti,🔽the Lord said, when you teach the Bodhisattvas, the great beings, in such a way.

original: chen po rnams la chags pa'i rnam pa de lta bu dag ston pa legs so legs so zhes bya ba ni gong du rab 'byor gyis chags pa med pa'i don bstan pa la /
analyzed: chen po rnams la chags pa'i rnam pa de lta bu dag ston pa legs so legs so zhes bya ba ni gong du rab 'byor gyis chags pa med pa'i don bstan pa la /
translated: Well said is the Lord's approval of Subhuti's teaching of the meaning of nonattachment above.

original: 'khor rnams brtan par yid ches par bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis rjes su yi rangs nas legs so zhes bya ba gnang ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor rnams brtan par yid ches par bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis rjes su yi rangs nas legs so zhes bya ba gnang ba bstan pa'o //
translated: In order to make the assembly firmly believe, he teaches the approval of well said.

original: rab 'byor de bas na khyod la chags pa'i rnam pa de bas kyang phra ba dag bstan par byas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa la mtshan mar yid la byed pa yang byang chub sems dpa'i chags pa yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor de bas na khyod la chags pa'i rnam pa de bas kyang phra ba dag bstan par byas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa la mtshan mar yid la byed pa yang byang chub sems dpa'i chags pa yin te /
translated: Subhuti, I will teach you the more subtle forms of attachment, etc. means that even the attention to the Tathagata, etc. as a sign is an attachment of the Bodhisattva.

original: chags pa gong du bshad pa pas kyang zab cing phra ba dag bshad par byas nyon cig ces skabs phye ba'o //
analyzed: chags pa gong du bshad pa pas kyang zab cing phra ba dag bshad par byas nyon cig ces skabs phye ba'o //
translated: It is said, Listen, I will teach the more subtle forms of attachment than those explained above, and thus the opportunity is given.

original: rab 'byor 'di la rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par zhugs pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par zhugs pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Subhuti, here a son or daughter of good family who has set out for full enlightenment, etc.

original: gang yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos de dag dang / de ma yin pa'i sems can gzhan rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad kyang mtshan mar bya ste /
analyzed: gang yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos de dag dang / de ma yin pa'i sems can gzhan rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad kyang mtshan mar bya ste /
translated: Subhūti, here, a son of a good family or a daughter of a good family who has set out for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, up to “having made all those wholesome roots into something with signs,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo na /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo na /
translated: and having dedicated them to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: rab 'byor ji tsam du mtshan mar yid la byed pa de tsam du chags pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi yon tan dang / mtshan dang / dpe byad la sogs pa la mtshan mar 'dzin cing yid la byed pa dang /
analyzed: rab 'byor ji tsam du mtshan mar yid la byed pa de tsam du chags pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi yon tan dang / mtshan dang / dpe byad la sogs pa la mtshan mar 'dzin cing yid la byed pa dang /
translated: Subhūti, to the extent that there is attention to something with signs, to that extent there is attachment.”

original: dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams la mtshan mar yid la byed cing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngo ba dang / 'phags pa nyan thos dang / so so'i skye bo rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams la mtshan mar bya ste /
analyzed: dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams la mtshan mar yid la byed cing bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngo ba dang / 'phags pa nyan thos dang / so so'i skye bo rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams la mtshan mar bya ste /
translated: They mentally attend to the roots of virtue of the Bhagavans, the Buddhas of the three times, and they dedicate them to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment. They mentally attend to the roots of virtue of the noble śrāvakas and ordinary beings, and they dedicate them to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba rnams byang chub sems dpa'i chags pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba rnams byang chub sems dpa'i chags pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The dedication of the roots of virtue of the Blessed Buddhas of the three times, while taking them as signs, to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, and the dedication of the roots of virtue of the noble Hearers and of ordinary beings, while taking them as signs, to unsurpassed enlightenment, are the attachments of the bodhisattva.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de dag ni mtshan mar yid la bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de dag ni mtshan mar yid la bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Those Tathagatas are not to be taken as signs,🔽and the roots of virtue of those Tathagatas are also not to be taken as signs.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba yang mtshan mar yid la bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mtshan mar yid la bya ba'i mi rigs pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba yang mtshan mar yid la bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mtshan mar yid la bya ba'i mi rigs pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches the reason why it is not reasonable to take them as signs.

original: de bzhin gshegs @49b pa rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams don dam par dngos po yod par ma grub pas mtshan mar yid la byar med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs @49b pa rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams don dam par dngos po yod par ma grub pas mtshan mar yid la byar med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The Thus-Gone Ones and the roots of virtue of the Thus-Gone Ones are not established as ultimately existent things, so they should not be mentally attended to as signs.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni zab bo zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa'i tshul du mtshan mar yid la byed pa thams cad chags pa yin par bshad pa'i don zab mo rab 'byor gyis rtogs nas /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni zab bo zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa'i tshul du mtshan mar yid la byed pa thams cad chags pa yin par bshad pa'i don zab mo rab 'byor gyis rtogs nas /
translated: Subhūti said, Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom is profound. This is because Subhūti realized the profound meaning explained above, that all mental attentions to signs are attachments.

original: 'khor thams cad kyis kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab par yid ches par bya ba'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni zab bo zhes gsol pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor thams cad kyis kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab par yid ches par bya ba'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni zab bo zhes gsol pa'o //
translated: In order to make the entire retinue trust in the profundity of the perfection of wisdom, he said, The perfection of wisdom is profound.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽So it is.

original: rab 'byor chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis rnam par dben pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pas mtshan mar 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i skyon gang gis kyang ma chags ma gos te yongs su dag cing dben pa'i
analyzed: rab 'byor chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis rnam par dben pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pas mtshan mar 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i skyon gang gis kyang ma chags ma gos te yongs su dag cing dben pa'i
translated: This means that ultimately, because all phenomena are empty by nature, they are not attached to or tainted by any faults such as grasping at signs, and are therefore pure and isolated.

original: phyir zab bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyir zab bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of profound.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya ba ni de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo bcom ldan 'das kyis bshad pa la rab 'byor dad pa skyes nas /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya ba ni de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo bcom ldan 'das kyis bshad pa la rab 'byor dad pa skyes nas /
translated: Subhūti said, Blessed One, I pay homage to the perfection of wisdom. This shows that Subhūti, having given rise to faith in the Blessed One's explanation of the profound meaning of the perfection of wisdom,

original: 'khor gzhan rnams kyang dag pa bskyed pa'i phyir gus shing rim gro bskyed pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor gzhan rnams kyang dag pa bskyed pa'i phyir gus shing rim gro bskyed pa bstan pa'o //
translated: and in order to generate purity in the other retinues, he respectfully generated reverence.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor de ni 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma byas mngon par 'dus ma byas pa ste zhes bya ba ni don dam par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rang bzhin gyis stong pas rgyu dang rkyen gang gis kyang ma byas🔽shing ma bskyed la /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ni 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma byas mngon par 'dus ma byas pa ste zhes bya ba ni don dam par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rang bzhin gyis stong pas rgyu dang rkyen gang gis kyang ma byas shing ma bskyed la /
translated: “Subhūti, it is because the perfection of wisdom is not made, is not brought about” means that ultimately the perfection of wisdom is empty of nature, and it is not made or produced by any cause or condition.

original: bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa'i dngos pos yongs su dag pa dang ma dag par mngon par 'du bya zhing bcos su yang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa'i dngos pos yongs su dag pa dang ma dag par mngon par 'du bya zhing bcos su yang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is not something that can be brought about or fabricated as pure or impure by the things of merit or demerit.

original: de ni sus kyang mngon par 'tshang rgya bar bya bar mi nus so zhes bya ba ni mngon par sangs rgyas par byed pa'i sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / mngon par sangs rgyas par bya ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyang rang bzhin gyis stong pas shes par bya ba dang /
analyzed: de ni sus kyang mngon par 'tshang rgya bar bya bar mi nus so zhes bya ba ni mngon par sangs rgyas par byed pa'i sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / mngon par sangs rgyas par bya ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyang rang bzhin gyis stong pas shes par bya ba dang /
translated: “No one can fully awaken to it” means that the buddhas who fully awaken, the bodhisattvas, and the perfection of wisdom that is to be fully awakened to are all empty of nature.

original: shes par byed pa gnyis ka med pa'i phyir sus kyang mngon par sangs rgyas par bya @50a * //🔽mi nus so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: shes par byed pa gnyis ka med pa'i phyir sus kyang mngon par sangs rgyas par bya @50a * // mi nus so zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because there is neither a knower nor anything to be known, no one can fully awaken to buddhahood.🔽Subhūti said, “Blessed One, all phenomena are not fully awakened.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad ni mngon par sangs ma rgyas pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'ba' zhig mngon par 'tshang rgya bar bya bar mi nus par ma zad kyi /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad ni mngon par sangs ma rgyas pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'ba' zhig mngon par 'tshang rgya bar bya bar mi nus par ma zad kyi /
translated: This explains that not only is the perfection of wisdom alone unable to fully awaken,

original: chos thams cad kyang don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong pas shes par byed pa dang / shes par bya ba gnyis ka med pa'i phyir mngon par sangs ma rgyas pa'o zhes bshad pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyang don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong pas shes par byed pa dang / shes par bya ba gnyis ka med pa'i phyir mngon par sangs ma rgyas pa'o zhes bshad pa'o //
translated: all phenomena are also not fully awakened because ultimately they are empty of inherent nature, and there is neither a knower nor anything to be known.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor de ni 'di ltar chos kyi rang bzhin ni gnyis ma yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ni 'di ltar chos kyi rang bzhin ni gnyis ma yin te /
translated: “Subhūti, it is because the nature of phenomena is not dual.🔽Subhūti, the nature of phenomena is just one.”

original: rab 'byor chos kyi rang bzhin ni gcig tu zad do zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad de bzhin du ro gcig ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor chos kyi rang bzhin ni gcig tu zad do zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad de bzhin du ro gcig ste /
translated: This explains that all phenomena are of one taste, just as they are.

original: don dam par stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du zad pas shes par byad pa dang / shes par bya ba gnyis su dbyer med do zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽rab 'byor chos kyi rang bzhin gcig po gang yin pa de ni rang bzhin ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gong du chos rang bzhin ni gcig tu zad do zhes bshad pa la kha cig de bzhin nyid dam stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gcig pu zhig
analyzed: don dam par stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du zad pas shes par byad pa dang / shes par bya ba gnyis su dbyer med do zhes bya ba'i don to // rab 'byor chos kyi rang bzhin gcig po gang yin pa de ni rang bzhin ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gong du chos rang bzhin ni gcig tu zad do zhes bshad pa la kha cig de bzhin nyid dam stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gcig pu zhig
translated: The meaning is that ultimately, since it is exhausted in the nature of emptiness, the object of cognition and the cognition are inseparable.🔽Subhūti, that which is the single nature of phenomena is not a nature.

original: yod par 'dzin pa bsal ba'i phyir de yang don dam par rang bzhin yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yod par 'dzin pa bsal ba'i phyir de yang don dam par rang bzhin yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This teaches that ultimately that also does not exist as a nature in order to dispel the apprehension by some that there is a single nature of suchness or emptiness.🔽That which is not a nature is not produced.

original: gang rang bzhin ma yin pa de ni ma byas pa'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar don dam par rang bzhin yod pa ma yin pa de ni rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang rang bzhin ma yin pa de ni ma byas pa'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar don dam par rang bzhin yod pa ma yin pa de ni rgyu dang rkyen gyis bskyed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that ultimately that which does not exist as a nature is not produced by causes and conditions.

original: gang ma byas pa de ni mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar rgyu dang rkyen gyis ma bskyed cing dngos po med pa de la ni bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pas bzang po dang ngan par bcos shing mngon par 'du byar
analyzed: gang ma byas pa de ni mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar rgyu dang rkyen gyis ma bskyed cing dngos po med pa de la ni bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pas bzang po dang ngan par bcos shing mngon par 'du byar
translated: This is to say, that which is not produced by causes and conditions, and which is not a thing, cannot be made good or bad by merit or demerit, and cannot be brought about.

original: yang med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yang med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the teaching.

original: rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos kyi rang bzhin gcig po rang bzhin ma yin pa ma byas pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos kyi rang bzhin gcig po rang bzhin ma yin pa ma byas pa /
translated: Subhuti, in this way, if the Bodhisattva-mahāsattva knows that the single nature of dharmas is not a nature,🔽and is not brought about, then he abandons all forms of attachment.

original: mngon par 'du ma byas pa shes na chags pa'i rnam pa thams cad yongs su spangs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni de ltar gong du bshad pa'i tshul du chos thams cad stong pa nyid du ro gcig ste /
analyzed: mngon par 'du ma byas pa shes na chags pa'i rnam pa thams cad yongs su spangs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni de ltar gong du bshad pa'i tshul du chos thams cad stong pa nyid du ro gcig ste /
translated: This is to say, in the way explained above, all dharmas are of one taste in emptiness.

original: ma byas shing mngon par 'du ma byas par shes na /
analyzed: ma byas shing mngon par 'du ma byas par shes na /
translated: If one knows that they are not done and are not brought about,

original: mtshan ma dang dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i skyon thams cad spangs pa yin @50b no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma dang dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i skyon thams cad spangs pa yin @50b no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The Lord: Because it is not a basis for the outflows, Subhuti.🔽 Subhuti : Hard to understand, O Lord, is the perfection of wisdom.🔽The Lord: Because it is not apprehended.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rtogs par dka' ba'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo dmigs pa can rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rtogs par dka' ba'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo dmigs pa can rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Subhuti : Deep, O Lord, is the perfection of wisdom.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord: Because it is not defiled by anything.🔽Subhuti : Inconceivable, O Lord, is the perfection of wisdom.🔽The Lord: Because it is not apprehended by anyone.

original: rab 'byor de ni 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni sus kyang ma mthong /🔽ma thos ma rtogs /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ni 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni sus kyang ma mthong / ma thos ma rtogs /
translated: Subhuti : Unthinkable, O Lord, is the perfection of wisdom.🔽The Lord: Because it is not apprehended by thought.🔽Subhuti : Incomparable, O Lord, is the perfection of wisdom.🔽The Lord: Because it is not apprehended by the incomparable.🔽Subhuti : Unequalled, O Lord, is the perfection of wisdom.🔽The Lord: Because it is not apprehended by the unequalled.🔽Subhuti : Not defiled, O Lord, is the perfection of wisdom.🔽The Lord: Because it is not apprehended by the defiled.🔽Subhuti : Not purified, O Lord, is the perfection of wisdom.🔽The Lord: Because it is not apprehended by the purified.🔽Subhuti : Incalculable, O Lord, is the perfection of wisdom.🔽The Lord: Because it is not apprehended by the incalculable.

original: rnam par ma shes mngon par sangs rgyas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa don dam par dngos po med pas mig gi rnam par shes pas mthong bar bya ba yang ma yin ;🔽rna ba'i rnam par shes pas thos par bya ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: rnam par ma shes mngon par sangs rgyas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa don dam par dngos po med pas mig gi rnam par shes pas mthong bar bya ba yang ma yin ;🔽rna ba'i rnam par shes pas thos par bya ba yang ma yin /
translated: Subhuti : Immeasurable, O Lord, is the perfection of wisdom.🔽The Lord: Because it is not apprehended by the immeasurable.🔽Subhuti : Infinite, O Lord, is the perfection of wisdom.🔽The Lord: Because it is not apprehended by the infinite.🔽Subhuti : Not past, O Lord, is the perfection of wisdom, not future, not present.🔽The Lord: Because it is not apprehended as past, future, or present.🔽Subhuti : Not defiled, O Lord, is the perfection of wisdom, not purified.🔽The Lord: Because it is not apprehended as defiled or purified.🔽Subhuti : Not bound, O Lord, is the perfection of wisdom, not freed.🔽The Lord: Because it is not apprehended as bound or freed.🔽Subhuti : Not produced, O Lord, is the perfection of wisdom, not stopped.🔽The Lord: Because it is not apprehended as produced or stopped.🔽Subhuti : Not decreasing, O Lord, is the perfection of wisdom

original: sna dang / lce dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pas rtogs par bya ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: sna dang / lce dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pas rtogs par bya ba yang ma yin /
translated: It is not to be realized by the ear, nose, tongue, body, or mental consciousnesses.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pas rnam par shes par bya ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pas rnam par shes par bya ba yang ma yin /
translated: It is not to be cognized by the mental consciousness.

original: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyis mngon par sangs rgyas par bya ba yang ma yin pa'i phyir rtogs par dka' ba yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyis mngon par sangs rgyas par bya ba yang ma yin pa'i phyir rtogs par dka' ba yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It is not to be fully awakened to by nondual wisdom.🔽Subhūti says, “Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom is inconceivable.”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa don dam par dngos po med pas mthong zhing thos pa la sogs pas mngon sum du byar mi rung
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa don dam par dngos po med pas mthong zhing thos pa la sogs pas mngon sum du byar mi rung
translated: Since the perfection of wisdom is ultimately not a thing, it cannot be made directly perceptible by seeing, hearing, and so on.

original: yang / sems kyis rjes su dpag tu med dam snyam du sems dpa'i the tshom bsal ba'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yang / sems kyis rjes su dpag tu med dam snyam du sems dpa'i the tshom bsal ba'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Subhūti thinks, “Is it not to be inferred by the mind?” In order to dispel that doubt, the Blessed One teaches, “It is inconceivable.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor de ni 'di ltar sems kyis ma shes so zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor de ni 'di ltar sems kyis ma shes so zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Subhūti, it is because it is not known by the mind, up to🔽it is not known by the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis ma shes so zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i don zhib tu bshad pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis ma shes so zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i don zhib tu bshad pa ste /
translated: This explains in detail the meaning of the inconceivability of this perfection of wisdom.

original: sems dang gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyis chos thams cad kyis shes par bya ba'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sems dang gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyis chos thams cad kyis shes par bya ba'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It teaches that all phenomena, from the mind up to the knowledge of all aspects, are inconceivable because they are not objects to be known.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum pa rgya cher bshad pa las le'u nyi shu brgyad pa'o /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum pa rgya cher bshad pa las le'u nyi shu brgyad pa'o /
translated: This concludes the twenty-eighth chapter on the perfection of wisdom in the commentary on the perfection of wisdom in one hundred thousand lines.

original: // / de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces @51a * //
analyzed: // / de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces @51a * //
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to the Blessed One:🔽Blessed One, how should a bodhisattva great being who wishes to train in this perfection of wisdom set about doing so?

original: gsol to // bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni bgyid pa ma mchis pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par mi rtog cing ci yang byed pa ma yin pa bstan pa'i sgo nas zab cing mos par dka' ba🔽bstan pa ste /
analyzed: gsol to // bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni bgyid pa ma mchis pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par mi rtog cing ci yang byed pa ma yin pa bstan pa'i sgo nas zab cing mos par dka' ba bstan pa ste /
translated: The Blessed One said, “Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom is not a doer.” This teaches that the perfection of wisdom is profound and difficult to believe because it is non-conceptual and does not do anything at all.

original: don dam par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyang rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
analyzed: don dam par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyang rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
translated: The perfection of wisdom itself is ultimately empty by nature.

original: dngos po med pas byed pa po'i rang bzhin ma yin la /
analyzed: dngos po med pas byed pa po'i rang bzhin ma yin la /
translated: Since it is not a thing, it is not a doer by nature.

original: chos thams cad kyang rang bzhin gyis stong pas bya ba'i dngos po ma yin te /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyang rang bzhin gyis stong pas bya ba'i dngos po ma yin te /
translated: And since all phenomena are empty by nature, they are not things to be done.

original: de ltar bya ba dang byed pa gnyis ka don dam par yod par ma grub pas cis kyang mi byed pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar bya ba dang byed pa gnyis ka don dam par yod par ma grub pas cis kyang mi byed pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus, since neither the doer nor the deed ultimately exist, the meaning is that it does not do anything at all.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor byed pa po mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong pas byed pa po'i dngos po dmigs su med pa'i phyir ci yang mi byed pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor byed pa po mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong pas byed pa po'i dngos po dmigs su med pa'i phyir ci yang mi byed pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Subhūti, because the agent is not apprehended. This teaches that because the perfection of wisdom is ultimately empty of intrinsic nature, the entity of an agent is not apprehended, so it does not do anything at all.

original: rab 'byor de bzhin du gzugs mi dmigs pa dang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin du gzugs mi dmigs pa dang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Subhūti, similarly, because form is not apprehended, up to

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du chos thams cad don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong pas bya ba'i dngos por yod pa
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni gzugs la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du chos thams cad don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong pas bya ba'i dngos por yod pa
translated: because the knowledge of all aspects is not apprehended. This teaches that because all phenomena from form up to the knowledge of all aspects are ultimately empty of intrinsic nature, they do not exist as entities of action,
