analyzed: gal te gzugs chags pa'am ma chags pa zhes bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do zhes bya ba nas /
translated: if they do not engage in the notion of form as either attached or unattached, they engage in the perfection of wisdom.

original: gal te rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid chags ma'am ma chags pa zhes bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pas chags par🔽bya ba'i gnas kyang ma yin no snyam mam chags pa med pa'i rang bzhin no snyam du yang mi sems shing rnam par mi rtog na gdod shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gal te rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid chags ma'am ma chags pa zhes bya bar mi spyod na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pas chags par bya ba'i gnas kyang ma yin no snyam mam chags pa med pa'i rang bzhin no snyam du yang mi sems shing rnam par mi rtog na gdod shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: If one does not practice with the thought that the knowledge of all modes is attached or not attached, then one practices the perfection of wisdom.🔽Up to this point it is taught that one should not think that all phenomena such as form are a basis for attachment because they are empty of intrinsic nature, nor should one think that they are not a basis for attachment because they are empty of intrinsic nature. If one does not think in these ways, and does not conceptualize, then one is practicing the perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar spyod na gzugs chags pa'am ma chags pa zhes bya bar 'du shes pa med do zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar spyod na gzugs chags pa'am ma chags pa zhes bya bar 'du shes pa med do zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Subhuti, if a Bodhisattva-mahāsattva practices in this way, he does not have the notion that form is attached or not attached.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub chags pa'am ma chags pa zhes bya bar 'du shes pa med do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de ltar gong du bshad pa'i tshul du chos thams cad la chags pa dang ma chags pa zhes bya bar
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub chags pa'am ma chags pa zhes bya bar 'du shes pa med do zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de ltar gong du bshad pa'i tshul du chos thams cad la chags pa dang ma chags pa zhes bya bar
translated: conceptualization of all phenomena as attached or unattached.

original: rnam par rtog pa med par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo bsgoms na /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo bsgoms na /
translated: If one meditates on the profound meaning of the perfection of wisdom without conceptualizing it in that way,

original: de'i yon tan @52b gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad la chags pa dang ma chags pa zhes bya bar mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang 'du shes skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de'i yon tan @52b gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad la chags pa dang ma chags pa zhes bya bar mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang 'du shes skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: it is taught that the qualities of all phenomena, such as form, will not be apprehended as signs or conceived of as attached or unattached.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ltar chos zab mo 'di bstan kyang yongs su mi 'grib /🔽ma bstan kyang yongs su mi 'grib /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ltar chos zab mo 'di bstan kyang yongs su mi 'grib / ma bstan kyang yongs su mi 'grib /
translated: Subhūti said, “Bhagavān, even though this profound Dharma is taught, it does not diminish;🔽even though it is not taught, it does not diminish;

original: bstan kyang mi 'phel /
analyzed: bstan kyang mi 'phel /
translated: even though it is taught, it does not increase;

original: ma bstan kyang mi 'phel ba ngo mtshar che'o zhes bya bas ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo 'di de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin mi 'gyur ba yongs su grub pa yin par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: ma bstan kyang mi 'phel ba ngo mtshar che'o zhes bya bas ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo 'di de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin mi 'gyur ba yongs su grub pa yin par bstan pa ste /
translated: The statement It is amazing that it does not increase even when taught indicates that the meaning of the perfection of wisdom is suchness, the unchanging perfected nature.

original: de la bstan kyang yongs su mi 'grib ces bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin mi 'gyur ba yongs su grub pa de chos ston pas nyan pa rnams la chos kyi sbyin pa bya ste /
analyzed: de la bstan kyang yongs su mi 'grib ces bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin mi 'gyur ba yongs su grub pa de chos ston pas nyan pa rnams la chos kyi sbyin pa bya ste /
translated: The statement It does not decrease even when taught indicates that the perfection of wisdom, the suchness that is the unchanging perfected nature, is the gift of Dharma to those who listen to the teaching of the Dharma.

original: rnam pa du mar bstan pas kyang de bzhin nyid la 'bri ba'am gdod par gyur pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam pa du mar bstan pas kyang de bzhin nyid la 'bri ba'am gdod par gyur pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The statement It does not increase even when taught in many ways indicates that suchness is not diminished or augmented by the teaching of the Dharma in many ways.

original: ma bstan kyang yongs su mi 'grib ces bya ba ni gzhan la ma bstan ma spel na sus kyang ma mnyan ma bsam ma bsgoms pas nub ste med par yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ma bstan kyang yongs su mi 'grib ces bya ba ni gzhan la ma bstan ma spel na sus kyang ma mnyan ma bsam ma bsgoms pas nub ste med par yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The statement It does not decrease even when not taught indicates that even if it is not taught to others and is not propagated, it does not disappear and become nonexistent, because no one listens to it, reflects on it, or meditates on it.

original: bstan kyang mi 'phel zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin chos zab mo mi 'gyur ba yongs su grub pa yin pas sems can mang po la bstan te spel kyang sems can rnams kyis so sor rtogs shing go ba tsam du zad kyi de bzhin
analyzed: bstan kyang mi 'phel zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin chos zab mo mi 'gyur ba yongs su grub pa yin pas sems can mang po la bstan te spel kyang sems can rnams kyis so sor rtogs shing go ba tsam du zad kyi de bzhin
translated: “Even if taught, it does not increase” means that the nature of suchness is the profound, unchanging, perfected Dharma. Therefore, even if it is taught and spread to many sentient beings, it is merely understood and comprehended by sentient beings, but the nature of suchness

original: nyid kyi rang bzhin la ni 'phel zhing rgyas par 'gyur ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyid kyi rang bzhin la ni 'phel zhing rgyas par 'gyur ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: does not increase and expand. This is the meaning.

original: ma bstan kyang mi 'phel zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid ni mi 'gyur ba yongs su grub pa yin pas /
analyzed: ma bstan kyang mi 'phel zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid ni mi 'gyur ba yongs su grub pa yin pas /
translated: “Even if not taught, it does not increase” means that suchness is the unchanging perfected nature.

original: gzhan la ma bstan te /
analyzed: gzhan la ma bstan te /
translated: Therefore, even if it is not taught to others,

original: ma god kyang 'phel zhing rgyas par 'gyur ba yang med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ma god kyang 'phel zhing rgyas par 'gyur ba yang med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: it does not increase and expand even if not corrupted. This is the teaching.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: de de bzhin no //
analyzed: de de bzhin no //
translated: “It is so.

original: rab 'byor de de bzhin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rab 'byor gyis gsol pa'i tshig dang don 'khor rnams kyis brtan par yid ches par bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis de bden no zhes bka' stsal pa'o //🔽rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor de de bzhin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rab 'byor gyis gsol pa'i tshig dang don 'khor rnams kyis brtan par yid ches par bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis de bden no zhes bka' stsal pa'o // rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba nas /
translated: As for Thus it is, Subhuti, etc., the Lord says this to make the assembly firmly believe the words and meaning of Subhuti's statement.

original: rab 'byor de bzhin du chos rnams kyi chos nyid gang yin pa de bstan kyang de bzhin ma bstan kyang de bzhin no zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo mi @53a * //
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin du chos rnams kyi chos nyid gang yin pa de bstan kyang de bzhin ma bstan kyang de bzhin no zhes bya ba'i bar du ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo mi @53a * //
translated: As for For example, Subhuti, etc., the Lord teaches an example of the unchangeability of the profound meaning of the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'gyur ba yongs su grub pa yin pas rkyen gyi khar ma las pa'i dpe bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ba yongs su grub pa yin pas rkyen gyi khar ma las pa'i dpe bstan pa'o //
translated: Since the ultimate reality of phenomena is the perfected nature, which is not subject to change, he teaches an example that is not subject to conditions.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing zhes bya ba nas /
translated: As for The Lord: Just as, Subhuti, the Dharmahood of the Tathagatas, etc., the Lord teaches an example of the unchangeability of the profound meaning of the perfection of wisdom.

original: dka' ba bgyid pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo mi 'gyur ba yongs su grub cing /
analyzed: dka' ba bgyid pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo mi 'gyur ba yongs su grub cing /
translated: The passage from “It is difficult to have conviction in it” up to “It is difficult to practice it” teaches that when one practices and teaches the profound meaning of the perfection of wisdom, which is unchanging and fully established,

original: rkyen gyi khar ma las pa mos pa dang yid ches par dka' ba de lta bu la spyod cing bstan pa'i tshe /
analyzed: rkyen gyi khar ma las pa mos pa dang yid ches par dka' ba de lta bu la spyod cing bstan pa'i tshe /
translated: and which is difficult to have conviction in and believe in because it is not dependent on conditions,

original: sems zhum pa dang g-yeng bar yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: sems zhum pa dang g-yeng bar yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: one’s mind will not become discouraged or distracted.

original: brtson 'grus mi gtong zhing phyir mi ldog par nus pa'i ngo mtshar che ste dka' ba spyod pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus mi gtong zhing phyir mi ldog par nus pa'i ngo mtshar che ste dka' ba spyod pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It teaches that one is able to practice the difficult conduct without giving up one’s perseverance and without turning back, and that this is a great wonder.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste /
translated: Blessed One, it is like this:🔽The cultivation of the perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva great beings is the cultivation of space.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms pa 'di ni nam mkha' bsgom pa ste zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo bsgom zhing nyams su len pa dka' ba spyod
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms pa 'di ni nam mkha' bsgom pa ste zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo bsgom zhing nyams su len pa dka' ba spyod
translated: The passage from “It is difficult to practice it” up to “It is difficult to have conviction in it” teaches that the practice of the profound meaning of the perfection of wisdom, which is difficult to practice,

original: pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: The explanation of the argument.🔽Just as space is non-entity and free from all signs, so also this profound meaning of the perfection of wisdom is non-entity and signless.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' dngos po med cing mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo 'di yang dngos po med cing mtshan ma med pa la spyod cing bsgom yang skyo zhing yid 'byung bar mi 'gyur
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' dngos po med cing mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo 'di yang dngos po med cing mtshan ma med pa la spyod cing bsgom yang skyo zhing yid 'byung bar mi 'gyur
translated: One practices and meditates, but does not become weary or discouraged.

original: ba dka' ba spyod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ba dka' ba spyod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of one practices difficult conduct.

original: nam mkha' la ni gzugs ma mchis so //
analyzed: nam mkha' la ni gzugs ma mchis so //
translated: In space, there is no form.

original: tshor ba ma mchis so zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: tshor ba ma mchis so zhes bya ba nas /
translated: There is no feeling, and so on,🔽up to: there is no unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ma mchis so zhes bya ba'i bar du ni nam mkha' la dngos po dang / mtshan ma med pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ma mchis so zhes bya ba'i bar du ni nam mkha' la dngos po dang / mtshan ma med pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches the argument of non-entity and signlessness in space.

original: nam mkha' ni gzugs la sogs pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la thug gi bar du chos de dag thams cad kyi dngos po ma yin zhing rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' ni gzugs la sogs pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la thug gi bar du chos de dag thams cad kyi dngos po ma yin zhing rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
translated: Space is not the entity of any of those phenomena, from form up to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, and is empty of an inherent nature.

original: de lta bu rang bzhin gyis stong pa la bsgom par dka' ba de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bsgom pa yang dka' ba spyod pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //🔽bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang gis go cha 'di 'tshal ba de dag ni phyag bgyi bar 'os pa'o zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa'i tshul du @53b shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo nam mkha' dang
analyzed: de lta bu rang bzhin gyis stong pa la bsgom par dka' ba de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bsgom pa yang dka' ba spyod pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o // bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang gis go cha 'di 'tshal ba de dag ni phyag bgyi bar 'os pa'o zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa'i tshul du @53b shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo nam mkha' dang
translated: Just as it is difficult to meditate on that which is empty of an inherent nature, so it is difficult to practice the perfection of wisdom.🔽“Blessed One, those bodhisattva great beings who take up this armor are worthy of homage.”

original: 'dra ba la spyod cing bsgom yang sems zhum par mi 'gyur zhing phyir ldog par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'dra ba la spyod cing bsgom yang sems zhum par mi 'gyur zhing phyir ldog par mi 'gyur la /
translated: In the manner explained above, they practice and meditate on the profound meaning of the perfection of wisdom, which is like space, and their minds do not become discouraged or turn back.

original: dka' ba spyod pa de lta bu dkon zhing ngo mtshar che ste /
analyzed: dka' ba spyod pa de lta bu dkon zhing ngo mtshar che ste /
translated: Such difficult practices are rare and wonderful.

original: go cha chen po bgos pa yin pas lha dang mi rnams kyis mchod cing phyag bya bar 'os pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: go cha chen po bgos pa yin pas lha dang mi rnams kyis mchod cing phyag bya bar 'os pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: They are the ones who have donned the great armor, and so they are worthy of being worshipped and bowed to by gods and humans.🔽Blessed One, those who don this armor are dedicated to striving for the sake of space, are dedicated to being intent, and are dedicated to being diligent.

original: bcom ldan 'das gang gis go cha 'di 'tshal ba de dag ni nam mkha'i don du brtson par mos 'bad par mos rtsol bar mos pa dag ste zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo bsgom zhing yid ches par dka' ba
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang gis go cha 'di 'tshal ba de dag ni nam mkha'i don du brtson par mos 'bad par mos rtsol bar mos pa dag ste zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo bsgom zhing yid ches par dka' ba
translated: This shows that those who meditate on the profound meaning of the perfection of wisdom and who do not lose heart,

original: la bsgom yang sems zhum par mi 'gyur zhing phyir mi ldog pa'i go cha bgos pa de dag dka' ba spyod pa'i dpe nam mkha' la rtsol zhing 'bad pa dang 'dra bar dka' ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: la bsgom yang sems zhum par mi 'gyur zhing phyir mi ldog pa'i go cha bgos pa de dag dka' ba spyod pa'i dpe nam mkha' la rtsol zhing 'bad pa dang 'dra bar dka' ba bstan pa'o //
translated: but don the armor of irreversibility, are like the example of difficult practice of striving and exerting oneself in space.

original: bcom ldan 'das gang gis sems can rnams kyi slad du go cha 'tshal ba de dag ni nam mkha' yongs su smin par 'tshal zhing yongs su grol bar 'tshal ba'o zhes bya ba ni sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang rnam par grol bar bya ba'i
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang gis sems can rnams kyi slad du go cha 'tshal ba de dag ni nam mkha' yongs su smin par 'tshal zhing yongs su grol bar 'tshal ba'o zhes bya ba ni sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang rnam par grol bar bya ba'i
translated: Blessed One, those who don the armor for the sake of sentient beings are those who want to ripen and liberate space.

original: phyir brtson 'grus kyi go cha bgos pa de dag kyang don dam par sems can dngos po med de //
analyzed: phyir brtson 'grus kyi go cha bgos pa de dag kyang don dam par sems can dngos po med de //
translated: This shows that those who don the armor of effort in order to ripen and liberate sentient beings, in the ultimate sense, do not have real sentient beings as their object.

original: ma mkha' dang 'dra ba la yongs su smin pa dang / rnam par grol bar byed pa ni nam mkha' yongs su smin pa dang / rnam par grol bar bya bar 'dod du zad do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ma mkha' dang 'dra ba la yongs su smin pa dang / rnam par grol bar byed pa ni nam mkha' yongs su smin pa dang / rnam par grol bar bya bar 'dod du zad do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: They are like space, so it is as if they want to ripen and liberate space.

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nam mkha' lta bu'i chos rnams kyi slad du go cha 'tshal ba de dag ni go cha chen po 'tshal ba'o zhes bya ba ni yongs su smin par bya ba dang / rnam par grol bar bya ba'i sems can rnams dang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nam mkha' lta bu'i chos rnams kyi slad du go cha 'tshal ba de dag ni go cha chen po 'tshal ba'o zhes bya ba ni yongs su smin par bya ba dang / rnam par grol bar bya ba'i sems can rnams dang /
translated: Blessed One, those bodhisattva great beings who don the armor for the sake of space-like phenomena don the great armor.

original: mngon par rtogs par bya ba dang / thob par bya ba'i rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams dang / yongs su spang zhing zad par bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i phyogs su gtogs pa'i chos thams cad don dam par dngos po med cing rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs par bya ba dang / thob par bya ba'i rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams dang / yongs su spang zhing zad par bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i phyogs su gtogs pa'i chos thams cad don dam par dngos po med cing rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
translated: The phenomena of complete purification that are to be realized and attained, and all the phenomena that are to be abandoned and exhausted, which are included in the class of afflictions, are ultimately unreal and empty by nature.

original: nam mkha' dang 'dra ba la sems can rnams yongs su smin pa dang / rnam par grol bar bya bar brtson pa dang rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams mngon par rtogs shing thob par bya bar brtson pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i @54a * //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang 'dra ba la sems can rnams yongs su smin pa dang / rnam par grol bar bya bar brtson pa dang rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams mngon par rtogs shing thob par bya bar brtson pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i @54a * //
translated: They are like space. Yet, they strive to bring sentient beings to full maturity and liberation, they strive to realize and attain the phenomena of complete purification, and they strive to abandon and exhaust the phenomena of the class of afflictions.

original: phyogs su gtogs pa'i chos rnams yongs su spang zhing zad par bya bar brtson pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de dag ni dka' ba spyod pa ste /
analyzed: phyogs su gtogs pa'i chos rnams yongs su spang zhing zad par bya bar brtson pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de dag ni dka' ba spyod pa ste /
translated: Those bodhisattvas who strive to abandon and exhaust the phenomena that belong to the extremes are those who practice austerities.

original: go cha chen po bgos pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: go cha chen po bgos pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: They are those who don the great armor.

original: bcom ldan 'das sems can rnams kyi don du go cha 'tshal ba de dag ni nam mkha' bar snang la gdeg par 'tshal ba'o zhes bya ba yang don dam par sems can dngos po med de /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sems can rnams kyi don du go cha 'tshal ba de dag ni nam mkha' bar snang la gdeg par 'tshal ba'o zhes bya ba yang don dam par sems can dngos po med de /
translated: Blessed One, those who don the armor for the sake of sentient beings are those who wish to lift up space.

original: nam mkha' dang 'dra ba la sems can gyi don bya bar rtsol ba de dag kyang dka' ba spyod pa'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang 'dra ba la sems can gyi don bya bar rtsol ba de dag kyang dka' ba spyod pa'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Those who strive to benefit sentient beings, who are ultimately unreal and like space, are those who practice austerities.

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang sems can rnams kyi slad du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par zhugs pa de dag ni brtson 'grus chen po thob pa'o zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems

translated: This is because the efforts and endeavors of sentient beings would be meaningless, and it demonstrates the praise of the perfection of wisdom endowed with method and wisdom.🔽Then, the Lord of the Gods, Sakra, said to the Venerable Subhuti:

original: gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la bslab par sems pa de ni mkha' stong pa la brtson pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni gong du kun rdzob zag pa med pa'i phung po lnga la sogs pa yod par bstan pa la chags shing mtshan🔽mar 'dzin pa bsal ba'i phyir /

translated: The passage from “Whoever thinks to train in this perfection of wisdom” up to “is striving in empty space” is taught in order to dispel attachment to and grasping at signs in the teaching above that the five contaminated and uncontaminated aggregates and so on exist conventionally.

original: don dam par chos thams cad nam mkha' stong pa dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par chos thams cad nam mkha' stong pa dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The passage from “Therefore, Subhūti” up to “You should know that all phenomena are like empty space” is taught in order to show that ultimately all phenomena are to be known as being like empty space.

original: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Then Śatakratu, head of the gods, said to the Lord:

original: de ni bsam pa ltar mi 'grub cing dub pa'i skal ba can du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: de ni bsam pa ltar mi 'grub cing dub pa'i skal ba can du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: “He will not accomplish his aim and will end up exhausted.”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo ji skad du bstan pa la mos shing yid ches la /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo ji skad du bstan pa la mos shing yid ches la /
translated: This passage is taught in order to show that if one has conviction in and believes the profound meaning of the perfection of wisdom as it has been taught,

original: dmigs pa dang bcas shing mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i 'du shes can du ma gyur na /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas shing mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i 'du shes can du ma gyur na /
translated: and if one does not have a perception that is referential and involves signs,

original: mi dang mi ma yin pa la sogs pas glags btsal ba'i dmigs med de /🔽de nyid de'i bsrung ba dang / bskyab pa yin pas mtshan ma dang @55a * //
analyzed: mi dang mi ma yin pa la sogs pas glags btsal ba'i dmigs med de / de nyid de'i bsrung ba dang / bskyab pa yin pas mtshan ma dang @55a * //
translated: There is no basis for being harmed by humans, non-humans, and so on.

original: bcas pa'i ba srung ba bya mi dgos so zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: bcas pa'i ba srung ba bya mi dgos so zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: Since that itself is its protection and its refuge, it is not necessary to perform protection with signs.

original: don dam par gang la bsrung bar bya ba'i dngos po de lta bu yod par ma grub pas dngos po med pa la 'bad cing rtsol ba ni don yod par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par gang la bsrung bar bya ba'i dngos po de lta bu yod par ma grub pas dngos po med pa la 'bad cing rtsol ba ni don yod par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This teaches that since ultimately such a thing that is to be protected is not established as existent, striving and exertion in regard to a non-thing will not be meaningful.

original: koo shi ka de ji snyam du sems khyod kyis sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / rmi lam dang / sgra ba snyan dang / mig yor dang / sprul pa la bsrung ba dang / bskyang ba dang / bskyab par nus sam zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: koo shi ka de ji snyam du sems khyod kyis sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / rmi lam dang / sgra ba snyan dang / mig yor dang / sprul pa la bsrung ba dang / bskyang ba dang / bskyab par nus sam zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Kauśika, what do you think? Can you protect, guard, and defend an illusion, a mirage, a dream, an echo, an optical illusion, or a magical creation?

original: koo shi ka ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: koo shi ka ji snyam du sems /
translated: Kauśika, what do you think?

original: khyod kyis chos kyi dbyings dang / yang dag pa'i mthar dang / de bzhin nyid dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings la bsrung ba dang / bskyang ba dang / bskyab par nus sam /
analyzed: khyod kyis chos kyi dbyings dang / yang dag pa'i mthar dang / de bzhin nyid dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings la bsrung ba dang / bskyang ba dang / bskyab par nus sam /
translated: Can you protect, guard, and defend the dharma-element, the very limit of reality, thusness, and the inconceivable element?

original: brgya byin gyis smras pa /
analyzed: brgya byin gyis smras pa /
translated: Śakra said,

original: btsun pa rab 'byor de ni mi nus so //
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor de ni mi nus so //
translated: “Venerable Subhūti, I cannot.”

original: smras pa koo shi ka de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa rnams bsrung ba dang / bskyang ba dang / bskyab par gang sems pa de ni bsam pa ltar mi 'grub cing dub pa'i skal ba can du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: smras pa koo shi ka de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa rnams bsrung ba dang / bskyang ba dang / bskyab par gang sems pa de ni bsam pa ltar mi 'grub cing dub pa'i skal ba can du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: Subhūti said, “Kauśika, in the same way, those who think that they can protect, guard, and defend bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom will not succeed in their intention and will become exhausted.”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' don dam par dngos po med pas bsrung zhing bskyab par bya mi nus pa sgyu ma la sogs pa la dpe blangs te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' don dam par dngos po med pas bsrung zhing bskyab par bya mi nus pa sgyu ma la sogs pa la dpe blangs te bstan pa'o //
translated: This passage explains that because bodhisattvas practicing the perfection of wisdom are ultimately not real things, they cannot be protected and guarded. It uses the examples of illusions and so on.

original: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Then, Śatakratu, head of the gods, said to the venerable Subhūti:

original: sprul pa la rlom sems su mi byed pa yin zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: sprul pa la rlom sems su mi byed pa yin zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: “He does not falsely project the emanations.”

original: gong du rmi lam dang sgyu ma la sogs pa smos pa ji tsam gyis chos thams cad sgyu ma la sogs pa dang 'dra bar rtogs par 'gyur ba dang / de ltar chos thams cad sgyu ma la sogs par rtogs nas kyang /
analyzed: gong du rmi lam dang sgyu ma la sogs pa smos pa ji tsam gyis chos thams cad sgyu ma la sogs pa dang 'dra bar rtogs par 'gyur ba dang / de ltar chos thams cad sgyu ma la sogs par rtogs nas kyang /
translated: Up to this point, he has explained dreams, illusions, and so on, and how much one should realize that all phenomena are like illusions and so on, and how, having realized that all phenomena are like illusions and so on,

original: rmi lam dang sgyu ma la sogs pa'i rlom sems su mi 'gyur ba 'khor rnams la zhib tu bstan pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir brgya byin gyis rab 'byor la dris pa'o //
analyzed: rmi lam dang sgyu ma la sogs pa'i rlom sems su mi 'gyur ba 'khor rnams la zhib tu bstan pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir brgya byin gyis rab 'byor la dris pa'o //
translated: he does not falsely project dreams, illusions, and so on. In order to open the section for the assembly, Śatakratu asks Subhūti.

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti said:

original: koo shi ka gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: koo shi ka gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Kauśika, if a bodhisattva mahāsattva, when practicing the perfection of wisdom,

original: gzugs la rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: gzugs la rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: does not falsely project form,

original: gzugs kyis rlom sems @55b su mi byed /🔽gzugs la rlom sems su mi byed na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad don dam par dngos po med par rtogs nas /
analyzed: gzugs kyis rlom sems @55b su mi byed / gzugs la rlom sems su mi byed na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad don dam par dngos po med par rtogs nas /
translated: One should not form mental images of form.🔽One should not form mental images on account of form.🔽The above passage shows that, having realized that all phenomena such as form are ultimately unreal,

original: de dag la rnam par mi rtog cing mtshan mar mi 'dzin na chos thams cad sgyu ma la sogs pa dang 'dra bar rtogs par yang 'gyur la /
analyzed: de dag la rnam par mi rtog cing mtshan mar mi 'dzin na chos thams cad sgyu ma la sogs pa dang 'dra bar rtogs par yang 'gyur la /
translated: one should not form mental images of them or grasp them as signs.

original: de dag gis rlom sems su yang ji ltar mi 'gyur ba bstan pa ste /🔽de la gzugs rlom sems su mi byed ces bya ba ni don dam par gzugs dngos po med par rtogs pas 'di ni gzugs yin no snyam du gzugs la mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing mi sems pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gis rlom sems su yang ji ltar mi 'gyur ba bstan pa ste / de la gzugs rlom sems su mi byed ces bya ba ni don dam par gzugs dngos po med par rtogs pas 'di ni gzugs yin no snyam du gzugs la mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing mi sems pa'o //
translated: One should also not form mental images of them.🔽As to the meaning of the above passage, one should not form mental images of form means that, by realizing that ultimately form is unreal, one does not grasp form as a sign or think that this is form.

original: gzugs kyis rlom sems su mi byed ces bya ba ni gzugs 'dis dngos po 'di lta bu zhig sgrub po snyam du yang mi sems pa la bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyis rlom sems su mi byed ces bya ba ni gzugs 'dis dngos po 'di lta bu zhig sgrub po snyam du yang mi sems pa la bya'o //
translated: One should not form mental images on account of form means that one should not think that this form accomplishes this thing.

original: gzugs la rlom sems su mi byed ces bya ba ni gzugs la phan pa'am /
analyzed: gzugs la rlom sems su mi byed ces bya ba ni gzugs la phan pa'am /
translated: One should not falsely project form.

original: gnod pa 'di lta bu zhig bya'o snyam du yang mi sems pa la bya ste /
analyzed: gnod pa 'di lta bu zhig bya'o snyam du yang mi sems pa la bya ste /
translated: “One does not falsely project form” means that one does not think, “I will help or harm form in such and such a way.”🔽Thus, if one does not falsely project form, one will also not falsely project dreams, etc., because one will understand that they are unreal.

original: de ltar gzugs la rlom sems su mi byed na rmi lam la sogs pa yang dngos po med par rtogs pas rmi lam dang / sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / sgra brnyan dang / mig yor dang / sprul pa rnams la yang rlom sems su mi byed par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar gzugs la rlom sems su mi byed na rmi lam la sogs pa yang dngos po med par rtogs pas rmi lam dang / sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / sgra brnyan dang / mig yor dang / sprul pa rnams la yang rlom sems su mi byed par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: It is taught that one will not falsely project dreams, illusions, mirages, echoes, optical illusions, or magical incarnations.

original: gzugs la ji ltar bshad pa de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos re re la yang rmi lam dang / sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / sgra brnyan dang / mig yor dang / sprul pa rnams dang sbyar te rlom sems su mi 'gyur ba bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs la ji ltar bshad pa de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar gyi chos re re la yang rmi lam dang / sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / sgra brnyan dang / mig yor dang / sprul pa rnams dang sbyar te rlom sems su mi 'gyur ba bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: As it is explained for form, it should be understood that the same is taught for each phenomenon up to the knowledge of all aspects, that one will not falsely project dreams, illusions, mirages, echoes, optical illusions, or magical incarnations.

original: de nas sangs rgyas kyi mthus stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di na /
analyzed: de nas sangs rgyas kyi mthus stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di na /
translated: Then, through the Buddha’s power, in this great billionfold world system,

original: rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha dang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha dang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: the gods of the Catur­mahā­rāja­kāyika realm and so on,

original: steng gi phyogs kyi sangs rgyas stong yi ge 'di dag nyid kyis chos ston pa mtshan 'di dag nyid mnga' ba dge slong rab 'byor ces bya ba sha stag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di nyid dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i le'u 'di nyid zhu ba de na /
analyzed: steng gi phyogs kyi sangs rgyas stong yi ge 'di dag nyid kyis chos ston pa mtshan 'di dag nyid mnga' ba dge slong rab 'byor ces bya ba sha stag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di nyid dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i le'u 'di nyid zhu ba de na /
translated: up to the gods of the Akaniṣṭha realm, and the buddhas in the upward direction, a thousand buddhas who teach the Dharma with these very words and possess these very names, and monks named Subhūti who ask about this very profound perfection of wisdom and this very chapter on the perfection of wisdom,

original: lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i le'u 'di nyid zhu zhing yongs su dri ba sems la snang bar gyur to zhes @56a * //
analyzed: lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i le'u 'di nyid zhu zhing yongs su dri ba sems la snang bar gyur to zhes @56a * //
translated: Śakra, Lord of the Gods, thought, “I will ask about this very chapter on the perfection of wisdom.”

original: bya ba'i bar du ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi lha rnams dang / gzugs kyi khams kyi lha rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la lhag par dad pa bskyed pa'i phyir phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams na yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mang po mtshan sh'a kya thub pa zhes bya ba sha stag shes rab kyi
analyzed: bya ba'i bar du ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi lha rnams dang / gzugs kyi khams kyi lha rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la lhag par dad pa bskyed pa'i phyir phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams na yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mang po mtshan sh'a kya thub pa zhes bya ba sha stag shes rab kyi
translated: In the middle of the activity, in the worlds of the ten directions, many buddhas, bhagavats, all named Shakyamuni, teach this perfection of wisdom in order to generate intense faith in the gods of the desire realm and the gods of the form realm.🔽

original: pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di nyid kyi chos ston pa dang / the tshom zhu zhing rtogs pa yang dge slong rab 'byor ces bya ba sha stag dang / lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis zhu zhing yongs su rtogs pa sha stag bzhugs par de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs dang mthus lha mang po de dag gis mthong bar gyur pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di nyid kyi chos ston pa dang / the tshom zhu zhing rtogs pa yang dge slong rab 'byor ces bya ba sha stag dang / lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis zhu zhing yongs su rtogs pa sha stag bzhugs par de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs dang mthus lha mang po de dag gis mthong bar gyur pa bstan pa'o //
translated: In the middle of the action, many Buddhas, Blessed Ones, all named Shakyamuni, in the worlds of the ten directions, teach this very profound perfection of wisdom, and the one who asks questions and understands is always a monk named Subhuti, and the lord of the gods, Shakra, asks questions and understands. By the power of the Tathagata's blessing, many gods see this.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Then the Lord said to the venerable Subhuti, and so on up to🔽This very perfection of wisdom will be taught and explained.🔽In order to generate special faith in this perfection of wisdom in the assembly, the Lord Shakyamuni alone

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid ston cing 'chad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du yang 'khor rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la lhag par dad pa bskyed pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das sh'a kya thub pa nyag gcig da
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid ston cing 'chad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du yang 'khor rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la lhag par dad pa bskyed pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das sh'a kya thub pa nyag gcig da
translated: taught this perfection of wisdom.

original: ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ston par ma zad kyi /
analyzed: ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ston par ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only did he teach this perfection of wisdom,

analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na yang byams pa byang chub sems dpa' dang bskal pa bzang po 'di la mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par 'gyur ba'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid ston cing 'chad par 'gyur ba bstan
translated: but he also taught that in the future Maitreya Bodhisattva and the Bodhisattvas who will attain complete enlightenment in this fortunate eon will also teach and explain this very perfection of wisdom.

original: pa'o // gsol pa /
analyzed: pa'o // gsol pa /
translated: He said:🔽Subhuti, if you have no doubt or uncertainty about any dharma whatsoever,

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam pa gang dang / rtags gang dang / mtshan ma gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus na /
translated: The Bhagavān said, By what aspects, what signs, what indications?

original: byams pa byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di thabs ji ltar ston pa zhus pa'o //
analyzed: byams pa byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di thabs ji ltar ston pa zhus pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One, by what aspects, what signs, what marks? and so on, Maitreya, the Bodhisattva, asks how this perfection of wisdom will be taught in the future.

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: Having thus been asked, the Blessed One said to the Venerable Subhuti and so on.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na byams pa byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos zab mo 'di thabs ji ltar ston pa bshad pa ste /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na byams pa byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i chos zab mo 'di thabs ji ltar ston pa bshad pa ste /
translated: This explains how Maitreya, the Bodhisattva, will teach this profound Dharma of the perfection of wisdom in the future.

original: don dam par gzugs rang bzhin gyis stong zhing dngos po med par rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag dang / bdag @56b med pa dang / sdug pa dang / mi sdug pa dang /
analyzed: don dam par gzugs rang bzhin gyis stong zhing dngos po med par rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag dang / bdag @56b med pa dang / sdug pa dang / mi sdug pa dang /
translated: Ultimately, form is empty by nature, non-existent, and is not permanent, not impermanent, not blissful, not suffering, not self, not selfless, not attractive, and not unattractive.

original: zhi ba dang / ma zhi ba dang / bcings pa dang / grol ba dang / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba zhes bya bar mi dmigs shing mtshan ma dang bcas par chos mi ston to zhes bshad pa ste /
analyzed: zhi ba dang / ma zhi ba dang / bcings pa dang / grol ba dang / 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba zhes bya bar mi dmigs shing mtshan ma dang bcas par chos mi ston to zhes bshad pa ste /
translated: He does not teach the Dharma with signs, saying, 'This is past, future, or present.'

original: gzugs la ji ltar bshad pa de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du chos thams cad la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs la ji ltar bshad pa de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la thug gi bar du chos thams cad la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Just as it is explained with regard to form, so it is with regard to all phenomena, up to and including the knowledge of all aspects.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas chos ni ji ltar ston par 'gyur ston na ni ci zhig ston par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas chos ni ji ltar ston par 'gyur ston na ni ci zhig ston par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni
translated: He said, “Blessed One, when the bodhisattva mahāsattva Maitreya fully awakens to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, how will he teach the Dharma? What will he teach?”

original: de ltar gong du bshad pa'i tshul du gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong pas de dag la rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs par chos mi ston na thams cad ji ltar ston /
analyzed: de ltar gong du bshad pa'i tshul du gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong pas de dag la rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs par chos mi ston na thams cad ji ltar ston /
translated: As explained above, since all phenomena such as form are ultimately empty of inherent nature, if they are not taught to be permanent, impermanent, and so on, how are they taught?

original: de ltar gzugs la sogs pa rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
analyzed: de ltar gzugs la sogs pa rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
translated: Thus, form and so on are empty of inherent nature.🔽If they do not exist, what is taught?

original: med na ci zhig ston par 'gyur zhes bcom ldan 'das la rab 'byor gyis zhus pa'o //
analyzed: med na ci zhig ston par 'gyur zhes bcom ldan 'das la rab 'byor gyis zhus pa'o //
translated: This is what Subhūti asked the Bhagavān.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽gzugs shin tu rnam par dag go zhes shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos ston par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / gzugs shin tu rnam par dag go zhes shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos ston par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The Bhagavān replied,🔽“Form is extremely pure. I will teach the extremely pure Dharma.”🔽“Omniscience is extremely pure. I will teach the extremely pure Dharma.”

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid shin tu rnam par dag go zhes shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos ston par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid shin tu rnam par dag go zhes shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos ston par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
translated: All phenomena such as form are ultimately empty of inherent nature.

original: cis kyang ma gos ma chags pas shin tu rnam par dag pa'o zhes shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo ston gyi gzugs la sogs pa la dngos po la dngos por dmigs nas rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i mtshan mar 'dzin
analyzed: cis kyang ma gos ma chags pas shin tu rnam par dag pa'o zhes shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don zab mo ston gyi gzugs la sogs pa la dngos po la dngos por dmigs nas rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i mtshan mar 'dzin
translated: It is extremely pure because it is not defiled or attached by anything.

original: cing chos ston pa ni ma yin no zhes bshad pa'o //
analyzed: cing chos ston pa ni ma yin no zhes bshad pa'o //
translated: Thus, it teaches the profound meaning of the perfection of wisdom. It is not that one observes entities such as form and so on as entities and then teaches the Dharma while apprehending the signs of permanence, impermanence, and so on.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni yongs su dag pa'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad shin tu rnam par dag pa yin par bshad na /🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang chos de dag shin tu rnam par dag pa las @57a * //
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni yongs su dag pa'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad shin tu rnam par dag pa yin par bshad na / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang chos de dag shin tu rnam par dag pa las @57a * //
translated: The request, Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom is completely pure is as follows: Having explained that all phenomena such as form and so on are extremely pure,🔽since the perfection of wisdom is also not separate from those phenomena being extremely pure,

original: gud na med pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang yongs su dag pa yin no zhes gsol pa'o //
analyzed: gud na med pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang yongs su dag pa yin no zhes gsol pa'o //
translated: the perfection of wisdom is also completely pure.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽Subhūti, it is so.

original: rab 'byor gzugs yongs su dag pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa'o zhes bya ba nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su dag pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa'o zhes bya ba'i🔽bar du ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzugs yongs su dag pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa'o zhes bya ba nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su dag pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: “Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom is pure because form is pure,” up to “the perfection of wisdom is pure because the knowledge of all aspects is pure.”

original: rab 'byor gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa'o zhes gsol pa'i don de nyid zhib tu bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa'o zhes gsol pa'i don de nyid zhib tu bstan pa ste /
translated: This is a detailed explanation of the meaning of Subhūti’s statement, “The perfection of wisdom is pure.”

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong zhing yongs su dag pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rang bzhin gyis stong zhing yongs su dag pa gnyis yongs su dag par ro gcig cing tha mi dad pas gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad yongs su dag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong zhing yongs su dag pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rang bzhin gyis stong zhing yongs su dag pa gnyis yongs su dag par ro gcig cing tha mi dad pas gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad yongs su dag pa'i phyir /
translated: All phenomena such as form and so on are ultimately pure and empty of inherent nature, and the perfection of wisdom is pure and empty of inherent nature. Since these two are of the same taste and are not different, because all phenomena such as form and so on are pure,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the purity of the perfection of wisdom.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na gzugs yongs su dag pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa lags zhes bya ba nas /🔽ji ltar na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su dag pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa lags zhes bya ba'i bar du ni chos thams cad skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa la sogs pa'i don zhib tu bshad pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir ji ltar na gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad yongs su dag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na gzugs yongs su dag pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa lags zhes bya ba nas / ji ltar na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su dag pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa lags zhes bya ba'i bar du ni chos thams cad skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa la sogs pa'i don zhib tu bshad pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir ji ltar na gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad yongs su dag pa'i phyir /
translated: Subhūti asks, “Blessed One, how is the perfection of wisdom pure due to the purity of form?”🔽Up to, “How is the perfection of wisdom pure due to the purity of the knowledge of all aspects?”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa lags zhes bcom ldan 'das la rab 'byor gyis zhus pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa lags zhes bcom ldan 'das la rab 'byor gyis zhus pa'o //
translated: This is Subhūti’s question to the Blessed One about how the perfection of wisdom is pure due to the purity of all phenomena such as form.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: rab 'byor gzugs la skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa ni gzugs yongs su dag pa'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzugs la skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa ni gzugs yongs su dag pa'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Subhuti, the non-production, non-stopping, non-defiling, and non-purifying of form is the purity of form.🔽The non-production, non-stopping, non-defiling, and non-purifying of the knowledge of all aspects is the purity of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa ni @57b rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su dag pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong pas /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa ni @57b rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su dag pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong pas /
translated: This passage explains that all phenomena, such as form, are ultimately empty of inherent nature.

original: skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa nyid la yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba'i bar du ni dngos po yod pa zhig las skyon nam dri ma dang bral ba'i phyir yongs su dag pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa nyid la yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba'i bar du ni dngos po yod pa zhig las skyon nam dri ma dang bral ba'i phyir yongs su dag pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Up to “non-production, non-cessation, non-affliction, and non-purification” teaches that it is not the case that purification is from the separation of a fault or stain from an existent thing.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang nam mkha' yongs su dag pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa nam mkha' la dpe blangs te bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang nam mkha' yongs su dag pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa nam mkha' la dpe blangs te bstan pa ste /
translated: “Moreover, Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom is purified because space is purified” teaches the purity of the perfection of wisdom by way of an example of space.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' la glo bur gyi sprin dang khug rna la sogs pas bsgribs kyang nam mkha'i rang bzhin yongs su dag pa las ma dag par 'gyur ba med pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' la glo bur gyi sprin dang khug rna la sogs pas bsgribs kyang nam mkha'i rang bzhin yongs su dag pa las ma dag par 'gyur ba med pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as space is not purified from its own nature, which is pure, even though it is obscured by adventitious clouds, mist, and so on,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang kun brtags pa'i chos rnams kyis bsgribs kyang rang bzhin yongs su dag pa las ma dag par 'gyur ba med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang kun brtags pa'i chos rnams kyis bsgribs kyang rang bzhin yongs su dag pa las ma dag par 'gyur ba med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is also obscured by the imagined dharmas, but its nature is completely pure, and it does not become impure.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na nam mkha' yongs su dag pa'i slad du /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na nam mkha' yongs su dag pa'i slad du /
translated: Subhūti said, “Blessed One, how is the perfection of wisdom completely pure because space is completely pure?”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa lags zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la skye ba dang 'gag pa la sogs pa med pa'i don bshad pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir rab 'byor gyis zhus pa'o
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa lags zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la skye ba dang 'gag pa la sogs pa med pa'i don bshad pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir rab 'byor gyis zhus pa'o
translated: This is Subhūti’s question in order to open the section explaining the meaning of the absence of arising, cessation, and so on in space and the perfection of wisdom.

original: // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa'i phyir nam mkha' yongs su dag pa'o zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' la skye ba dang 'gag pa la sogs pa med de yongs su dag pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa'i phyir nam mkha' yongs su dag pa'o zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' la skye ba dang 'gag pa la sogs pa med de yongs su dag pa de bzhin du /
translated: This teaches that just as space is pure because of the absence of production, stopping, etc.,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang skye ba dang 'gag pa la sogs pa med pa'i phyir yongs su dag pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang skye ba dang 'gag pa la sogs pa med pa'i phyir yongs su dag pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: so also the perfection of wisdom is pure because of the absence of production, stopping, etc.🔽Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom is pure because of the non-soiling of space.

original: rab 'byor nam mkha' la 'go ba med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa'o zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' rang bzhin gyis dag pas skyon dang dri ma cis kyang ma gos pa de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu🔽phyin pa @58a * //
analyzed: rab 'byor nam mkha' la 'go ba med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa'o zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' rang bzhin gyis dag pas skyon dang dri ma cis kyang ma gos pa de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa @58a * //
translated: This teaches that just as space is pure by nature and is not soiled by any faults or stains,

original: yang yongs su dag pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yang yongs su dag pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: so also the perfection of wisdom is pure.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na nam mkha' la 'go ba ma mchis pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa lags zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med pa'i don bshad pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir rab 'byor gyis zhus
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na nam mkha' la 'go ba ma mchis pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa lags zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med pa'i don bshad pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir rab 'byor gyis zhus
translated: Subhūti asks, Blessed One, how is the perfection of wisdom pure because of the non-apprehension of space? This is asked by Subhūti in order to open up the topic of explaining the meaning of the absence of apprehended objects and apprehending subjects.

original: pa'o // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: pa'o // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied:

original: rab 'byor nam mkha' gzung du med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa'o zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis med de yongs su dag pa de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa
analyzed: rab 'byor nam mkha' gzung du med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa'o zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis med de yongs su dag pa de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa
translated: Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom is pure because space is ungraspable. This teaches that in space, the apprehended object and apprehending subject do not exist as a duality, and it is pure. Similarly, in the perfection of wisdom,

original: la yang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir yongs su dag pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: la yang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir yongs su dag pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: because the concepts of apprehended object and apprehending subject do not exist, it is pure.

original: rab 'byor nam mkha' la tha snyad med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa'o zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' nyid smra zhing tha snyad 'dogs pa'i rang bzhin yang ma yin la /
analyzed: rab 'byor nam mkha' la tha snyad med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa'o zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' nyid smra zhing tha snyad 'dogs pa'i rang bzhin yang ma yin la /
translated: This is to say, space is not by nature something that speaks and makes conventions,

original: nam mkha' la gzhan gyis brjod cing tha snyad du gdags par bya ba'i rang bzhin yang ma yin te yongs su dag pa de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang rjod par byed pa dang / brjod par bya ba'i tha snyad dang bral ba'i phyir yongs su dag pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' la gzhan gyis brjod cing tha snyad du gdags par bya ba'i rang bzhin yang ma yin te yongs su dag pa de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang rjod par byed pa dang / brjod par bya ba'i tha snyad dang bral ba'i phyir yongs su dag pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: nor is it by nature something that is spoken and conventionally designated by others. Just as it is pure, the perfection of wisdom is also pure because it is free of the conventions of something that speaks and something that is spoken.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na nam mkha' la tha snyad ma mchis pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa lags zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' la tha snyad med pa'i dpe sgra brnyan la blangs te bstan pa'i skabs dbye ba'i
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na nam mkha' la tha snyad ma mchis pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa lags zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' la tha snyad med pa'i dpe sgra brnyan la blangs te bstan pa'i skabs dbye ba'i
translated: Subhūti then asks, “Blessed One, how is the perfection of wisdom pure because space is free of conventions?” This is the question that opens the section on the analogy of an echo, which is used to illustrate the absence of conventions in space.

original: phyir zhus pa'o //
analyzed: phyir zhus pa'o //
translated: The reply.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said:

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this:

original: dper na nam mkha'i sgra brnyan gnyis kyi sgra ltar nam mkha' la tha snyad med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na nam mkha'i sgra brnyan gnyis kyi sgra ltar nam mkha' la tha snyad med pa'i phyir /
translated: Just as the sound of an echo in space is not a convention,🔽so is the perfection of wisdom pure.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa'o zhes bya ba ni mis sgra brjod pa dang / brag ca las sgra 'byung ba gnyis ka yang nam mkha' stong pa la grag mod kyi /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa'o zhes bya ba ni mis sgra brjod pa dang / brag ca las sgra 'byung ba gnyis ka yang nam mkha' stong pa la grag mod kyi /
translated: Although the sound of a man's speech and the sound that arises from an echo are both heard in empty space,

original: 'on kyang nam mkha' ni smra ba'am /
analyzed: 'on kyang nam mkha' ni smra ba'am /
translated: nevertheless, space is not by nature speaking

original: brjod pa'i rang bzhin yang ma yin sgra'i rang bzhin yang ma yin te /
analyzed: brjod pa'i rang bzhin yang ma yin sgra'i rang bzhin yang ma yin te /
translated: or expressing, nor is it by nature sound.

original: yongs su dag pa de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu @58b phyin pa yang kun rdzob tu smra zhing brjod pa tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: yongs su dag pa de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu @58b phyin pa yang kun rdzob tu smra zhing brjod pa tsam du zad kyi /
translated: Just as it is pure, so also the perfection of wisdom is merely spoken of and expressed conventionally.

original: don dam par smra bar byed pa dang / smra bar bya ba gnyis ka'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir yongs su dag pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par smra bar byed pa dang / smra bar bya ba gnyis ka'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir yongs su dag pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Ultimately, it is pure because it is not by nature both that which speaks and that which is spoken.

original: rab 'byor nam mkha' brjod du med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa'o zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' rang bzhin gyis stong pas smra ba'am /🔽brjod pa'i bya ba mi byed pa de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong zhing smra ba'am brjod pa'i bya ba mi byed pa'i phyir yongs su dag pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor nam mkha' brjod du med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa'o zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' rang bzhin gyis stong pas smra ba'am / brjod pa'i bya ba mi byed pa de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong zhing smra ba'am brjod pa'i bya ba mi byed pa'i phyir yongs su dag pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Subhuti: Because space is inexpressible, the perfection of wisdom is pure.🔽Just as space, being empty of intrinsic nature, does not perform the function of speaking or expressing, so the perfection of wisdom, being empty of intrinsic nature in the ultimate sense, does not perform the function of speaking or expressing.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na nam mkha' brjod du ma mchis pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa lags ces bya ba ni brjod du med pa'i phyir yongs su dag pa'i don mdor smos pa de nyid zhib tu bshad pa'i
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das ji ltar na nam mkha' brjod du ma mchis pa'i slad du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa lags ces bya ba ni brjod du med pa'i phyir yongs su dag pa'i don mdor smos pa de nyid zhib tu bshad pa'i
translated: Subhuti: How is it that the perfection of wisdom is pure because space is inexpressible?

original: skabs dbye ba'i phyir zhus pa'o //
analyzed: skabs dbye ba'i phyir zhus pa'o //
translated: This is a request for an exposition of the meaning of purity in terms of inexpressibility, which was mentioned in brief.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

translated: The Lord:

analyzed: rab 'byor nam mkha' la ni gang yang brjod du med do //
translated: Subhūti, in space there is nothing at all to be expressed.🔽Subhūti, similarly, because space is inexpressible, the perfection of wisdom is pure.

original: rab 'byor de bzhin du nam mkha' brjod du med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa'o zhes bya ba'i nam mkha' dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gnyis ka rang bzhin gyis stong zhing brjod par bya ba dang /🔽rjed par byed pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir yongs su dag pa'o zhes bstan pa'o //

analyzed: dmigs par byed pa'i dngos po ma yin pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //

translated: This is the teaching that ultimately, because all phenomena are empty of the nature of nonexistence, there is no turning of the wheel of the Dharma.🔽This perfection of wisdom also does not stand in order to cause any phenomenon to turn or not to turn the wheel of the Dharma.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yang ngo bo nyid kyis stong pas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'am /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yang ngo bo nyid kyis stong pas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'am /
translated: This is the teaching that just as all phenomena are empty of the nature of nonexistence, so too this perfection of wisdom is empty of an intrinsic nature.🔽Therefore, it does not turn the wheel of the Dharma.

original: mi bskor ba'i bya ba gnyis ka yang mi byed do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mi bskor ba'i bya ba gnyis ka yang mi byed do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: neither does it perform the action of turning, nor does it not perform the action of turning.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni chos gang yang 'khor bar bgyi ba'am /🔽mi 'khor bar bgyi ba'i slad du nye bar mi gnas pa'i dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid de gang lags zhes bya ba ni gong du dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'am /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni chos gang yang 'khor bar bgyi ba'am / mi 'khor bar bgyi ba'i slad du nye bar mi gnas pa'i dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid de gang lags zhes bya ba ni gong du dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'am /
translated: Subhūti says, Blessed One, in that way, the perfection of wisdom does not stand as a thing, as a non-thing, as emptiness, as the emptiness of essential nature of non-things, for the sake of turning any dharma,🔽or for the sake of not turning any dharma.

original: mi bskor ba med do zhes mdor smos pa chos gang dang gang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa zhib tu bshad pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir zhus pa'o //
analyzed: mi bskor ba med do zhes mdor smos pa chos gang dang gang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa zhib tu bshad pa'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir zhus pa'o //
translated: This is a request to open up the topic of the detailed explanation of which dharmas are empty of the essential nature of non-things, in the context of the brief statement above that the wheel of dharma is not turned or not turned due to the emptiness of the essential nature of non-things.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas stong pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas stong pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom is empty of the perfection of wisdom, and so on.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba'i bar du ni chos gang dang gang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa yin par bstan pa'o //🔽gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni chen mo ste zhes bya ba nas /🔽de dag gi chos gang yang yongs su mthong ba'am /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba'i bar du ni chos gang dang gang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa yin par bstan pa'o // gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni chen mo ste zhes bya ba nas / de dag gi chos gang yang yongs su mthong ba'am /
translated: From “The knowledge of all aspects is empty of the knowledge of all aspects” up to “The knowledge of all aspects is empty of the knowledge of all aspects” teaches that any phenomenon is empty of the nature of non-entityness.

original: yongs su ma mthong ba ma mchis pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong zhing /
analyzed: yongs su ma mthong ba ma mchis pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong zhing /
translated: The request, “Blessed One, this perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is great” up to “They do not see any phenomenon as existent or nonexistent” teaches that, in this way, the perfection of wisdom is ultimately empty of an intrinsic nature.

original: chos thams cad kyang don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong yang /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyang don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong yang /
translated: Although all phenomena are ultimately empty of an intrinsic nature,

original: kun rdzob tu byang chub sems dpa' rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la brten nas /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu byang chub sems dpa' rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la brten nas /
translated: conventionally, bodhisattvas, in dependence on this perfection of wisdom,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar yang 'gyur la /🔽de ltar mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas na yang don dam par chos gang yang mngon par rdzogs par sangs @62a * //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar yang 'gyur la / de ltar mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas na yang don dam par chos gang yang mngon par rdzogs par sangs @62a * //
translated: and they will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: rgyas pa yang med /🔽kun rdzob tu chos kyi 'khor lo yang bskor la /
analyzed: rgyas pa yang med / kun rdzob tu chos kyi 'khor lo yang bskor la /
translated: And even when they have fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, ultimately there is nothing that is fully awakened to.

original: don dam par chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba yang med /
analyzed: don dam par chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba yang med /
translated: And even when they turn the wheel of the Dharma, ultimately there is no turning of the wheel of the Dharma, and there is no not turning of the wheel of the Dharma.

original: mi bskor ba yang med pa dang / lha'i bu de dag gis chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar mthong ba dang / ma mthong ba gnyis ka yang med par ston pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: mi bskor ba yang med pa dang / lha'i bu de dag gis chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar mthong ba dang / ma mthong ba gnyis ka yang med par ston pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /
translated: And this perfection of wisdom, which teaches that both seeing the turning of the wheel of the Dharma and not seeing it do not exist,🔽is a great perfection because of its great qualities.”

original: de ltar yon tan che ba'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa chen mo'o zhes shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rab 'byor gyis bstod pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar yon tan che ba'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa chen mo'o zhes shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rab 'byor gyis bstod pa'o //
translated: This is Subhūti’s praise of the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: de ni 'di ltar gang 'khor bar bgyi ba'am /🔽mi 'khor bar bgyi ba'am /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar gang 'khor bar bgyi ba'am / mi 'khor bar bgyi ba'am /
translated: It is like this: that phenomenon which would turn the wheel of the Dharma,🔽or which would not turn the wheel of the Dharma,

original: rab tu 'khor bar bgyi ba'i chos de lta bu dmigs su ma mchis te /
analyzed: rab tu 'khor bar bgyi ba'i chos de lta bu dmigs su ma mchis te /
translated: or which would turn the wheel of the Dharma very well, cannot be apprehended.🔽Because all phenomena are utterly unapprehendable.

original: de ni 'di ltar chos thams cad kyang shin tu mngon par ma grub pa'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar gong du bshad pa'i tshul du don dam par chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba la sogs pa med pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar chos thams cad kyang shin tu mngon par ma grub pa'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar gong du bshad pa'i tshul du don dam par chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba la sogs pa med pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation of the reason why, in the ultimate, there is no turning of the wheel of the Dharma, and so forth, in the way that it was explained above.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: stong pa nyid ni 'khor bar bgyid pa'am /🔽mi 'khor bar bgyid pa ma lags so zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni 'khor bar bgyid pa'am / mi 'khor bar bgyid pa ma lags so zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Emptiness does not cause the turning of the wheel of the Dharma,🔽nor does it cause the not turning of the wheel of the Dharma.

original: smon pa ma mchis pa ni 'khor bar bgyid pa'am /
analyzed: smon pa ma mchis pa ni 'khor bar bgyid pa'am /
translated: Up to: wishlessness does not cause the turning of the wheel of the Dharma,🔽nor does it cause the not turning of the wheel of the Dharma.

original: mi 'khor bar bgyid pa ma lags so zhes bya ba'i bar du ni chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / mi bskor ba dmigs su med pa dang / chos thams cad shin tu mngon par ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs su rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum ci yang byed pa ma yin pa bstan pa'o //🔽de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa dang rab tu bstan pa dang zhes bya ba nas /🔽chos bstan pa 'di la gang su yang sbyin pa'i gnas su 'gyur ba ma mchis so zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: mi 'khor bar bgyid pa ma lags so zhes bya ba'i bar du ni chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / mi bskor ba dmigs su med pa dang / chos thams cad shin tu mngon par ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs su rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum ci yang byed pa ma yin pa bstan pa'o // de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa dang rab tu bstan pa dang zhes bya ba nas / chos bstan pa 'di la gang su yang sbyin pa'i gnas su 'gyur ba ma mchis so zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: Up to “it does not cause the wheel of Dharma to be turned, nor does it cause it not to be turned” indicates the non-apprehension of turning and not turning the wheel of Dharma, and the three doors of liberation as reasons for the complete non-establishment of all phenomena.
