original: don dam par chos gang yang bstan pa med pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa yongs su dag pa yin par bshad pa dang / de ltar yongs su dag par bstan pa de la ni don dam par ston cing 'chad pa yang med /
analyzed: don dam par chos gang yang bstan pa med pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa yongs su dag pa yin par bshad pa dang / de ltar yongs su dag par bstan pa de la ni don dam par ston cing 'chad pa yang med /
translated: And in that pure teaching, ultimately there is no teaching or explanation,

original: nyan cing 'dzin pa yang med /
analyzed: nyan cing 'dzin pa yang med /
translated: no listening or grasping,

original: 'bras bu mngon sum du thob pa @62b dang / mngon sum du ma thob pa dang / mya ngan las 'das par gyur pa dang / sbyin pa'i gnas su gyur pa yang med do zhes bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu mngon sum du thob pa @62b dang / mngon sum du ma thob pa dang / mya ngan las 'das par gyur pa dang / sbyin pa'i gnas su gyur pa yang med do zhes bstan pa ste /
translated: no attainment of the result, no non-attainment, no attainment of nirvana, and no one who becomes an object of generosity.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa dang / rab tu bstan pa dang / sgrub pa dang / rab tu bkod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni zhib tu bshad pa'i rnam grangs su zad do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa dang / rab tu bstan pa dang / sgrub pa dang / rab tu bkod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni zhib tu bshad pa'i rnam grangs su zad do //
translated: The terms teaching the perfection of wisdom, thoroughly teaching, practice, establishment and so on are merely different enumerations of the detailed explanation.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum pa rgya cher bshad pa las le'u nyi shu dgu pa'o /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'bum pa rgya cher bshad pa las le'u nyi shu dgu pa'o /
translated: This concludes the twenty-ninth chapter on the perfection of wisdom in the extensive commentary on the perfection of wisdom.

original: // / de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di zab pa'i rnam grangs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: // / de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di zab pa'i rnam grangs bstan pa ste /
translated: The Lord has said:🔽It is a perfection which is not defiled and not purified.🔽The Lord has said:🔽It is a perfection which is not single or manifold.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di lta ste /
translated: The Lord has said:🔽It is a perfection which is not turned towards nor turned away from anything.🔽The Lord has said:🔽It is a perfection which is not great.🔽The Lord has said:🔽It is a perfection which is not a perfection.🔽The Lord has said:🔽It is a perfection which is not taken up.🔽The Lord has said:🔽It is a perfection which is not set up.🔽The Lord has said:

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni don dam par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin yod par ma grub pa'i phyir ma mchis pa'o zhes gsol pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni don dam par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin yod par ma grub pa'i phyir ma mchis pa'o zhes gsol pa'o //
translated: It is a perfection which is not a basis.🔽The Lord has said:🔽It is a perfection which is not a non-basis.🔽The Lord has said:🔽It is a perfection which is not a coming or going.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord has said:🔽It is a perfection which is not something to be known.🔽The Lord has said:🔽It is a perfection which is not a perfection.🔽The Lord has said:🔽It is a perfection which is not a non-perfection.🔽The Lord has said:🔽It is a perfection which is not a perfection and not a non-perfection.🔽The Lord has said:🔽It is a perfection which is not a perfection and not a non-perfection.🔽The Lord has said:🔽It is a perfection which is not a perfection and not a non-perfection.

original: nam mkha' med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rab 'byor gyis bshad pa'i don bcom ldan 'das kyis dpes bkrol te bshad pa ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rab 'byor gyis bshad pa'i don bcom ldan 'das kyis dpes bkrol te bshad pa ste /
translated: The Lord has said:🔽It is a perfection which is not a perfection and not a non-perfection.🔽The Lord has said:🔽It is a perfection which is not a perfection and not a non-perfection.🔽The Lord has said:🔽It is a perfection which is not a perfection and not a non-perfection.🔽The Lord has said:🔽It is a perfection which is not a perfection and not a non-perfection.🔽The Lord has said:

original: ji ltar nam mkha' la dngos po med pa de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la yang /
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' la dngos po med pa de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la yang /
translated: It is a perfection which is not a perfection and not a non-perfection.🔽The Lord has said:🔽It is a perfection which is not a perfection and not a non-perfection.🔽The Lord has said

original: don dam par dngos po med de nam mkha' dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don dam par dngos po med de nam mkha' dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that ultimately there are no entities, like space.

original: mnyam pa nyid kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar gong du bshad pa'i tshul du rang bzhin gyis stong zhing nam mkha' dang 'dra bas che chung dang / mtho dman dang / bzang ngan la sogs pa med pa'i phyir mnyam pa nyid do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar gong du bshad pa'i tshul du rang bzhin gyis stong zhing nam mkha' dang 'dra bas che chung dang / mtho dman dang / bzang ngan la sogs pa med pa'i phyir mnyam pa nyid do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The perfection of sameness: in the above manner, all phenomena are empty by nature and like space, so there is no difference between greater and lesser, high and low, good and bad, and so on.

original: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas pa'i chos thams cad kyang don dam par stong zhing rang bzhin med pas /
analyzed: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas pa'i chos thams cad kyang don dam par stong zhing rang bzhin med pas /
translated: Because all phenomena are the same: all conditioned and unconditioned phenomena are ultimately empty and devoid of intrinsic existence.

original: de bzhin nyid du ro gcig cing mnyam pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du ro gcig cing mnyam pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: They are the same in being of the same taste in suchness.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang de dang 'dra bar mnyam pa nyid yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang de dang 'dra bar mnyam pa nyid yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is also taught to be the same as that.

original: rnam par dben pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i zhes bya ba ni yod pa dang / med pa dang / rtag pa dang chad pa la sogs pa'i mtha' gnyis dang bral bas dben pa @63a * //
analyzed: rnam par dben pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i zhes bya ba ni yod pa dang / med pa dang / rtag pa dang chad pa la sogs pa'i mtha' gnyis dang bral bas dben pa @63a * //
translated: The phrase “perfection of complete isolation” means that it is isolated because it is free from the two extremes of existence and nonexistence, of eternalism and nihilism, and so on.

original: yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation.

original: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rnam par dben pa'i don de nyid 'grel pa ste /
analyzed: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rnam par dben pa'i don de nyid 'grel pa ste /
translated: “Because it is the emptiness of the transcendence of extremes” is the commentary on the meaning of “isolation.”

original: yod med dang rtag chad la sogs pa'i mtha' las 'das shing rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir rnam par dben pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yod med dang rtag chad la sogs pa'i mtha' las 'das shing rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir rnam par dben pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It is isolated because it is free from the extremes of existence and nonexistence, of eternalism and nihilism, and so on, and is empty of intrinsic reality. This is the explanation.

original: thub pa med pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dngos po yod par ma grub pas mu stegs can la sogs pa phas kyi rgol ba rnams kyis glags mi mthong zhing cis kyang mi thub pa yin
analyzed: thub pa med pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dngos po yod par ma grub pas mu stegs can la sogs pa phas kyi rgol ba rnams kyis glags mi mthong zhing cis kyang mi thub pa yin
translated: “The perfection of invincibility” means that because this perfection of wisdom is not established as an existent thing, the adversaries, such as the tīrthikas, do not see an opportunity to attack and cannot defeat it in any way.

original: no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: chos thams cad dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni thub pa med pa'i don 'grel pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni thub pa med pa'i don 'grel pa ste /
translated: Because all phenomena are unobservable. This explains the meaning of “cannot be conquered.”

original: don dam par chos thams cad dngos por dmigs su med pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: don dam par chos thams cad dngos por dmigs su med pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as ultimately all phenomena are unobservable as things,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dmigs su med pa'i phyir thub pa med pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dmigs su med pa'i phyir thub pa med pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: so also the perfection of wisdom is unobservable. Thus it is taught that it cannot be conquered.

original: gnas ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga'i rang bzhin gyi gnas sam rten med pa'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gnas ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga'i rang bzhin gyi gnas sam rten med pa'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The perfection of the absence of a basis. This teaches that it is the absence of a basis or support that has the nature of the five aggregates.

original: ming dang lus med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gnas med pa nyid kyi don 'grel pa ste /
analyzed: ming dang lus med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gnas med pa nyid kyi don 'grel pa ste /
translated: Because it has no name and no body. This explains the meaning of “absence of a basis.”

original: ming ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po bzhi la bya lus ni gzugs kyi phung po la bya ste /
analyzed: ming ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po bzhi la bya lus ni gzugs kyi phung po la bya ste /
translated: Name refers to the four aggregates of feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness. Body refers to the aggregate of form.

original: de ltar ming dang gzugs kyi rang bzhin phung po lnga po med pa la gnas med pa'o zhes bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar ming dang gzugs kyi rang bzhin phung po lnga po med pa la gnas med pa'o zhes bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Thus, the nature of name-and-form, the five aggregates, is said to be “baseless.”🔽The perfection of space is the five aggregates, which are the nature of name-and-form, are said to be “baseless,” because they do not exist.🔽The perfection of space is the five aggregates, which are the nature of name-and-form, are said to be “baseless,” because they do not exist.

original: nam mkha'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar ming dang gzugs kyi rang bzhin gnas zhes bya ba phung po lnga med pas nam mkha' dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de ltar phung po lnga'i rang bzhin ma yin pas dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba med pa'i phyir nam mkha' dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽brjod du ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni ming dang mtshan mar bzung ba'i tha snyad du brjod du med do zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par dpyod pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni brjod du med pa'i don 'grel pa ste /🔽tshig tu brjod do cog ni sems kyis rnam @63b par brtags dpyad nas mtshan mar bzung ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par dpyod pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni brjod du med pa'i don 'grel pa ste / tshig tu brjod do cog ni sems kyis rnam @63b par brtags dpyad nas mtshan mar bzung ste /
translated: This is the commentary on the meaning of “inexpressibility.”🔽All verbal expressions arise from the mind’s conceptualization and analysis, which grasps at signs,

original: ming dang tha snyad du 'dogs shing tshig tu brjod pa las 'byung gi /
analyzed: ming dang tha snyad du 'dogs shing tshig tu brjod pa las 'byung gi /
translated: and then attaches names and designations and expresses them in words.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par dpyod pa med na tshig tu brjod pa yang med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par dpyod pa med na tshig tu brjod pa yang med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: If there were no conceptualization and analysis, there would be no verbal expression.🔽This is the teaching.🔽The perfection of the absence of names.

original: ming ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs med pa'i phung po bzhi med pa'i rang bzhin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ming ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs med pa'i phung po bzhi med pa'i rang bzhin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the teaching on the nature of the absence of the four formless aggregates.🔽Because feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness are non-apprehensible.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ming med pa'i don 'grel pa ste /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ming med pa'i don 'grel pa ste /
translated: This is the commentary on the meaning of “absence of names.”

original: ming zhes bya ba ni gzugs med pa'i phung po bzhi po tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa rnams la bya ste /
analyzed: ming zhes bya ba ni gzugs med pa'i phung po bzhi po tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa rnams la bya ste /
translated: The term “name” refers to the four formless aggregates of feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness.

original: de dag gi rang bzhin ma yin pa la ming med pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dag gi rang bzhin ma yin pa la ming med pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that that which is not their nature is called “namelessness.”

original: mchi ba ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rang bzhin gyis stong zhing mi g-yo bas /
analyzed: mchi ba ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rang bzhin gyis stong zhing mi g-yo bas /
translated: The perfection of non-going is the perfection of wisdom, which is empty of intrinsic nature and unmoving.

original: khams gsum dang 'gro brgyud lnga gang du yang 'gro ba med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: khams gsum dang 'gro brgyud lnga gang du yang 'gro ba med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It is taught that it does not go anywhere in the three realms or the five transmigrations.

original: chos thams cad 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba med pa'i don 'grel pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba med pa'i don 'grel pa ste /
translated: Because all phenomena are non-going. This explains the meaning of non-going.

original: don dam par chos thams cad dngos po med pas khams gsum dang 'gro ba rgyud lnga gang du yang 'gro zhing rgyu ba med pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: don dam par chos thams cad dngos po med pas khams gsum dang 'gro ba rgyud lnga gang du yang 'gro zhing rgyu ba med pa de bzhin du /
translated: Ultimately, since all phenomena are unreal, they do not go or move anywhere in the three realms or the five transmigrations.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dngos po med pas gang du yang 'gro zhing rgyu ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dngos po med pas gang du yang 'gro zhing rgyu ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The perfection of wisdom also has no real basis, so it does not go anywhere or move.

original: mi 'phrogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di rang bzhin gyis stong pas bdud dang mu stegs can la sogs pa lta ba ngan pa can rnams kyis dbrog cing bsgyur du mi nus so zhes bya ba'i
analyzed: mi 'phrogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di rang bzhin gyis stong pas bdud dang mu stegs can la sogs pa lta ba ngan pa can rnams kyis dbrog cing bsgyur du mi nus so zhes bya ba'i
translated: The perfection of wisdom is not to be taken away, because this perfection of wisdom is empty of essential nature, so it cannot be taken away or changed by demons, non-Buddhists, or others who have bad views.

original: don to // chos thams cad bzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mi 'phrogs pa'i don 'grel pa ste /
analyzed: don to // chos thams cad bzung du med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mi 'phrogs pa'i don 'grel pa ste /
translated: The meaning of “not to be taken away” is explained as follows:

original: chos thams cad kyang rang bzhin gyis stong pas ming dang mtshan mar bzung du med pa de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang don dam par ming dang mtshan mar bzung du med pas mi 'phrogs pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyang rang bzhin gyis stong pas ming dang mtshan mar bzung du med pa de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang don dam par ming dang mtshan mar bzung du med pas mi 'phrogs pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Because all phenomena are ungraspable. All phenomena are also empty of essential nature, so they cannot be grasped as names or signs. Just so, the perfection of wisdom is ultimately ungraspable as a name or sign, so it is not to be taken away.

original: skad cig ma ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu @64a * //
analyzed: skad cig ma ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu @64a * //
translated: The perfection of non-momentariness is the perfection of wisdom.

original: phyin pa rang bzhin gyis stong pas skad cig ma'i rgyun la gnas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyin pa rang bzhin gyis stong pas skad cig ma'i rgyun la gnas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that the perfection of wisdom does not abide in a continuum of moments, because it is empty of intrinsic nature.🔽Because all phenomena are purified and exhausted.

original: chos thams cad byang zhing zad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma med pa'i 'grel pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad byang zhing zad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma med pa'i 'grel pa ste /
translated: This is the commentary on the absence of moments.

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong zhing med pa la byang zhing zad pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong zhing med pa la byang zhing zad pa zhes bya ste /
translated: All phenomena are empty and non-existent by nature, and are called purified and exhausted.

original: de ltar stong zhing med pa'i phyir skad cig ma'i rgyun la yang mi gnas so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar stong zhing med pa'i phyir skad cig ma'i rgyun la yang mi gnas so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because they are thus empty and non-existent, they do not abide in a continuum of moments. This is the meaning.🔽The perfection of non-arising is the perfection of wisdom.

original: skye ba ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni don dam par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la dngos po med pas mi skye ba'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skye ba ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni don dam par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la dngos po med pas mi skye ba'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that ultimately, the perfection of wisdom is non-arising by nature, because it is non-existent as an entity.

original: chos thams cad skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni skye ba med pa'i 'grel pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni skye ba med pa'i 'grel pa ste /
translated: Because all phenomena are unborn and unceasing. This is the commentary on the chapter on non-arising.

original: don dam par dngos po med pa ni skye ba dang 'gag pa gnyis ka yang med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang skye ba med pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par dngos po med pa ni skye ba dang 'gag pa gnyis ka yang med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang skye ba med pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Because ultimately, since things are non-existent, both arising and ceasing do not exist, the perfection of wisdom is also non-arising. This is the teaching.

original: byed pa po ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni don dam par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dngos po med pa ci 'ang mi byed pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: byed pa po ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni don dam par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dngos po med pa ci 'ang mi byed pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The perfection of non-action. This is the teaching that ultimately, the perfection of wisdom is non-existent and has the nature of not doing anything at all.

original: byed pa po dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni byed pa po med pa'i 'grel pa ste /
analyzed: byed pa po dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni byed pa po med pa'i 'grel pa ste /
translated: Because the agent is not apprehended. This is the commentary on non-agent.

original: don dam par dngos po yod par ma grub pas byed pa po'i rang bzhin dmigs su med pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yang byed pa po ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don dam par dngos po yod par ma grub pas byed pa po'i rang bzhin dmigs su med pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yang byed pa po ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because ultimately things are not established as existent, the nature of the agent is not apprehended. Therefore, this perfection is also not an agent. This is the meaning.

original: shes pa po ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa po ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The perfection of the non-apprehension of the knower is the perfection of wisdom. This shows that the perfection of wisdom has the nature of non-discrimination.

original: shes pa po dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni don dam par dngos po med pa'i phyir shes pa po rang bzhin ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shes pa po dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni don dam par dngos po med pa'i phyir shes pa po rang bzhin ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because the knower is not apprehended. This means that ultimately the knower is not real, because it is non-existent.

original: 'pho ba ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni don dam par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dngos po med pas 'gro ba'i rgyud gzhan du 'pho ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'pho ba ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni don dam par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dngos po med pas 'gro ba'i rgyud gzhan du 'pho ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The perfection of non-transmigration is the perfection of wisdom. This means that ultimately the perfection of wisdom is non-existent, so there is no transmigration to another life-stream.

original: 'chi ba dang skye ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'pho ba med pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'chi ba dang skye ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'pho ba med pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: Because there is no death and rebirth. This shows the reason for non-transmigration.

original: don dam par dngos po med pa la tshe 'pho ba dang skye ba mi srid pa'i phyir @64b 'pho ba med pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par dngos po med pa la tshe 'pho ba dang skye ba mi srid pa'i phyir @64b 'pho ba med pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Since ultimately there is no entity, there is no transference or rebirth, so it is said to be without transference.

original: 'jig pa ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni don dam par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dngos po yod par ma grub pas /
analyzed: 'jig pa ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni don dam par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dngos po yod par ma grub pas /
translated: The perfection of non-destruction is the ultimate perfection of wisdom, because it is not established as an existent entity.

original: mi 'jig pa'i rang bzhin can no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi 'jig pa'i rang bzhin can no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It has the nature of non-destruction, is the meaning.

original: chos thams cad 'jig pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mi 'jig pa'i 'grel pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad 'jig pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mi 'jig pa'i 'grel pa ste /
translated: Because all phenomena are indestructible, is the commentary on non-destruction.

original: chos thams cad kyang don dam par dngos po med pas stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin de bzhin nyid la 'jig cing gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang 'jig pa med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyang don dam par dngos po med pas stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin de bzhin nyid la 'jig cing gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang 'jig pa med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Because all phenomena are ultimately empty, being without entity, there is no destruction or transformation of the suchness that is the nature of emptiness. In the same way, it is taught that the perfection of wisdom is also without destruction.

original: rmi lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni don dam par dngos po med pa las kun rdzob tu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes ming dang tha snyad du brjod pa ni rmi🔽lam gyi dngos po dang 'dra'o zhes bstan pa'o //🔽rmi lam mthong ba dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rmi lam dang 'dra bar bshad pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: rmi lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni don dam par dngos po med pa las kun rdzob tu shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes ming dang tha snyad du brjod pa ni rmi lam gyi dngos po dang 'dra'o zhes bstan pa'o // rmi lam mthong ba dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rmi lam dang 'dra bar bshad pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: This shows that the perfection of wisdom is a conventional expression, a mere name, for the ultimate non-existence of things, like a dream object.🔽Because the seen object in a dream is not apprehended.🔽This shows the reason for the explanation of the perfection of wisdom as being like a dream.

original: rmi lam du mthong ba'i dngos po rnams yang dag par brtags na dmigs su med pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rmi lam du mthong ba'i dngos po rnams yang dag par brtags na dmigs su med pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that when the objects seen in a dream are examined, they are not apprehended.

original: sgra brnyan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni don dam par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i dngos po med pa las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming du btags shing sgrar brjod pa ni sgra brnyan nam brag ca dang 'dra'o
analyzed: sgra brnyan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni don dam par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i dngos po med pa las shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming du btags shing sgrar brjod pa ni sgra brnyan nam brag ca dang 'dra'o
translated: The perfection of the echo is the ultimate non-entity of the perfection of wisdom, and the name and sound of the perfection of wisdom are like an echo.

original: zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation.

original: nyan pa dang sgrar brjod pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sgra brnyan lta bur bshad pa'i 'grel pa ste /
analyzed: nyan pa dang sgrar brjod pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sgra brnyan lta bur bshad pa'i 'grel pa ste /
translated: Because the listener and the sound are not apprehended. This is the commentary on the explanation of the echo.

original: brag la sogs pa las brag ca'i sgra byung ba sgra yang dag pa ma yin yang sgra bur grag pa bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming dang sgrar brjod pa yang dngos po med pa las sgrar brjod pa tsam du zad do zhes bstan
analyzed: brag la sogs pa las brag ca'i sgra byung ba sgra yang dag pa ma yin yang sgra bur grag pa bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming dang sgrar brjod pa yang dngos po med pa las sgrar brjod pa tsam du zad do zhes bstan
translated: Just as the sound of an echo arises from a rock and so on, and although it is not a real sound, the sound of an echo is heard, likewise, the name and sound of the perfection of wisdom are mere sounds from a non-entity. This is the explanation.

original: pa'o // mig yor gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni don dam par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dngos po med pa las /
analyzed: pa'o // mig yor gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni don dam par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dngos po med pa las /
translated: The perfection of the reflection means that the perfection of wisdom, which is ultimately devoid of substance,

original: yi ge'i 'bru la sogs pa snang ba ni mig yor dang 'dra'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yi ge'i 'bru la sogs pa snang ba ni mig yor dang 'dra'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: is like a reflection in that the appearance of the syllables, etc. is like a reflection.

original: me long gi bzhin dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mig yor dang 'dra bar bshad pa'i 'grel pa ste /🔽me long gi nang na bzhin gyi @65a * //
analyzed: me long gi bzhin dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mig yor dang 'dra bar bshad pa'i 'grel pa ste / me long gi nang na bzhin gyi @65a * //
translated: Because the reflection in the mirror is not perceived. This is the commentary on the explanation of the reflection.

original: gzugs brnyan snang ba mi'i bzhin yang dag par ma yin yang /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan snang ba mi'i bzhin yang dag par ma yin yang /
translated: The reflection of a face appearing in a mirror is not a real face,🔽but it appears as if it were a face.

original: bzhin dang 'dra bar snang ba bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang don dam par yig 'bru'i rang bzhin ma yin pa las kun rdzob tu yi ge'i 'bru lta bur snang ba tsam du zad do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bzhin dang 'dra bar snang ba bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang don dam par yig 'bru'i rang bzhin ma yin pa las kun rdzob tu yi ge'i 'bru lta bur snang ba tsam du zad do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: In the same way, the perfection of wisdom, which is ultimately devoid of the nature of syllables, is merely an appearance as if it were syllables on the conventional level.

original: smig rgyu'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni don dam par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dngos po med pa las /
analyzed: smig rgyu'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni don dam par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dngos po med pa las /
translated: The statement it is the perfection of the mirage means that, ultimately, this perfection of wisdom is unreal,

original: yod pa lta bur snang ba ni 'khrul pa ste /
analyzed: yod pa lta bur snang ba ni 'khrul pa ste /
translated: and that its appearance as real is a mistake.

original: smig rgyu la chu'i rang bzhin med pa las chu 'dra bar snang ba dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: smig rgyu la chu'i rang bzhin med pa las chu 'dra bar snang ba dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is like the mirage, which is unreal as water, but appears to be water.

original: chu 'bab pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni smig rgyur bshad pa'i 'grel pa ste /
analyzed: chu 'bab pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni smig rgyur bshad pa'i 'grel pa ste /
translated: The statement because the flow of water is not perceived is the commentary on the mirage.

original: don dam par chu 'bab pa nyid kyang dngos po med pa yin no //
analyzed: don dam par chu 'bab pa nyid kyang dngos po med pa yin no //
translated: Ultimately, the flow of water itself is unreal.

original: smig rgyu la chu 'bab pa'i rang bzhin med pa lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: smig rgyu la chu 'bab pa'i rang bzhin med pa lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: What need is there to mention the flow of water in a mirage, which is unreal? This is the meaning.

original: sgyu ma'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di don dam par dngos po med pa las yod pa lta bur snang ba ni sgyu ma'i rta dang glang po che la sogs pa rta dang glang po che'i rang
analyzed: sgyu ma'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di don dam par dngos po med pa las yod pa lta bur snang ba ni sgyu ma'i rta dang glang po che la sogs pa rta dang glang po che'i rang
translated: The perfection of illusion is the perfection of wisdom.

original: bzhin ma yin yang rta dang glang po che lta bur snang ba dang 'dra'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bzhin ma yin yang rta dang glang po che lta bur snang ba dang 'dra'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This teaches that this perfection of wisdom, ultimately devoid of entities, appears as if it were existent, like an illusory horse or elephant, which, although not having the nature of a horse or elephant, appears as if it were a horse or elephant.🔽Because the signs are not observed.

original: mtshan ma dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sgyu ma lta bur bshad pa'i 'grel pa ste /🔽sgyu ma mkhan gyis sgyu ma byas pa'i gzhi dang mtshan ma /
analyzed: mtshan ma dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sgyu ma lta bur bshad pa'i 'grel pa ste / sgyu ma mkhan gyis sgyu ma byas pa'i gzhi dang mtshan ma /
translated: This is the commentary on the explanation of illusion.🔽The basis of the illusion created by the magician,

original: rta dang glang po che'i dngos po dang sgyu ma bya ba'i rgyu rkyen /
analyzed: rta dang glang po che'i dngos po dang sgyu ma bya ba'i rgyu rkyen /
translated: the signs of the causes and conditions of the illusion,

original: sman dang sngags la sogs pa'i mtshan ma yang don dam par dmigs su med na de las byung ba'i sgyu ma lta bu dngos po med pa smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sman dang sngags la sogs pa'i mtshan ma yang don dam par dmigs su med na de las byung ba'i sgyu ma lta bu dngos po med pa smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: such as the medicine and mantra, are ultimately not observed. What need is there to mention the illusory things that arise from them? This is the meaning.

original: rmongs pa ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag cing mi shes pa'i sgrib pa med pa'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rmongs pa ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag cing mi shes pa'i sgrib pa med pa'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This shows that the perfection of wisdom is pure by nature and free from the obscuration of ignorance.🔽Because the darkness of ignorance is not apprehended.

original: ma rig pa'i mun pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rmongs pa med pa'i don 'grel pa ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i mun pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rmongs pa med pa'i don 'grel pa ste /
translated: This explains the meaning of non-delusion.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rmongs pa med cing yongs su dag pa de sngon ma rig pa'i sgrib pa yod pa las bsal te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rmongs pa med cing yongs su dag pa de sngon ma rig pa'i sgrib pa yod pa las bsal te /
translated: The perfection of wisdom, which is non-deluded and pure, was previously obscured by the obscuration of ignorance.🔽It is not that it was purified by removing the obscuration of ignorance.

original: yongs su dag pa ni ma yin gyi ma rig pa'i mun pa nyid don dam par dmigs su med pas /
analyzed: yongs su dag pa ni ma yin gyi ma rig pa'i mun pa nyid don dam par dmigs su med pas /
translated: Rather, because the darkness of ignorance itself is ultimately not apprehended,

original: thog ma nas yongs su dag pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thog ma nas yongs su dag pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: it is pure from the beginning. This is the meaning.

original: kun nas nyon mongs @65b pa ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa yongs su dag pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs @65b pa ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa yongs su dag pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The perfection of non-affliction is the perfection of wisdom. This shows that the perfection of wisdom is the purification of the obscuration of afflictions.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di de ltar nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa yongs su dag pa yang sngon nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa las nyon mongs pa spangs te /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di de ltar nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa yongs su dag pa yang sngon nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa las nyon mongs pa spangs te /
translated: Because affliction is not apprehended. This shows that the perfection of wisdom is the purification of the obscuration of affliction, since previously, having abandoned affliction from that which is accompanied by affliction,

original: phyis yongs su dag par gyur pa ni yin gyi /
analyzed: phyis yongs su dag par gyur pa ni yin gyi /
translated: it becomes purified later.

original: nyon mongs pa nyid kyang don dam par dngos po med pas thog ma nas yongs su dag pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa nyid kyang don dam par dngos po med pas thog ma nas yongs su dag pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: But since affliction itself is ultimately unreal, it is primordially pure.

original: rnam par byang ba ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di rang bzhin gyis stong zhing gzod ma nas yongs su dag pa yin pas /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di rang bzhin gyis stong zhing gzod ma nas yongs su dag pa yin pas /
translated: This means that since this perfection of wisdom is empty of intrinsic reality and originally pure,

original: sngon nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa las phyis rnam par byang bar gyur pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sngon nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa las phyis rnam par byang bar gyur pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: it is not the case that it was previously defiled and later became purified.🔽Because of the absence of defilement.

original: nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de ltar rnam par byang ba'i gtan tshigs bshad pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de ltar rnam par byang ba'i gtan tshigs bshad pa ste /
translated: This explains the reason for purification.

original: nyon mongs pa zhig sngon yod na ni de spangs par rnam par byang ba zhes bya na nyon mongs pa nyid kyang rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa zhig sngon yod na ni de spangs par rnam par byang ba zhes bya na nyon mongs pa nyid kyang rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
translated: If defilement existed previously, it would be called purification through the abandonment of that. But defilement itself is empty of intrinsic reality.

original: gzod ma nas dag pa'i phyir rnam par byang ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzod ma nas dag pa'i phyir rnam par byang ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because of original purity, there is no purification. This is the meaning.

original: dmigs su ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di don dam par dngos po yod par ma grub pas dmigs par bya ba dang / dmigs par byed pa'i dngos po ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dmigs su ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di don dam par dngos po yod par ma grub pas dmigs par bya ba dang / dmigs par byed pa'i dngos po ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The perfection of non-apprehension is the perfection of wisdom. This means that this perfection of wisdom is not an entity that can be apprehended, because ultimately it is not established as an existent thing.

original: gnas dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dmigs par bya ba'i gnas sam yul dngos po med pas dmigs su byed par yang med pa'i phyir dmigs su med pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gnas dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dmigs par bya ba'i gnas sam yul dngos po med pas dmigs su byed par yang med pa'i phyir dmigs su med pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Because the basis is non-apprehensible. This shows that it is non-apprehensible because the basis or object that is to be apprehended is not an entity, and therefore there is also no apprehender.

original: spros pa ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa thams cad dang bral ba'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bstan pa'o //

translated: The perfection of non-elaboration is the perfection of wisdom. This shows that this perfection of wisdom has the nature of being free from all conceptual elaborations.

analyzed: spros pa thams cad yang dag par bcom pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de ltar rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa dang bral ba yang /

analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa thams chad gzod ma nas ma skyes par rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'o // rlom sems ma @66a * //

analyzed: mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di rnam par mi rtog pa'i rang bzhin yin pas /

analyzed: rlom sems thams cad yang dag par bcom pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sngon rlom sems dang bcas pa las phyis rlom sems med par gyur pa ni ma yin gyi rlom sems thams cad gzod ma nas ma skyes par rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don
translated: Because all conceit is thoroughly destroyed. This means that it is not the case that one was previously conceited and later became non-conceited, but rather that one realizes that all conceit is primordially unborn.

analyzed: chos thams cad ma nor ba yang dag pa nyid du mngon par 'tshang rgya bar byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad stong pa'i ngo bo nyid du phyin ci ma log par rtogs par byed pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin🔽pas / de'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This shows that the perfection of wisdom is the perfection of the absence of attachment, because it causes the unerring realization that all dharmas have the nature of emptiness.

translated: The afflictions such as desire, etc.,

original: kun nas ldang ba'i rang bzhin can no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas ldang ba'i rang bzhin can no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: are by nature arising.🔽Because all phenomena are non-conceptual.

original: chos thams cad rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni don dam par chos @66b thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pas rnam par rtog pa med pa de bzhin du /

translated: This means that ultimately, all phenomena are empty by nature and non-conceptual.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang rang bzhin gyis stong zhing rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir kun nas ldang ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang rang bzhin gyis stong zhing rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir kun nas ldang ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Likewise, the perfection of wisdom is also empty by nature and non-conceptual, therefore it is without arising.

original: zhi ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhi ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The perfection of peace is the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ltar rnam par mi rtog cing nyon mongs pa kun nas ldang ba med pas zhi ba'i rang bzhin can no zhes bstan pa'o //🔽chos thams cad mtshan ma med cing dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pas /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par mi rtog cing nyon mongs pa kun nas ldang ba med pas zhi ba'i rang bzhin can no zhes bstan pa'o // chos thams cad mtshan ma med cing dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni don dam par chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong pas /
translated: Thus, it is peaceful by nature, because it is non-conceptual and because the reactive emotions do not arise.🔽Because all things are signless and non-apprehensible.🔽The perfection of wisdom is peaceful because ultimately all things are empty by nature,

original: nyon mongs pa rnams skye ba'i mtshan ma dmigs su med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhi ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽'dod chags ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni chags par bya ba'i dngos po med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams skye ba'i mtshan ma dmigs su med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhi ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to // 'dod chags ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni chags par bya ba'i dngos po med pa'i phyir /
translated: and the signs of the arising of the reactive emotions are non-apprehensible.🔽The perfection of non-attachment.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dod chags med pa'i rang bzhin can no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dod chags med pa'i rang bzhin can no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is by nature non-attachment, because there is no thing to be attached to.

original: 'dod chags dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni chags par bya ba'i dngos po med pas chags par byed pa'i 'dod chags kyang dmigs su med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dod chags med pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to
analyzed: 'dod chags dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni chags par bya ba'i dngos po med pas chags par byed pa'i 'dod chags kyang dmigs su med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dod chags med pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to
translated: Because attachment is not apprehended. The meaning is: because the thing to be attached to does not exist, the attachment which is the agent of attachment is also not apprehended. Therefore, the perfection of wisdom is without attachment.

original: // zhe sdang ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag cing skyon med pas zhe sdang med pa'i rang bzhin can no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: // zhe sdang ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag cing skyon med pas zhe sdang med pa'i rang bzhin can no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The perfection of non-hatred. This teaches that the perfection of wisdom is by nature without hatred, because it is completely pure and faultless.

original: zhe sdang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni zhe sdang skye bar 'gyur ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i chos rnams dngos po med pas zhe sdang skye bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: zhe sdang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni zhe sdang skye bar 'gyur ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i chos rnams dngos po med pas zhe sdang skye bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: Because hatred does not exist. The meaning is: because the things which are the causes for the arising of hatred do not exist, hatred does not arise.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhe sdang med pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhe sdang med pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the perfection of wisdom is without hatred.

original: gti mug ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shes bya dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa thams cad yongs su dag pa'i rang bzhin can yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gti mug ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shes bya dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa thams cad yongs su dag pa'i rang bzhin can yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The perfection of non-delusion is the perfection of wisdom, which has the nature of the complete purification of all the obscurations of the knowable and of the afflictions.

original: mi shes pa'i mun pa thams cad sel ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gti mug gi gnyen po yin pa'i phyir gti mug med pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽nyon mongs pa ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu @67a * //
analyzed: mi shes pa'i mun pa thams cad sel ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gti mug gi gnyen po yin pa'i phyir gti mug med pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to // nyon mongs pa ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu @67a * //
translated: Because it removes all the darkness of ignorance is the meaning of the perfection of non-delusion is the perfection of wisdom, because it is the antidote to delusion.🔽The perfection of non-affliction is the perfection of wisdom, which has the nature of non-conceptuality and spontaneity.

original: phyin pa rnam par mi rtog pa lhun gyis grub pa'i rang bzhin yin pas rnam par rtog pa'i nyon mongs pa med pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: phyin pa rnam par mi rtog pa lhun gyis grub pa'i rang bzhin yin pas rnam par rtog pa'i nyon mongs pa med pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It is the perfection of non-affliction because it is free from the affliction of conceptuality.

original: yongs su rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nyon mongs pa yongs su rtogs pa yin no zhes 'byung bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yongs su rtogs pa med pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa med pa'i🔽pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nyon mongs pa yongs su rtogs pa yin no zhes 'byung bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yongs su rtogs pa med pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa med pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is called the perfection of the absence of afflictions because there is no thorough understanding of afflictions in the perfection of wisdom.🔽The perfection of the absence of sentient beings is the perfection of wisdom.

original: sems can ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di rang bzhin gyis stong bas /
analyzed: sems can ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di rang bzhin gyis stong bas /
translated: This perfection of wisdom is empty by nature.

original: mu stegs can gyis brtags pa'i bdag sems can gyi dngos po med pa yin zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mu stegs can gyis brtags pa'i bdag sems can gyi dngos po med pa yin zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It is taught that the self imagined by tīrthikas is not the entity of a sentient being.

original: sems can med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can gyis brtags pa'i bdag sems can zhes bya ba de kun rdzob tu yang yod par ma grub pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: sems can med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can gyis brtags pa'i bdag sems can zhes bya ba de kun rdzob tu yang yod par ma grub pa de bzhin du /
translated: Because there are no sentient beings. The self imagined by tīrthikas is called a sentient being. It is not established as existing even conventionally.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yang don dam par dngos po med pa'i phyir sems can med pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di yang don dam par dngos po med pa'i phyir sems can med pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This perfection of wisdom is also devoid of sentient beings, because ultimately it is a non-entity. This is the meaning.

original: rab tu spangs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po yin pas nyon mongs pa thams cad ma lus par spangs pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu spangs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po yin pas nyon mongs pa thams cad ma lus par spangs pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The perfection of complete relinquishment: it is taught that the perfection of wisdom is the antidote to the afflictions, and so it is by nature the complete relinquishment of all the afflictions without exception.

original: chos thams cad kun nas ldang ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa kun nas ldang ba rnams dngos po yod pa las gnyen po bsgoms pas spangs te med par gyur pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: chos thams cad kun nas ldang ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa kun nas ldang ba rnams dngos po yod pa las gnyen po bsgoms pas spangs te med par gyur pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Because all phenomena are devoid of the arising of afflictions: the arising of the afflictions is not something that is eliminated by the cultivation of antidotes and becomes non-existent due to the existence of a thing.

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
translated: All phenomena are empty by nature.

original: kun nas ldang zhing 'byung ba med par rtogs pa nyid rab tu spangs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: kun nas ldang zhing 'byung ba med par rtogs pa nyid rab tu spangs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The realization that they are devoid of the arising of afflictions is itself complete relinquishment. This is the meaning.

original: mtha' gnyis su mi 'gyur ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i rang bzhin yin pas /
analyzed: mtha' gnyis su mi 'gyur ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par mi rtog pa'i rang bzhin yin pas /
translated: The perfection of non-relapse is the perfection of wisdom, because it is the nature of non-discrimination.

original: yod pa dang / med pa dang / rtag pa dang / chad pa la sogs pa'i mtha' gnyis su rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ba'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yod pa dang / med pa dang / rtag pa dang / chad pa la sogs pa'i mtha' gnyis su rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ba'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It is taught that it does not lapse into the two extremes of existence and non-existence, eternalism and nihilism, etc.

original: mtha' rnam par spong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa nyid mtha' gnyis rnam par spongs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir mtha' gnyis su mi 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mtha' rnam par spong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa nyid mtha' gnyis rnam par spongs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir mtha' gnyis su mi 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because it abandons the extremes, it is taught that it does not lapse into the two extremes because non-discrimination is the nature of the abandonment of the two extremes.

original: tha mi dad pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni @67b shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin yin pas chos kyi dbyings dang tha mi dad pa'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni @67b shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin yin pas chos kyi dbyings dang tha mi dad pa'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The perfection of non-differentiation is the perfection of wisdom, because it is the nature of thusness, it is non-differentiated from the dharma-dhātu.

original: chos thams cad 'dres pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dngos po zhig yod na 'dres pa dang ma 'dres pa tha dad du gyur pa zhes byar yang rung na /
analyzed: chos thams cad 'dres pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dngos po zhig yod na 'dres pa dang ma 'dres pa tha dad du gyur pa zhes byar yang rung na /
translated: If there were any entity, then differentiation and non-differentiation would be possible.

original: chos thams cad dngos po med pas 'dres pa dang ma 'dres pa yang med pa'i phyir tha dad du gyur pa yang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos thams cad dngos po med pas 'dres pa dang ma 'dres pa yang med pa'i phyir tha dad du gyur pa yang med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: But because all phenomena are non-entities, there is no differentiation or non-differentiation, and so there is no difference. This is the meaning.

original: nyams pa ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa skyon dang dri ma thams cad dang bral ba yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nyams pa ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa skyon dang dri ma thams cad dang bral ba yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The perfection of non-deficiency is the perfection of wisdom, because it is free from all faults and stains.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las 'da' bar byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen pa'i skyon dang dri ma ni theg pa dman pa las 'das pa yin te /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las 'da' bar byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen pa'i skyon dang dri ma ni theg pa dman pa las 'das pa yin te /
translated: Because it transcends the levels of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas. The faults and stains of the Great Vehicle are the lower vehicles.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa dman pa las 'das pa nyid ma nyams shing skyon dang bral ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa dman pa las 'das pa nyid ma nyams shing skyon dang bral ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is the transcendence of the inferior stage of the Disciples and the Rhinoceros-like Solitary Sages.

original: rnam par rtog pa ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di rnam par mi rtog pa lhun gyis grub pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di rnam par mi rtog pa lhun gyis grub pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The perfection of non-discrimination is the perfection of wisdom, because it is non-discriminative and spontaneous.

original: rnam par rtog pa thams cad dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni don dam par rnam par rtog pa nyid kyang dmigs su med pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa thams cad dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni don dam par rnam par rtog pa nyid kyang dmigs su med pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because all discriminations are unapprehendable. In the ultimate sense, even discrimination is unapprehendable.

original: tshad ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di don dam par dngos po med pas tshad mas brtag cing gzhal du med do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: tshad ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di don dam par dngos po med pas tshad mas brtag cing gzhal du med do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The perfection of the immeasurable is the perfection of wisdom, because it is immeasurable in the ultimate sense.

original: chos thams cad kyi tshad dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyang rang bzhin gyis stong pas tshad mas gzhal du med pa de bzhin du tshad mas gzhal du med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi tshad dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyang rang bzhin gyis stong pas tshad mas gzhal du med pa de bzhin du tshad mas gzhal du med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that just as all phenomena are immeasurable by a measure because they are empty of intrinsic nature, in the same way, the perfection of wisdom is immeasurable by a measure.🔽The perfection of space.

original: nam mkha'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di don dam par dngos po med de /
analyzed: nam mkha'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di don dam par dngos po med de /
translated: This shows that this perfection of wisdom is ultimately non-existent,

original: nam mkha' dang 'dar bar ci la yang ma thogs ma chags pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang 'dar bar ci la yang ma thogs ma chags pa yin no zhes bstan pa'o /
translated: like space, unobstructed and unattached to anything.🔽Because all phenomena are unattached.

original: chos thams cad la chags pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyang don dam par dngos po med pas /
analyzed: chos thams cad la chags pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad kyang don dam par dngos po med pas /
translated: This means that just as all phenomena are like space, ultimately non-existent,

original: nam mkha' dang 'dra ba ci la yang ma thogs ma chags pa de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin @68a * //🔽pa yang nam mkha' dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang 'dra ba ci la yang ma thogs ma chags pa de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin @68a * //🔽pa yang nam mkha' dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: unobstructed and unattached to anything, in the same way, the perfection of wisdom is also like space.

original: mi rtag pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The perfection of impermanence.🔽It is not impermanent in the sense that a thing that has arisen or exists is destroyed, as it is for the adherents of the Lesser Vehicle.

original: theg pa chung ngu ba'i mi rtag pa ltar dngos po skyes pa'am yod pa las 'jig pa'i phyir mi rtag pa ni ma yin gyi don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong zhing dngos po med de ri bong gi rva la sogs pa bzhin du rtag tu yod pa
analyzed: theg pa chung ngu ba'i mi rtag pa ltar dngos po skyes pa'am yod pa las 'jig pa'i phyir mi rtag pa ni ma yin gyi don dam par rang bzhin gyis stong zhing dngos po med de ri bong gi rva la sogs pa bzhin du rtag tu yod pa
translated: It is said to be impermanent in the sense that it is ultimately empty of intrinsic reality and non-existent like the horn of an ass, etc.,

original: ma yin pa la mi rtag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma yin pa la mi rtag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and never exists.🔽Because all things are indestructible.

original: chos thams cad 'jig pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de ltar rang bzhin gyis stong zhing rtag tu yod pa ma yin pa de la 'jig pa yang mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos thams cad 'jig pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de ltar rang bzhin gyis stong zhing rtag tu yod pa ma yin pa de la 'jig pa yang mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that since it is empty of intrinsic reality and never exists, its destruction is also impossible.🔽The perfection of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin yin pas /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin yin pas /
translated: Since this perfection of wisdom has the nature of non-existence,

original: de la spyad na bde ba'i 'du shes med pa'i phyir sdug bsngal zhes bya'i /
analyzed: de la spyad na bde ba'i 'du shes med pa'i phyir sdug bsngal zhes bya'i /
translated: it is said to be suffering because there is no perception of pleasure when practicing it.

original: mi bde ba dang ldan pa'i phyir sdug bsngal ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mi bde ba dang ldan pa'i phyir sdug bsngal ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not suffering because it is associated with discomfort.🔽Because there is no application in the search for all phenomena.

original: chos thams cad tshol bar sbyor ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dngos po zhig yod na de thob pas bde ba thob par bya ba'i phyir tshol zhing sbyor ba yang srid na /
analyzed: chos thams cad tshol bar sbyor ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dngos po zhig yod na de thob pas bde ba thob par bya ba'i phyir tshol zhing sbyor ba yang srid na /
translated: If there were an entity, it would be possible to search for it and apply oneself to it in order to attain happiness by attaining it.

original: chos thams cad dngos po med de dngos po med pa la bde ba thob par bya ba'i phyir tshor ba dang sbyor ba yang med de /
analyzed: chos thams cad dngos po med de dngos po med pa la bde ba thob par bya ba'i phyir tshor ba dang sbyor ba yang med de /
translated: But all phenomena are not entities, and there is no application in the search for them in order to attain happiness, since they are not entities.

original: de ltar bde ba med pa la sdug bsngal zhes brdar btags te bshad pa yin gyi sdug bsngal nyid dang ldan pa la ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bde ba med pa la sdug bsngal zhes brdar btags te bshad pa yin gyi sdug bsngal nyid dang ldan pa la ni mi bya'o //
translated: Thus, since there is no happiness, it is designated and explained as suffering, but it should not be taken as actually being suffering.🔽The perfection of non-self.

original: bdag ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa don dam par ngo bo nyid kyis stong pas /
analyzed: bdag ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa don dam par ngo bo nyid kyis stong pas /
translated: This shows that the perfection of wisdom is ultimately empty of intrinsic nature,

original: de'i bdag nyid dam rang bzhin yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid dam rang bzhin yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: and that its essence or nature does not exist.

original: chos thams cad la mngon par chags pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad de ltar rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad la mngon par chags pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad de ltar rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
translated: Because there is no attachment to any dharma. This means that all dharmas are empty of intrinsic nature in that way.

original: bdag med pas mngon par chags par bya ba'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir bdag med pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽stong pa nyid kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid kun rdzob tu ji skad du brtags shing rnam par gzhag pa de dang bral ba'i phyir stong pa nyid do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bdag med pas mngon par chags par bya ba'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir bdag med pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to // stong pa nyid kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid kun rdzob tu ji skad du brtags shing rnam par gzhag pa de dang bral ba'i phyir stong pa nyid do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Because they are selfless, they are not objects of attachment. This is the meaning of “selfless.”🔽The perfection of emptiness is the emptiness of the perfection of wisdom. This teaches that the perfection of wisdom is empty because it is devoid of the characteristics that are its nature, which are imagined and posited conventionally in that way.

original: chos thams cad dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad kyi so so'i @68b mtshan nyid ji skad du brtags shing rnam par gzhag pa de dag gis stong zhing dmigs su med pa de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha
analyzed: chos thams cad dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad kyi so so'i @68b mtshan nyid ji skad du brtags shing rnam par gzhag pa de dag gis stong zhing dmigs su med pa de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha
translated: Because all dharmas are unapprehendable. This means that just as all dharmas such as form are empty and unapprehendable by the individual characteristics that are imagined and posited in that way, the perfection of wisdom is also empty and unapprehendable by the characteristics that are imagined and posited in that way.

original: rol tu phyin pa yang rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rol tu phyin pa yang rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The perfection is also empty of its own intrinsic nature.

original: mtshan nyid ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid rang bzhin gyis stong bas /
analyzed: mtshan nyid ma mchis pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid rang bzhin gyis stong bas /
translated: The perfection of the absence of defining characteristics is the perfection of wisdom itself, which is empty of intrinsic nature.

original: de'i mtshan nyid kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It is taught that its defining characteristic also does not exist.

original: chos thams cad mngon par grub pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad mngon par grub pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because all phenomena are non-arisen.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad ma skyes shing mngon par grub pa med pa'i phyir so so'i mtshan nyid kyang yod pa ma yin pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i chos thams cad ma skyes shing mngon par grub pa med pa'i phyir so so'i mtshan nyid kyang yod pa ma yin pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because all phenomena such as form are non-arisen and do not come into existence, their individual defining characteristics also do not exist. This is the meaning.

original: nang stong pa nyid kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba nas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba nas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: The perfection of inner emptiness, up to the perfection of the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence, is the perfection of wisdom itself, which is empty of intrinsic nature.🔽It is taught that its defining characteristic also does not exist.

original: stong pa nyid bcva brgyad dang sbyar te de dag gi dngos po yang yod pa ma yin pa'i sgo nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di zab pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid bcva brgyad dang sbyar te de dag gi dngos po yang yod pa ma yin pa'i sgo nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di zab pa bstan pa ste /
translated: This is the teaching of the profound perfection of wisdom through the door of the non-existence of the entities of those [thirty-seven factors of enlightenment].

original: stong pa nyid bcva brgyad kyi mtshan nyid ni sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: stong pa nyid bcva brgyad kyi mtshan nyid ni sngar bshad zin to //
translated: The characteristics of the eighteen emptinesses have already been explained.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The perfection of the applications of mindfulness, up to

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar du ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang /
translated: the perfection of the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, the three doors of liberation, the eight liberations,

original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad rnams don dam par dmigs su med pa'i rang bzhin nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin par bstan pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bcva brgyad rnams don dam par dmigs su med pa'i rang bzhin nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin par bstan pa'i sgo nas /
translated: The nine serial absorptions, the six perfections, the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are the perfection of wisdom, because of the teaching that the ultimate non-apprehendable nature is the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni zab pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni zab pa bstan pa'o //
translated: This perfection of wisdom is the teaching of the profound.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin dang tha mi dad do zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin dang tha mi dad do zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: The perfection of the Tathagata is the teaching that it is not different from the nature of the Tathagata.

original: brjod pa thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa ste /
analyzed: brjod pa thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa ste /
translated: Because of the suchness of all expressions is the teaching of the nature of the Tathagata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni gsungs so @69a * //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni gsungs so @69a * //
translated: The Tathagata is the one who speaks.

original: cog ma nor ba de bzhin nyid gsung gi gzhan du mi gsung ba de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las chos ci bshad do cog kyang de bzhin nyid du brjod cing bshad kyi gzhan du brjod pa dang bshad pa med do zhes
analyzed: cog ma nor ba de bzhin nyid gsung gi gzhan du mi gsung ba de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las chos ci bshad do cog kyang de bzhin nyid du brjod cing bshad kyi gzhan du brjod pa dang bshad pa med do zhes
translated: Just as the Buddha does not teach anything other than the unmistaken suchness, in the same way, whatever Dharma is explained in this perfection of wisdom is expressed and explained as suchness, but there is no expression or explanation of anything else.

original: bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.
